hike_name:
Taft Point and The Fissures - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'rocky', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Taft Point and The Fissures is a 2.3 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Mariposa, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from March until October. Horses are also able to use this trail.

user_texts:
["Incredible hike! I would do this again although I wouldn't try to be daring due to the recent death that was on the news about the Indian couple Vishnu Viswanath and Meenakshi Moorthy in October 2018. Thinking back, I even walked down inside a fissure that seemed to have solid grounding underneath between the rocks but I would not attempt that again. This place is so remarkable, you can spend hours taking photos.", "This is a nice little hike from the road, I did this one first after driving 4+ hours to Yosemite and it was good way to start great weekend.  I't just slightly more than a mile each way, so carry a bottle of water with you.  It is really neither an up hill or a down hill trail either, nor is flat.  It's small section going slightly up or down till you get close to edge, then the last 300+ feet of the trail is downhill till you get Point.  Most of the fissures are to the east (right hand side), so take a little time to view these before making your way out to the point.  At the point, you will find 2 over looks, one on the east with some old guard rails, and one to the west without guard rails (where the couple fell off a week or two ago).  If you're doing this as group, have someone stay at the guard rail overlook with a camera, while your friends visit the other overlook, you'll get great photos here.  Take turns too so everyone get's a photo on the west overlook. Of course, don't fall off and ruin your weekend.

The trail back starts off as uphill, but then is just slight up and downs till you're back at the road.  While you won't find water here, you will find a set of porta pottys if you need to go.", 'The hike is easy enough and the views are amazing, just stay away from the edge!', 'Easy hike and view was amazing!', "1 star just so that you notice; views are breath taking and the hike is easy. It's a 5 star hike.But, I lost 2 of my friends from the edge of the cliff Oct, 2018 - there are no giard rails at the edge and it gets very windy. Please be careful up there guys!", 'awesome views, easy hike', "Awesome and my personal favorite after my friend showed it to me. Better for those trying to get away from the crowds. Descends off the road to the cliff's edge. There are about 5 different bluffs all with views of the canyon. No railing so be careful but it gives you a great sense of scope of the park. Pretty shady until you get to the cliff's edge and a decently moderate gain on your way back.", 'Not for those with a fear of heights. Awesome views of the valley but I couldn’t bring myself to get close enough to the edges to really get a good view. There is one railing and the point is very large. Trail is pretty easy up until the very end where the elevation change is a little rough going back once you’re finished. Will definitely do again, I’m thinking for sunrise!', "If you want one of the best views of the park and to hike one of the most accessible trails, take this hike. The view is absolutely amazing. If you want/can handle a bit more of a challenge, Sentinel Dome is my recommendation, but standing at the edge of a cliff and beholding the fissures of the valley is simply breathtaking. Both Sentinel and Taft make for excellent sunset destinations, the former of which I can personally attest to. If you do one hike on a day trip, this should be it. There's no reason not to. Make it your last activity of the day and the sunset will be the perfect bookend to your visit.", "Really great view of El Capitan's dawn wall as well as the fissures. A very nice easy 2 mile hike. Easy to do this one with children or people who can hike very easily.", 'This is a super easy to follow trail, leads you directly to Taft Point and is clearly marked the entire way. Be prepared to be winded if you’re not used to the elevation.', 'If there’s one place to go in Yosemite this is it!! Not for the ones afraid of heights as there are no railings and the edge is 4000’ straight down! Most breathtaking place in my opinion!!', 'The best trail in the entire park with incredible views especially at sunset. A quieter place in Yosemite as well if you arrive early or later in the day. Hoping it stays that way! After a long day though, the hike is a little tiring on the way back because of the incline. Still my favorite hike. Would do it over and over again.', 'Easy hike with big payoff of views. Great view of El Capitan.', 'Love this hike! Beautiful view! Bit of a rush to stand near the edge!', 'This may be a short hike, but bring water!', 'Great hike! Not too bad, not much of an incline. Took us 45 mins - 50 mins to get to the edge. Amazing view of the valley and El Capitan! Don’t forget to take a picture to that other edge of the point. Also, be aware and be prepared for mosquitoes along the hike.. Have off lotion/spray handy with you. Wear windbreakers or layered clothing.', 'Great little hike we did with our almost 2 year old. He walked the first 3/4 of a mile and we loaded him into a child carrier backpack for the remainder, mostly because he was tired but also because the fissures posed a risk for his fast, wandering legs and because at that point the trail became steeper and rocky for a short time. The view though was spectacular.', 'Great trail. Fissures are awesome. Very rewarding views at the end. Lots of mosquitoes early today. Bring bug spray.', 'Hiked up for sunset and it was highlight of our trip.', "It's a nice and easy way to get a good view of the valley. Personnally, I think a lot of view point on this side of the valley are similar, so just do one. Taft might be the easiest. You should probably combine with doing sentinel dome (even if it is a bit dissappointing), the whole loop and finishing/starting at glacier point", 'Easy hike with huge payoff. I proposed to my now fiancé here with beautiful El Capitan and Yosemite falls in view. Damp ground from snow melt in late April made the trail difficult/fun to navigate. A great oppurtunity to see Yosemite from above the valley floor.', 'Nice easy hike, pretty views from the point.', 'Great view of El Capitan', 'Nice short little, easy hike- the ending is fairly amazing, getting to see the fissures and the dropoff at taft point make the hike!', 'Really easy, shorter hike. Hiked in October and were the only ones on the trail!', 'This is an amazingly wonderful hike. Has great views and a fairly easy/moderate skill level. Shady trees in most spots.', 'We did this hike yesterday. Nervous that it might be too icy/ snowy at this time of year but it was a lovely hike. We hiked up the 4 miles trail & came down this trail. Spectacular day in Yosemite.', 'Beautiful views, but holy anxiety attack!  If you have a fear of heights, skip this trail.  I did a quick peek at the overlook and had to take off. The drop off was crazy!', 'Great walk, tie it up with Sentinal dome', 'Cool place!!', 'Excellent views. My 10 year old daughter did it with no problem.', 'Great views and nice, easy hike through the woods', 'This was a really quick and beautiful spot to enjoy the view of the valley. It was not wheel chair or stroller friendly. And, the mosquitoes were killer during the late afternoon. But overall, we really enjoyed the leisurely one mile walk up and one mile back down. I, especially, thought going closer to sunset was worth it and it was a great way to end the day.', 'Great trail. Beautiful scenery! Easy!', 'Basic words of caution: Keep the younger and/or inexperienced hikers under control at Taft Point. The fissures could easily swallow a mis-behaving or rambunctious child.  Because of this danger factor, along with the rather steep climb back out, I would consider this hike "moderate" and not "easy" as is claimed by All Trails...  Also, this is a terrific hike when combined with Sentinel Dome via the Pohono Trail along the north rim of Yosemite Valley.  This loop pushes the hike well over 5 miles and adds a couple thousand up-and-down vertical feet.  The views from Sentinel Dome, Taft Point, and all along the Pohono Trail are second to none.  Consider this a must-do if you have a couple days in Yosemite.  Technically the hike is easy, but the altitude, climbing, and 2000 foot cliff will get your attention.  Pohono is basically empty between these two destinations, but you will probably have some company on both ends of your journey.', 'Great vies usually but we were dealing with a ton of smoke from the fires.  Still an amazing hike - highly recomend', "Nice hike to start your stay in the park or on your last day if you legs are worn out. The trail is flat and takes you through a nice wooded area. At the end it opens up to a large rock service to view some of the valley. Great place to spend some time looking at the different view points. We took the trail that follows the cliff edge to Sentinel Dome instead of going back to the parking area and starting the Sentinel Done trail. Great trail but it isn't well marked. After you cross the creek you turn right to stay on the trail. It looks like there is a trail to the left but it's not the actual trail.", 'Downhill on the way there, a bit more of uphill walking on the way back. I love to go here for the view of El Cap... seriously such a cool place to look at el cap from. From Taft you can also see Yosemite falls and a huge drop of 3,000 feet below you. Show extreme caution around the cliff edges!!', 'Easy and beautiful hike. We went late in the day when parking was easy and there were hardly any people at the point. Beautiful views and nice trees along the way.', 'We started this trail at 7am & there were 5 parked cars already. By the time we finished our hike around 9:30am, the parking lot was full. The trail starts as a decline with an incline all the way back up. It goes through shaded areas with a beautiful scenery all the way to Taft point. I gave this trail a 4 star because its filled of mud and MOSQUITOES! HUGE MOSQUITOES. Bug spray did not work. I suggest going early to take it all in without the crowd. Unbelievably gorgeous! Highlight of my trip.', 'Fun hike , not too hard. Did it with Sentinel Dome.', 'BEAUTIFUL hike. Amazing views at the end, and a very pleasant trail to get there. Fun to combine with Sentinel Dome as well.', 'Trail closed due to snow 30 May 17, so hiked Sentinel instead. Looking forward to a chance to hike in the future.', 'So good!!', 'Fun, easy trail with stunning views.', "This is more like a pleasant stroll than a hike. But the scenery is beautiful and the payoff at the end is amazing. The views are stunning, and If you have the courage to lay on your stomach and look down over the over hang, to the straight drop below 1000+ ft, it's chilling and definitely worth it.", "I love this trail! it's so beautiful and not to long. It gives you time to do other things in the valley!", "Awesome! Words can't adequately describe the view. Must see for yourself.", "One of my favorite hikes! If you're feeling daring you can go out onto Taft Point or look over the cliffs to the bottom of the valley. Easy hike, even for people with knee injuries, but it can be rocky in some places. Amazing overlook of Yosemite Valley, I highly recommend this hike!", "Breathtaking views of Yosemite Valley. The hike is fairly easy. Even for someone that isn't in shape.", 'Great escape from the Yosemite Valley crowds. Beautiful 1000 foot cliffs.', 'Grate views', 'Arrived at trailhead fairly early, approximately 7:00 AM or shortly thereafter, on the way to the Point we encountered only one group coming back the other direction and no one coming up behind us along the trail.  The majority of the trail takes you through well shaded forest with little to no elevation gain, shortly before you reach Taft Point you will go down a short series of switchbacks, the trail will then become rocky for a short time before again becoming uniform.
The views from Taft Point are fantastic; you can see most of the Valley Floor below you, as well as views of Yosemite Falls and the North Rim.  There is a single small railed area approximately 8x4 feet; the rest is completely exposed so if you are afraid of heights you may want to confine yourself to the railed area!
The hike to the Point is easy, but the hike back out is not quite as easy, the rocky portion of the trail as well as the switchbacks are probably easy for people who are in great shape, but if you are out of shape and on the larger side like I am, this part will prove to be somewhat of a challenge, though not one that feels insurmountable.  
This is definitely a fantastic hike for beginners and experts alike as the views from the Point are well worth the hike, regardless of your skill level!', 'Best to combine this hike and make it a loop to include Sentinel Dome.  Total was about 5.5 miles.', 'This is a very nice trail.  I have taken it before but this time I had the opportunity to take it with children and granndkids.  We all enjoyed it very much.  I asked my oldest grandson (college age) what he liked most about this trip and he selected this and sentinel dome as the high points of our trip.   This is high praise and he has been on many hikes in Rocky mountain and Zion national parks.', 'Great little hike.  Saw some deer on the hike out and a great view at the end. combined this with sentinel dome via the pohono trail', 'This was amazing. Totally underrated. The views were stunning. The point it awesome, really more so to see as you approach. The Fissures were really cool. We combined with Sentinel Dome, taking the trail that goes closest to the cliff. The view at the halfway point was the best of the hike. Oh, and our 5 year old and 2 year old did awesome.', 'hidden gem.  took trail from taft to sentinel dome. well worth it. went on to glacier point. ehhhh crowded and a bit wider view but the peace and tranquility of taft and the trail to sentinel dome is where Yosemite is at her best.', 'This trail is easy, but not when covered in snow. Following footprints just gets you lost. We turned this hike into a big ordeal, but it was worth it when we finally made it to Taft point. We just did a little extra work for some awesome views, worth it!!! We took the correct trail on the way back and it seriously only took ten minutes ', 'This hike is much more challenging when the trail is covered in snow. As others have mentioned, the views are awesome.', 'Short easy hike with huge payoff! Beautiful views. I even stumbled upon some high liners traversing a gap at the top. It made it even more amazing. Do this and sentinel dome for the ultimate array of views.', 'Super beautiful scenery.  Easy hike.', "This hike offers phenomenal views for relatively minor hiking. We took the trail from the parking lot and the hike was an easy downhill stroll. The views at the end of the trail are nothing short of spectacular. I've never seen a place that has such pure vertical drops of that height. The last step-up before reaching the little rail section reveals a panoramic view of the valley with a great view of El Cap. The only thing it does not offer is a view of Half Dome, but you can get that from Sentinel Dome or Glacier Point. If you have the nerve, take a look over the rail. It almost made me feel paralyzed; stunning.

This was one of our favorite places in Yosemite and we only came across 10 other hikers, much less congested than the Valley trails. On the way back, we opted to yield to the left and took the Pohono trail to Sentinel Dome for sunset. More and more awesome views. Highly recommended.", "It was a great, simple hike. Ended my day at Taft Point. It's a great place for views of the West Valley. Looking forward to doing it again soon.", 'Easy hike, great views', 'Wow! My favorite hike in Yosemite.', "Taft Point is a very easy and short hike with dramatic views at the end. It is family friendly but there are no guard rails (unlike Glacier Point) so keep an eye on kids that tend to wander. However, because it's pretty close to Glacier Point and it's easy it tends to get really crowded. Instead of starting from the trail head parking, I suggest parking at Glacier Point and hiking to Sentinel Dome then to Taft Point. It's a solid day hike and you knock out a few birds with one stone and you keep your parking.", 'Beautiful hike. We went in Oct. and the weather was great.(Hooray for Global Warming!) We combined the Sentinel Dome to Taft Point and the Fissures hikes and it totaled 5.5 miles. The section from Sentinel Dome to Taft point moves in and out of the woods along the south ridge of Yosemite Valley at around 7000 feet give or take. The view of El Capitan and the valley floor is spectacular from this vantage point. Moderate/easy. My  kids hd  no problem completing this and very few people on the section between the two points. Trailhead and parking very crowded though.', 'might be a better view than sentinel and combined the 2 together to make it a loop a total of like 5 miles or so.....great lookout point with stunning views of the valley el cap and the drop off is unreal...', 'it was terrifyingly beautiful. the hike itself is lovely and very mild, but when you come up to the edge of the rock faces going down into the valley it gets significantly steeper. down on taft point there are amazing fissures in the rock that allow you to see for the first time just how high up you are- i cant even..... 

there are multiple spots to look out from, you can see el capitan very very well. terrifying. beautiful. wow.', 'Beautiful view!  easy hike.  Not a good hike if you like less people.', "Glacier Point without the hand rails.  Great view, easy hike.  If you're brave, you can go all the way to the edge and look over.  Would not recommend taking kids out here for safety reasons.  Spectacular view of El Capitan, Yosemite Falls, and Cathedral Rocks.", "This is a nice trail that ends with a fantastic view of Yosemite valley. Keep your kids close. There are no guardrails at any of the fissures and only a small one at the point. Even if you aren't afraid of heights, your knees may feel a little shaky near the edge!  A lot of diverse landscape on this short trail. ", 'Amazing views of the valley.  Caution, do not take chilLdren. ', 'Fantastic overnight backpack. Start at McGurk Meadows trailhead, hike to Bridalveil  creek, camp, hike to Fissures, return and hike out. ', 'A fun hike with a amazing knee weakening views that all can enjoy. ', 'Easy. Nice. Shaded. Beautiful views of the valley. ', "What an easy hike with a giant payoff. The hike to Taft Point is a nice walk through the woods. It had snowed the night before, so there was snow melting from the trees, and everything was spongy and cool. There is a large quartz outcropping along the trail that is interesting. Taft Point has incredible views of the north valley wall, El Cap, and Yosemite Falls, but you have to be careful and use common sense because there are no guard rails except for the one at Taft Point itself. Other than that you are free to stand wherever you want, and it is a LONG way down. The hike back up to the trailhead is where the elevation gain comes in, but it's still fairly easy. While you are here, you should hike over and check out Sentinel Dome, as well. (2.2 miles round trip)", "We started from Glacier Point road - there is a parking lot right on the side of the road - and decided first to go to the Sentinel Dome Trail, a great hike! A gradual climb to the base of a giant dome.  On top is a 360-degree spectacular view of Yosemite.  Every feature except El Capitan can be seen.  This was a famous spot for Ansel Adams, whose barren tree stood alone in solitude at the top (and has since fallen on its side).  A good spot for reflection, we pondered awhile and then hiked back to the parking lot.  The parking lot is right in the middle of the two trails about 2.2 mi. RT to Sentinel Dome and about 2.4 mi. RT to Taft Point.  We still had some spunk, so decided to try the Taft Trail to the fissures at Taft Point.  The trail down is easy, but the hike back is a bit harder.   Taft was a scary place, with tubular railings not as safe as the wide rock and rails at Glacier Point.  One unknowing step into a fissure (you could see them if you knew about them) and you are a goner.  I don't recommend children under 7 hiking this trail - maybe there are better railings now than the ones they had in 2000.  The trail back up is a gradual climb, so take water.  When we got back to the car, we headed for the Glacier Point snack and gift shop for hot dogs and sandwiches, a great pit stop.  ", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Peters Canyon Loop Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'road biking', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'lake', 'views', 'wild flowers']
hike_description: Peters Canyon Loop Trail is a 5.9 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Orange, California that features a lake and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['I liked this trail, it had a few different paths you could take to give different scenery which could be confusing to know if you are heading in the right direction but I’m adventurous and enjoy that kind of thing.  Some of the hills are difficult but if you hike regularly they aren’t too bad. Will do this one again!', "...I'm coming back...lots of ups and downs...could have used poles in several places (left them in my car ", 'Try again', 'This trail is a great quick weekend workout.', "Awesome trail. It's near by if you live in Orange and is fairly easy.", 'great place for kids love it', "The majority of this trail is easy, but Scout Hill, East Ridge, and Eucalypti Trail are closer to moderate. I have hiked this trail and mountain biked this trail many times.  The start is on the street which means you won't have to pay for parking.  If this is close to where you live I would highly recommend checking it out.  Most of this trail is double track with probably around 1 mile or less of single track, but it can still be quite fun.", '', "I have come to Peters Canyon for a while, but only recently for mountain biking.  I typically start by Lower Peter's Canyon Reservoir and then go left at the sign.  Then around the lake, I would recommend taking Cactus Point Trail.  Next, I take the main fire road back until Scout Hill and then continue on East Ridge until Eucalyptus and then the ride is over.  It is fairly steep at some spots, but is still relatively easy.  I love this trail for hiking, and it is good for biking but there are definitely better places.", 'Great work out with amazing view.', 'Love it!!', 'Nice trail but gotta pay for parking', 'Its what i needed to go! Fantastic workout', 'Fabulous!', "Ran the track in about an hour.  If you haven't trained for uphills like me, the beginning will have your calves burning.  Second half is mostly flat with a slight incline.  Scenery is decent considering it's local.", 'not bad. had lots of fun', 'Decent hike, not too strenuous, and the foot traffic was fairly moderate Everything is kind of burnt up from the fires, and compound that with the dry conditions, the scenery was all that.I’d probably only do this again after a lot of heavy rain and when the lake reopens', 'Has a really challenging hills and beautiful nature walk ,, careful on weekends  a lot of kids and dogs ,,, clean bathrooms .. parking lot gets very full ,,, bring your pass', 'Pretty cool trail. A lot of different options to make your hike easier/harder and shorter/longer. Go early tho because it gets super busy. We went at 0700 and it was already pretty busy.', 'Definitely a workout! Always fun bringing my boys. A lot as changes since the fire but it still a gorgeous place to hike.', 'I have been here 4 times. It's not bad, but definitely not high on my list of favorite hikes or hikes that I can't wait to return to. The first time I came here was a solo hike. I brought some family member the 2nd time and thought this would be good since my niece has a young family and figured the trail around the lake would be short and easy enough for them to handle. The third time I came with a friend that I hadn't seen in a long time and we hiked the whole thing and that gave us time to "catch up". The last time I came here was for an Earth Day 10K.

Pros- easy to find and doesn't require a long drive to get there; there is ample parking in the lot ($3 I believe)...you can also park at the southwestern end at a school(during non-school hours) or on the street near the school for free; different connecting trails to make your hike suitable to the level of difficulty or time that you have (I have done as little as 2.5 miles here to as much as 6 miles); some steep hills that seemed much steeper when I was running the 10k that gives you a good workout if you choose that trail on the southern side; you can bring your dog

Cons- on the busy side and surrounded by neighborhoods so you don't get the feeling of really getting away from the hustle/bustle; no cool destination or view that you must see esp. since the lake is dry.', 'Dope', 'Great hike, even after the fire.', 'bueno', 'Not my favorite, (kinda boring), but I come here because it’s my local trail. Some great climbing, well maintained terrain, not much shade via the east ridge route. It can get very hot during the warmer days. VERY popular on the weekends, so I go during the week. Many hikers go here with their dog children.', 'Peters Canyon TrailRelatively easy trail with minimal hills and nice shady spots. Easy for everyone!East Ridge View TrailMore hilly and can be steep at parts. No shade from trees. Nice views of the houses though!', 'Nice short hike that is easy to get to  unfortunately the recent fire burned the natural vegetation  it’s starting to grow back', 'Closed due to fire :(', 'Temporarily closed from recent fires.', 'Burnt on 09OCTOBER2017 from Anaheim Canyon Fire', 'Tough to hike @ 104 degrees', "I love the hills on this trail, great workout! Go early there isn't any shade! Beware of rattlesnakes! Have seen 2 in the last week!", 'The lake loop is easy. There is another trail with hills and is more difficult.', 'I have completed this trail multiple times .It is definitely a moderate hike as it comes with some steep hills (both when you head up and then hike downward ).Recommend to pack lots of water especially if you take your pet on a hike !', 'Great moderate hike.', 'Nice trails with mixed view of the mountains, cityscape, and man-made lake. Very well maintained trails as well.', 'It was a nice hike & view', 'Fun hike with ups and downs', 'I go there once a week and it is a great hike. Great cardio and dogs are allowed.', 'Great trail with great scenery. Some steep grades make it perfect for a workout. Saw some runners and some nice dogs. Definitely coming back', 'Nice trail to workout and beautiful scenery.', 'Good morning workout hike.', 'Had a great hike, Ive never seen so many people out before on the trail before, parking was crazy. Get there early to beat the rush of people. The view of the snow topped mountains and clear sunny sky made up for the crowds.', 'Beautiful views! Moderately trafficked for sure, not too many people but enough. I went at 9am. You do need to pay for parking which is $3 for the day.', 'Love this trail! Quick and easy', 'Great hike I suggest getting there early because it gets busy after 7am.', 'Decent place for a ride, Too easy for a hike though...', 'Pretty nice workout and beautiful surroundings!', 'Oh boy, great butt kicker hills on the ridge trail will get you in shape. Flatter trails along the dry lakebed trail. Lots and lots of people on the weekend. But a good workout for sure!', 'fun!', 'Easy, fun trail with some serious hill options. Mostly wide berth, though on the Lake View downside mountain bikers can be a bit uncool, so be safe and aware. A couple of coyotes on the backside occasionally check you out. The big one I named Wiley.  Nice people and flat and wide enough for all ages. But bring water in case you do the entire 6-miles. No drinkable water on the trail stops.', 'Easier then expected', 'love this trail', 'Nice bit of nature. Good for training with the hills (Big Red).', 'Wonderfull', 'Great views from the heights. Teeming with wildlife.', 'good workout trail', "Tends to be crowded even during the week. Mild up & down trail especially the east ridge view portion which can be challenging to some. The lower portion(peters cyn trail) is relatively flat offering little challenge but has a decent portion of it canopied. The big hill which some locals call the MF'ing hill is a great challenge. I hit it twice for an added workout.", 'Has some challenging parts; good for exercising. It can get crowded at times', 'Easy to follow, good challenging spots. Brought two dogs, the entire loop too much for the little guy who smacks out at 3.5. No need to go off trail anywhere, plenty of clean and challenging sections.', "Great scenery and the trails are well kept. Moderate rating is accurate because it isn't hard but it does take some effort to get through it.", 'I do this hike about twice a week. Great trail', 'Great hike in the middle of suburban Orange County. Nice distance, some ups and downs, some views, try it out.

For turn by turn directions, check out my blog:
https://hikingguy.com/hiking-trails/peters-canyon-hike/', "It's an easy enough trail; you can pick if you want to do a challenging cardio workout by choosing the big hills, moderate or easy, up to you. This trail gets crowded a lot so don't go here if you're looking for a nature-y solitude hike!", 'A good trail to run along. Has some short hills for that extra training.', 'Good trail running / hiking in the heart of OC.  Parking down a long street with overflow into a school and park about 1/3 mile down the road.  Easy to difficult depending on which options you take.  You may hike up and back along a gradual incline paralleling a stream bed.  You may also go up and back along the ridgelines with lots of up and downs.     I sometimes use this park when I go out with people of different skill levels.  I will run two laps while my wife or some friends hike the loop.  It is impossible to get lost and there are a couple of places to shortcut down the hill to the part of the trail that is fairly flat.  Cell coverage is pretty good and there are three or four outhouses.  Can get busy but it is still fun.', 'This trail is great for running and those looking for incline/ decline challenges. This place is close to home and very convenient. Only gripe about this trail loop is there are many mountain bikers, especially during the weekends. Great for beginners too! This trail great if you want to be outside other than the gym.', 'Too many bike guys and dog and horse poops along the way.  Too many people and very close to the neighborhood.', 'Great hike!  Took the higher routes for a better workout.  Several steep hills made the hike quite a challenge, but it was so rewarding getting to the top.  Not much color out there in terms of foliage, but got several good pics of the views of the surrounding areas.  I highly recommend this trail for advanced beginners to intermediates.', 'Good hike. The continuous inclines/declines make a for great workout! ', 'Challenging. Enjoyed the view ... Surrounded by beautiful houses. Bikes come through real fast, so be careful!', "THIS IS AN EXCELLENT HIKE...if you like walking around for an hour or two looking at million dollar homes. Its a very simple hike with a few small hills. This is good for beginners or maybe throw on your pack and use it as a conditioning hike for harder trails. It's very crowded there with walkers, hikers, bikers, and runners. On the Pro side it is very convenient if you live near the the 22, 55 or 5fwy interchange. I would only recommend to beginners and people that really feel the need to get a hike in but don't have a lot of time to go some place good.", 'I went for my first time on this trail this past Saturday. The trail is pretty easy except for the 2 or 3 hills you climb. They are not that bad because their kind of short. All in all the trail was nice. A little busy so early in the morning. Note; The gate to the parking lot does not open until 7:00am. We got there early because of the reviews stating open from sunrise to sunset. Yes, if you live across the street and walk to the trails!', "Awesome hike I would say it's for intermediate hikers/runners", "Great local spot. This place is a good outdoor gym. Anytime I'm there I see trail runners, bikers, walkers, dogs, horses, and photographers. The park is nestled amidst a residential area, so don't worry about getting lost. On the other hand, don't be looking for an adventure either.", 'GREAT for hike! Moderate due to steep hills. Good for Hikes, Walks, Biking (mountain) and also great DOG friendly!

Con: Scenery on one side hiking grounds, other side homes.

Still a wonderful hike!', "This is nice hike that can be as easy or challenging as you want to make it. There are plenty of flat areas that are nice to walk around, and some relatively steep hills that aren't too long of a climb. With 2 dogs we traveled 6 miles within 2 hours. It's a good local hike, but nothing wow about the scenery. It's $3 for parking at the lot.", 'Beautiful day for a hike. Started out easy but we took the "high" roads for a more strenuous hike.  And we certainly got one!!  Many people with dogs, children and bikes!  Everyone was friendly and helpful when the trails became too small for passing each other!!  Certainly will go back!  The area isn't far from home and easy to get too for a nice afternoon with friends', 'This was a very good workout for me. Started out on the far right side of the parking lot, took the lake view trail on the right. Takes you on a couple good hills with nice views on the top. At the end of the lake view trail I then ventured upward on the east ridge view trail, that first hill kicked my ass! It continues over lots of ridges ups and downs. It ends at the eucalyptus trail which leads you down to peters canyon trail. It was easy from there back to the parking lot. You can get extra out of it by doing push ups at every bench like I did. I will be back for sure.', "Parking is free if you park on the street by the school on pioneer rd and pioneer way  but if you park in the main parking lot for the park, I think it's $5. We got there at 6am and there was people there already. Not a lot but by the end of our 5'ish mile hike, there was a lot of people. A lot if runners.Public bathroom look pretty clean by the parking lot and they do have a portable potty by the south entrance. Overall, a good hike! I like it a lot. About 3-4 hills and one steep ass hill! Omg! I was literally on my hands and knees trying to climb the steep hill. No switchbacks and they do have level trails. It smell real nice with all the trees and plants on one of the cover trails. The trail with hills are out in the open. So, make sure your wear sun screen and have lots of water.  There are benches along the trails with the hills. It took us 2 hours to hike 2 trails; which is a little over 5 miles total. I think this is my 5th hike and I would recommend it : )", 'Love this trail!', 'This was a great trail! Our first hike! My 5 year old did it and had fun.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
The Slot - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'camping', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'off road driving', 'scenic driving', 'walking', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'bugs', 'no dogs']
hike_description: The Slot is a 2.3 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near Borrego Springs, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
["By far the neatest hike I've done. loved walking through the narrow canyon. you can even  climb up to the top. soo soo much to see. so many different directions you can go. once u make ur way out u will hit this HUGE hill u have to climb/walk up to get up and out of the canyon and back to the parking lot. once up that hill u will be the whole canyon wide up from the top. I will def be back, hopefully to backpack..", 'Breathtaking views. We actually set up camp here for a night. It was definitely not the best spot due to the sand flies, but it was perfectly silent, except for a heli patroling here and there. Such a beautiful sight to wake up to.', 'Short, easy, kids and I loved it!', 'Great short hike. We did the loop walking down through the slot first and the up the hill and along the ridge on the road. The slot is really fun!', "Great hike through an amazing landscape. The trail is quite easy to follow once you arrive in the parking lot. The drive up the dusty road from the 78 is easy enough that 4wd is not required at all. A buddy of mine drove up in a Scion XB and had no trouble. Just be mindful of the patchy sand and be sure to stay on the designated road at all times.This hike is well worth the trip. Best time to visit is November-April so that the heat isn't so bad.", 'Great hike! I can’t wait to go there again :p', 'Great, easy slot canyon. Have to scramble a little to get down to the trail but it’s pretty easy.After walking through the slot, nice littletrail continues to a view of Fonts Point from the reverse and some miniature wind caves. Good hike for summer as a lot of it is shaded.', 'Great little hike! We did it in reverse which I recommend!', "This was a really cool short and easy trail. It had some really nice geological features. Some parts of the slots gets really tight. We had started our hike a little later in the day, but the weather was awesome and the 2nd half of the trail was all shaded. Since the trail is a loop we decided to start the trail from heading West (if facing the slots head left) from the parking. It'll take you through a dirt road (4wd vehicle use this trail too) until you finally hit a steep hill. Go down the hill to the right and head towards the slots. There is a faster option of getting to the slots which is starting at the end and either doing the loop in that direction or turning around at the end of the slots and head back the same way you came in. If you decide to start in reverse remember they're is that steep hill with loose sand you'll have to go up. We found it most rewarding doing it the way we did. But we ran into other hikers that did it in reverse.", "it was a lot of fun, but not a year round trail. I'd definitely avoid this place in the summer.  the description saying it's shaded and cool is inaccurate; most of the trail,even inside the canyon, is in the full brunt of the sun.The trail starts out on sandstone hills, then declines gradually into the slot canyon.  once inside, the trail is extremely narrow. I could barely fit through with my day pack on.  my husband wouldn't be able to fit through most of the trail as he's a big guy, and I was scraping my legs and arms on the walls as I passed.Fortunately, the views inside the canyon make it totally worth it.  It was even worth the heat!  Would be a beautiful hike in the winter or spring, when the sun isn't so hot.", 'Go early in the morning if you can to avoid the high heat.  It is a fairly easy hike.  The areas through the slot are not very big. Bring lots of water and sunscreen.  4WD is not required to get to the trailhead parking lot, but not sure I would recommend going with a low ground clearance car.', 'If your in the area you must stop and see the slot. It’s so amazing. Easy to get to from the 78. No 4wd needed.', 'the slot trail was easy and down a dirt road so passing in a car is impossible, there is another dirt road path that starts on the other side of the slots. We encountered a few other groups in the slots but only 2 once out of them. the slots themselves are fun for the family and windcaves can be found about half a mile past that.', 'Wife and kids loved this place. Easy access', 'Awesome and easy. Kids loved it. Lots of shade for a hot day. I wish the trail that looped back over the butte was more clearly sign posted. We ended up just turning around and going back through the slot.', "After finishing the Palm Canyon hike we drove over to the slot. The entrance from the highway is small and the road to the parking lot is sand packed one-way track with turn outs. We (3 adults and 3 kids (9-11 years old) did this easy hike and it was fantastic. Warning: there are some areas where it is more suited for slender body types and wearing a backpack (even a small one) can be a little tight. It's a nice short hike and pretty relaxed. We did this at the end of the day and by the time we came up we caught the sunset", '', 'Walked the Slot in February and found it to by a nice hike with interesting scenery in the canyon with narrow as well as wide walled areas. We did not know it looped and did not have our AllTrails app so our hike was short, but it was nice. I wore a pack on this one, and some spots can be tight to squeeze through with a pack.', 'Great little trail. Getting in at the trail head might be tough for those that require a cane to walk, it gets pretty skinny at times but awesome fun. The trail can go much farther than is listed if you want to. Pay attention to trail markers so you don’t miss your exits.', "We did it! Despite my son being convinced we were going to die in the desert (eye roll). He's 11 and dramatic. My 8-year-old girl loved it. The walked through the slot until it opened up and then turned back to go through it again. 

I highly recommend stopping by the Anza Borrego State Park Visitor's center to get more information on the area and peace of mind when checking on the road and wash conditions, especially if you aren't driving a 4WD.

This is a short hike, a few steps down over rocks. I did see Seniors (one 80+) doing the trail. People of all ages, shapes, and sizes were hiking this trail seemingly without a problem. The only hindrance would be if you needed a cane or something to assist with walking. Otherwise, you're good to go. Bring water, as always. But this was SO awesome because a lot of it was in the shade and there was a nice breeze.", 'Certainly a must see..short but spectacular hike! This is a good one for kids/family in my opinion. Trail head can be difficult to find.', "Stunning! So much better than I thought it would be!  Glad there weren't many people when I hiked it because some spaces get tight. Not sure why the description here says it's un maintained.  It looked very well maintained when we hiked it.", 'Awesome kid friendly hike.  Unique and easy for all skill levels.  Kids will love it.', 'Beautiful slot canyon and rock formations. The trailhead (and the trail itself, for that matter) could be much better marked. Also, come early and not on a weekend if you want to avoid the droves of 4x4 drivers, smokers, tourists playing loud music, and other nuisances.', 'We tried this as recommended by “Afoot & Afield San Diego County” by Jerry Schad. The Slot is awesome, but the trail taken counter-clockwise is poorly marked with multiple cairns for several trails and overlooks. Although not mentioned in the parking lot, a sign at the end of the slot mentions that no dogs are allowed.', 'fun hiking trail', 'Awesome hike. Wish it had a touch more color. But navigating a two foot wide slot is awesome. Super easy to find, only challenge is is finding the road off of 78. This trail app is awesome. It found the road off of 78,Google maps took us to a different road. Have fun!!', 'Great hike', 'Awesome trail and an unexpected surprise. Lots of people the day I was there. Great, easy hike. I highly recommend it for visitors to Anza-Borrego!', 'Totally worth the drive!', 'Took a break from dirt bike riding in Ocotillo Wells this afternoon and went on an awesome hike through the slot canyon. Definitely recommend this hike!', 'Exceeds expectations! The trailhead is easier to find these days since the signage has improved. Recommend considering doing the loop clockwise to avoid having to clambor up the steep hill at the end.', 'Hot but definitely worth it! Had to maneuver around people a bit but the slot was very cool to look at and walk through... do it! Can be hard to find because the sign is not prominent on the road.', 'It's not a hard hike, but man, it was worth finding. It was peaceful and there are plenty of crevices to explore. It's family friendly also.  It's not hard to find. The sign says "The Slot" go straight down into the canyon and turn left.', 'Good place to stroll easy hikes good for family hikes.', "Great place with a beautiful view, stick to the route or you'll get lost.", "Beautiful hike, very windy, don't lose your hat lol! Amazing geography. Will go again. Cars can easily access this by dirt road without any issues.", 'we had so much fun! there were several pee spots though', 'This trail is beyond over-crowded. plan on waiting in line to get through the tight confined spaces because everyone goes through then immediately turns around and comes back through the other direction to congest the canyon even further. people park and drive like idiots on the entire dirt road to the trail head. beautiful trail throughthe landscape but hard to enjoy with the constant need to get out of the way or be in the way of the other 50+ people continuously flowing through the Slot. We ended up going off trail the last 3/4 mile just to avoid the crowd.', 'Cool mountain to hangout on not many flowers cool canyon', 'I prefer a climb and more of challenge, but in the desert on a hot day a beautiful flat canyon trail with significant shady sections is pretty much perfect.', 'Better than expected, will be back to explore more...', 'Great hike, felt like I was in Utah !', 'First part of trail not well marked.  
Very fun hike. Give yourself 1 1/2 hrs round trip from highway', 'nice little hike. any car can make it to trail head. All ages can hike this trail.', 'Mellow drive from the parking area. But has a pretty serious section to make it down to "the slot" and to get to the mountain wash trail. We made it out to a cool spot to picnic but couldn't make it down the gnarly spot in my stock TRD Tundra.', 'Awesome hike. Really cool down in crevasse. Took the whole family. Made with a 3 year old all the way. Sign posted says no dogs on trail but we saw a couple with no problems.', "The road to get here is unpaved but it was easy even with a stock TSX. The hike was really easy and straightforward. We saw probably 8 cars when we parked but encountered less people during the hike. The map shows a loop but we kind of got lost once we got out of the slot canyon section so we turned around as it was dusk. It's really cool down there. Highly recommended.", 'Very easy hiking & what a very amazing view. I love it ', 'a great day,,,anyone can do this,  easy drive to trailhead, any car!', "What a cool experience. It's a short hike so we hiked in from the main road. We wore our day packs, but if you can wear a smaller pack, it's easier to squeeze through the slot. Great photos ops and beautiful sights. The trail opens up after the slot and you'll notice that if you go straight there are rocks cutting off the trail.... that's the Jeep trail. There is a sharp right turn that you can take, which has many cool areas to see, but it does dead end. You can climb out at the dead end, however you cannot get back to the car lot since it doesn't connect. At that point, you can just turn back and return the same way you came.", 'Oh Wow!! what a place.. we unfortunately started on wrong side and we went to the hawk mountain but on our way back, we finally found the canyon.. A bit confusing to find where does start the trail..', 'Wow and wow!! What a nice hike, once you found it... We started to follow the trail at the post sign then, gone below as per the trail brings us. But at this point(down below) there are no signs to whether turn right or left. We unfortunately turned right, we passed a small canyon(thought that was the slot) and started to climb(we were disappointed since we thought that was the slot that we have passed), anyways we loved the hike we did in the mountain.... Returning back, at the point where we had to climb to reach the parking lot, we have decided to continue!! Oh My God, the slot was there!!! What a place!!!So, once you are down in the canyon, pls turn left to not miss it!!', "Was there just a couple days ago. Such an amazing place! There was a good amount of people there enjoying it, but it wasn't at all crowded.", 'Very interesting hike! The canyon gets pretty deep at some points and there are tons of ledges that you can climb onto which is a plus since I enjoy bouldering. Definitely worth it to also check out the visitor center and learn more about what caused the slot area to form.', 'Beautiful and amazing! As described,  there's a short scramble down a rocky path to get to the trail. Did not keep going around the "loop" as it seemed the road just went on and on. turned back and walked through the slot again and walked right past the trail ò to the parking lot.  oops. figured it out eventually. highly recommend this hike.', "An amazing spot to visit if you're in Anza, especially if it's the summer time and you want to escape some of the heat. The trail is easy/impossible to stray from and there's a parking area at the trailhead. I've seen alot of people confused after parking when trying to find out how to start it. So when you park facing the canyon, go to the right up a small hill and then turn left down into the canyon. DO NOT try an adventure when there's been rain or a chance of a flood coming, the trail is narrow, hence the name. And to be blunt, if you're a bigger person, you may have some problems when it gets tight. Besides that it's the best hike for kids or a simple walk close to Borrego Springs.", 'amazing!!!', 'One of the coolest trails in So cal', "The hike is really short and easy but it's incredible. Something you don't get to see very often.", 'Hike is short but well worth seeing the beautiful canyon with amazing photo ops opportunity.', 'Very cool short hike.  Gets tight is some places but very scenic.', 'Great sights. Easy to get to...even in small rental car. Highly recommend!', 'Super short hike but worth the photo opportunities. Really enjoyed it.', 'Go early so you can have it to yourself. Magical.', "THE SLOT should be in everyone's bucket list :-) Awesome trail - great, unique and fun experience. Easy to miss the Buttes Pass road from 78, and a bit rough to get to the trail head, but once you are there - boy! This is it!

The trail is very easy - yes there are narrow passages but even a slightly large person can easily fit in. Not much elevation or anything strenuous, just a nice and easy walk. You will be amazed and awestruck with this canyon in the middle nowhere.", 'You drive down a dirt road for a little over a mile before getting to the parking lot. Amazing little canyons with some parts that are super narrow which makes it even more fun. I had just finished watching Star Wars and it felt like I was walking through a mini Tatooine haha', 'Great hike', 'Great easy hike', 'This was a very cool intro to what canyons are like. Some spots were pretty narrow. Definitely check the weather, in case of flash floods. Easy hike though getting in and out of the canyon is a little hard.', "GSP coordinates:  33.182132, -116.214176
The Slot Canyon out near Borrego Springs is one of the only ones  of it's kind in the area.  It is a great hike and very easy to find despite what folks always seem to write up about it.

If you are coming from Julian directly, stay on Hwy 78 and go pass Borrego Springs Road, the road you are looking for is Buttes Pass Road which is just a mile or so pass the turn for Borrego Springs Rd.  If coming out of Borrego Springs, use Borrego Springs Road directly and link up with the 78, turning east towards Ocotillo Wells, again heading east till you see the sign for Buttes Pass.  I think the trick is not missing the small brown signs that are used to denote the park roads as they are easy to miss.

The road is improved gravel, so you shouldn't need a 4x4, but stay on the trail and as long as your vehicle has pretty good ground clearance you should shouldn't have to worry about getting stuck.  I made the mistake of turning off on the wrong trail the first time out there in my car and got stuck.  It is very easy to do and can be dangerous given the right conditions.

Buttes Pass Road splits just a short ways in and heads slightly east to Goat Trail, continue northward towards Borrego Mountain Wash.  After a good half mile or so, you will come to a wide parking area.

Please note, the road goes on further but you will need a 4x4 very quickly once you continue from this point onward pass the Slot Canyon parking so only do it if you have one.

The initial climb down into the canyon is steep, but not that bad if you go slow and pay attention to your footing.  And as with all canyons like this, the temperature is a good 10 - 15 degrees cooler down inside the canyon than at the surface which is nice, but still make sure that you bring plenty of water and your standard hiking gear (good shoes and a hat are a must).

The canyon can be narrow in areas and you might have to take off your backpack if your wearing one.  Overall, it's a great hike.  One that you should see at various times with the light: morning, mid day, and evening.  It's simply gorgeous.

Be safe, make sure someone knows where you are and take someone with you.  I don't mean to sound preachy, but folks who have never been out in the heat sometimes read these posts then they head out to do the hikes and they can get themselves into trouble if they are not prepared - that desert can get super hot.  It always makes me very sad when I read about accidents like that and I hate seeing it happen.

Have fun.", "Always worth the time - hop over and knock this one out as you're passing through the area.  Each of the two dozen trips, I've always wondered if it's my time... Thrilling for the kid-o's. Take the dirt road out, park where you can see that everyone else does, and scoot down into the slot and follow the footsteps.  It's exists from nature's power - watch the skies before you go.", 'Really enjoy this hike. Not difficult or much of a work out but interesting and fun. Getting down into the slot area is basically scambling down a gravelly slope so not great for anyone not sure footed but its not too steep.  At one point it gets narrow enough that you have to walk sideways. Definitely bring water! To get to the parking area, you are ok if not 4wd when dry.
Road is unpaved and the sign is very small and easy to miss.', "Great little gem, we heard about this place while camping in Anza, Thought we'd check it out.  Awesome! The idea of getting lost in there, kinda kewl lol. A must do hike.", "Very cool hike. I have an iPhone and used the directions link which worked perfectly, however I didn't see a trail head sign at all. When you arrive you'll see cars parked facing the slot. On the far right side of the parking area you'll see a line of rocks. Follow that trail up a hill. The trail will split, stay to your left. That will drop you down into the canyon. Also I recommend not driving a vehicle that sits low to the ground. I bottomed out my A3 several times.", 'Fun, short hike. Took both my dogs with me, didn't see the tiny "no dogs" sign at the trail head until I got back to my truck; didn't run into any problems having them there.', 'Pretty awesome, simply put. It's worth a stop, walk, and some photo ops. Here's what I did:

My wife and I camped overnight extremely close by at Hawk Canyon in our vehicle (see on map: http://www.sandiegoreader.com/news/2004/jan/29/discover-slot-and-colorful-hawk-canyon-borrego-mou/). To beat the heat we started our hike just after sunrise. We were done by 0930 and traveled east to Niland, CA for some sightseeing. We brought our dogs, but there were "No Dog" signs. We took our chances and didn't run into any problems.

I hope this helps, I used the map on the link above and our GPS had 'Buttes Pass Road' on it. If you can find 'Buttes Pass' you'll have no problems. If you can't, I'd research better directions.', "Slot Canyon was cool I wish Mother nature would have carved a much deeper and longer canyon. It says the canyon is 2.5 miles but the cool parts were more like 0.5 miles so that was kind of a let down considering we drove 2 hours to get there,but overall it was cool and very unique of a hike.Soon to be going to the Arizona's Canyons hope there a little longer of a hike.", 'Nice Drop through ruts to the bottom of Borrego Mtn Wash. Can drive into the Slot and look around but its a dead end or drive out Borrego Mtn wash.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
McGinty Mountain Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'cave', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'rocky', 'no shade']
hike_description: McGinty Mountain Trail is a 4.6 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Jamul, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from March until October. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
