Very crowded.', 'Beautiful. Take a picnic!', 'fun walk on a beautiful day', 'loved this hike and the swim through the tunnel and back.', '4 stars only for the large amount of poison oak. This was an easy trail down, downhill. We went with our 3 children and were very cautious to make sure they stayed out of the bushes. It was no too bad at all. A workout on the way back up. The river is shallow and has tons of areas for crawdad cathcing, tadpools, fish, and someone even had their hammock up! This is about an hour from Manteca. Had a great time with my sister and cousin!", '4/29/2017 Hike', 'Perfect trail for a first time hike.Beautiful scenery and nice clear trail.', "I live in the Sacramento area, and it was about 2 hour drive to get there-give or take depending on traffic. You start out going down hill so that means you have to go back up after you reach the cave.   Fortunately the hike is pretty short so its not too bad.   We will for sure be back this summer to float through the cave.', 'Nice short hike with a big pay off.', "I loved this hike super easy so worth the walk to the cave very nice not deep at all watch out for snakes, I hope they're gopher snakes lol", 'Loved the trip down to the bridge and the view is definitely worth the trek.  It is fairly well used trail.  Nite, there are some wooden steps that have not worn too well towards the start of the trail.  Definitely doing this one again!Nite: April 2017, water level was high and was flowing pretty good.', 'bring hiking boots. watch for poison  oak. easy hike. beautiful falls. great place to have lunch.', "The end is a beautiful natural bridge, lots of wild flowers, and poison oak .in the summer the water is probably refreshing but now it's in the 50's. hopefully hikers can keep the trail clean, there is some hikers who don't pick up their own trash.", "The trail was moderate and a bit steep on your way back. The walk was nice and there was lots of shade as you're walking through. Couple of benches for you to take breaks on too. It's doesn't take too long to get to the bottom. I recommend continuing down the trail a little further than you see all the traffic and people swimming there is a much more private area on the other side if you don't mind a little climbing. I will definitely be back!", 'Almost too easy.', 'A nice little hike to the swimming hole', 'great trail but there are more than just one cave. you need to look around the parking lot for the other trail.', "Way back in the day very few people knew about this place.  Then they built the road closer to it and made it a park...unfortunate.  It was pristine and definitely clothes optional.  It's still a very enjoyable place even with all the people.  The last time I was there was 2006 and the friend I was with was talking to a gold panner who didn't wear clothes either.  Turns out the guy has a web site as well...", 'Really fun hike and destination !!!', 'Loved it... Beautiful the cave is super cool, floated thru it a few times. We had a Blast! Water was really cold, but it was amazing. Water shoes n a tube are a must. Bring a lunch an kick back and enjoy the wonder view. Be sure to save some energy to hike back up lol', 'swim through cave, lower cave had to hoist up dogs on one part up and over to other side. me like.', "so beautiful here. and the hike is definitely not too bad it's worth it!", 'Love it', "It's a coo lil hike especially with a fresh batch of some cookies", 'Decent amount of parking, great trail... Lovely cave and swimming hole in the middle. But sadly, too many people on the weekends, too much trash left behind by careless punks and too many smokers. Makes me sad. Clean your act up Calaveras peeps.', 'Easy - nice quick hike!!', "It's easygoing downhill a little more work coming out but the river at the bottom is real nice", "Beautiful trail, fairly easy unless you're walking in the peak of the heat. Bring water and water shoes. The caves are gorgeous, it's like something out of national geographic and it's free! What more could you ask for?", 'Hike was a bit short. Gets a bit busy during the day but if you go early enough you have the area for yourself. Water was ready cold until you get used to it. but overall nice for beginners like myself. ', 'nice place to spend all day,  water cold maybe u need small matress', '1.8 rocky descending trail Hot days wear sun block, hat with visor, 1-2 quart of water per person!  Bring waterproof camera, flashlight, ( to see walls inside well but not necessary to go through) neoprene beach shoes, bathing suit and inflatable mattress. Please pick up trash including bottle caps Etc!! Water appears clean and water fall and drips from caves ceiling. Also cathedral tall inner chamber is beautiful and cold creek water is refreshing! Water shallow at both entrances but deep in center area. Not a lot of flat area so expect to sit on rocks if not swimming or gliding through cave in inner tube.', 'Wonderful place. Nice & cool on a hot day!', 'The cave was beautiful and cathedral like. Water was beautiful and clear', "This was a great hike. I'm a beginner and it wasn't that hard. Uphill on the way back but the view is amazing. The cave made it worth the hike.", 'A beautiful natural area completely overrun by city people leaving their trash and carving their initials in the once beautiful rock. We saw a pharmacist from the Bay Area showing his son how to appropriately gouge his name in the wall with the other hundreds of graffiti marks.', 'A short and easy hike into an absolutely beautiful cavern.', "It was a little tough for someone out of shape as I am but so worth it. I am not saying it's not do able but just plan accordingly.  Just know that you are walking down to get to the spot so when it's time to head back, the whole way is an incline up.", 'Amazing experience. Great family spot. Bring floaty to go thru cave or swim. Not a long hike at all. More like a picnic swim spot. Lots of people.', "The trail is fairly easy-to-moderate with beautiful views of the canyons. The underground river that runs through the cave, however, is amazing. The water gets deep inside of the cave - I brought water shoes for the rocks and was really glad I did. I couldn't take my pack through because it was too deep, so I settled down to read at the mouth of the cave. After about 30 minutes of chilling in the cool water, I was surprised by a group of three kids on a blowup raft that came through from the other side. I paid one of them $20 to ferry me through. It was the first time he had ever been paid to ferry someone down an underground river.", 'Fantastic and beautiful! Great medium hike and so worth it. I only wish the other people could be more respectful and not leave trash and cigarettes butts behind. We picked up all we saw and hope others will do the same to keep it beautiful.', 'Loved it. Trail a little rocky. Watch your step but well worth the hike. Easy hike. Beautiful cave and stream.', 'Those caves were legit. Super easy hike.', "It's beautiful once you get to the water. It's rocky and ankle twisting territory.It's moderate, not easy. Not for out  of shape beginners like me", 'Absolutely beautiful and it was an easy hike. Loved the cave!!', 'Loved it. Nice for kids.', 'Fun', 'Another favorite near by beautiful escape. swimming through the cave is a must so go on a hot day and take a noodle to float through!', 'Beautiful. Easy hike. Awesome caves. Cold water. Serene.', 'Nice little hike I did with my wife today. The trail is clean and wide, so even beginners should find this trail doable. If you go in the colder months, make sure you go up and over the natural bridge to get to the other side of the cave, where the view is spectacular. Also, make sure you wear comfortable footwear with good tread, as the trail can be slippery.', "This was a really fun hike. We didn't see the second cave, but we did see the first. The water was really low, but this is December so it was too cold to go in very far. Still, very cool to check it out. \n\nAnother cool thing was that since it is December, no one was there and we had the whole place to ourselves and could explore as we wanted.", 'Fun with caves, rocks and picnic tables', "Park at the trail head or on the turnout off Parrot's Ferry Rd. The hike is easy, moderate amount of use, and no pets are allowed. Lots of overgrowth with thorns, and the area is very cold this time of year, so bring a sweater along. The water is too cold to wade into, and I wish I had a way to get to further into the cave to see how deep it is. There is a rumored second cave 30 mins to the left of the main cave, but I did not find it this time. We'll hike this one again, and hopefully find the second cave. Will update if we find it!", 'Awesome !!', "Short, easy hike to the cave. I've gone both routes. Best to go during the week or early in the morning because it does it crowded with families and party people, so not the most peaceful place. Make sure a bring a flotation device because the water is really cold and you may not wanna swim through. It is possible though, I saw a lot of people doing it! Overall, it's a pretty cool place!", 'Beautiful, definitely recommend it! The second cave going down the stream is gorgeous!', 'Best destination hike but you need to go super early or you will find a million kids and families in the first cave - the second cave is hard to get to but amazing - we had it all to ourselves when we went because there is no longer a trail to get to it - you must off trail and follow the water - rock jumping is a must to find your way - bring a float device with you - the water is too cold to just swim.....', 'Nice short trail is really worth the walk.  Tables along the route so plan a pick nick.  I was hear on a Saturday afternoon and it was not crowded.', "This was even more amazing than I had expected! This is a such a unique place to visit and experience, anyone can do this hike. It's harder on the way out because it's more uphill but otherwise this cave was just beyond amazing. We didn't even bother going to the next, it was beautiful, BUT definitely bring a floaty to float through. The water gets deep and is really cold since it's in the shade.", 'Very easy and short hike to the cave. So easy even a 2 year old can do it. Make sure to bring water shoes and floater to enjoy swimming in the cave. Dogs not allowed. Picnic tables available in the trail and at the cave/natural bridge area.', 'Getting to the first cave was an easy hike, a refreshing swim awaits you when get there.  The second cave is another 30 minutes in to the left of the first cave.  This hike is a bit harder but is quite rewarding once you get there....', "This is a hidden gem that we enjoyed a lot!  The hike is rated easy, probably because it's short, only .7 miles each direction.  Going in it is all down hill, and the trail gets pretty rocky in sections, and ends with some stairs of various sizes.  The float through the cave was wonderful!  There is just enough light inside to see the amazing rock formations.  The water looks black once you are inside, and we were too chicken to have swam where we can't see.  It is also very deep in some areas, in the middle of the cave.  We hiked up stream a little ways, it really is a beautiful place!  Amazing that something so unique and beautiful is still free, and in good condition.  Very little human trash.\nSome things to note:\nBring lots of water, there is none.\nMake use of the vaulted toilets at the top, there are no restrooms anywhere else.\nBring a floaty. The water is very cold, even in July.  We brought cheap inner tubes that we could blow up at the bottom, then deflate before we hiked out. \nBring water shoes, the stream bed & cave has some sharp rocks, and shoes make it nice to maneuver around.\nSign at the top says NO pets.\nPlease clean up after yourself & leave no trace. We picked up a bit of trash we found, to keep this area beautiful.", 'Terrific day hike! Not to hard and the reward at the bottom is a nice cool dip! Love to see it with more water. Good place for the family, young children if they are hikers will do fine. Bring a float to go through the cave. You can swim through but can see more on a float.', 'Great swimming place; how often can you swim through a cave?!!!  Short hike down the trail.  Watch out for poison oak!   Not dried up that much considering the California drought.  Definitely bring a float device or noodle if you want to swim through the cave.  It also  makes it easy to explore the travertine  formations within while you are swimming or to just hang out inside the cave for a while.  There is a rock about halfway through the cave on the right side some people were  jumping off of. The water is a  little chilly at first but you get used to it  pretty quickly  and after the hot hike down it  feels wonderful.  A very interesting fact; years ago  in the 1880s it was a  popular picnic resort.  The stream was diverted to one side of cave so that  up to 100 people could go inside while dried out and have picnics-  natural air conditioning before air-conditioners were invented!  If you explore downstream a bit,  you will find pools of little crawdads or some type of crabs  swimming around in the water.', 'Short, easy hike. Worth it for the natural tunnels the stream has made through the rock at the end. Great place to cool off in the summer. The hike is nothing particularly special but the destination is great. Went on a weekday and had it to ourselves.', "This short hike is definitely more about the destination than the journey, down to the most unique swimming hole I've ever encountered.  It's a popular place, though not many were daring the numbingly cold water in the middle of the cave.  It was worth the chill and kept me from overheating on the walk back up.", "If you like the cave at the end of the trail, take an extra 15 minutes and hike downstream to another similar cave! It's a bit longer and just as awesome! The trail is not quite as well defined, but just keep going down stream and you will find it!", "So worth the hike to get the cave at the end. The water was perfect temperature and only a few people there on a Friday. Got tired towards the end though but I did have my 4 month old on my chest. It's a fairly easy hike ☺️", 'Went here last year with my boyfriend and his family! It was an easy "hike," more like a walk. There was 2 amazing caves on the opposite ends of each other, it just requires more exploring. Also, the water is super cold to swim in, so I\'d bring a floaty next time!', "My wife and I just got done a few hour's ago. We enjoyed the hike, we are new to hiking just started a few weeks ago this is our 3rd trail in as many weeks. Our leg's were a little tight going up hill.But the overall experience was a great one. Next time will bring water shoe's and a intertube. So we can float inside the cave.", 'At the end of the trail you arrive to a cool cave with water where you can swim. The hike is easy (we are not fit) and one of us was carrying a 6 months old baby.The views are not the best, but I think is good if you are nearby.', "This is a famous local trail that can also be quite the party spot for youngsters with enough grit to lug an ice chest down to the water and back out again. On Parrotts Ferry Road you will see a brown landmark sign barely a half mile north of the bridge. There is a dirt entrance that doesn't look like much but plenty of parking once you turn in. A lot of people drive by without noticing the sign or seeing the cars parked which are out of sight from the road. Once there, the trail is quite groomed  and east to traverse. Wear your swim gear! The river actually runs through an awesome cave. As a matter of fact Moaning Caverns is only about 2 miles away. It can get a little crowded on the weekends, especially in the summer. So try to check it out during the week.", 'Short downhill to destination, take a float tube to explore the cave.', 'Great hike for little kids, not to long and they LOVE swimming the caves.  Water is cold but worth it.', 'Great easy hike, swim through the cold water. Picnic tables next to the river. Follow the river down about a quarter mile and you will find the second cave you can walk all the through it.', 'Good, short hike and fun place to explore. Bring water shoes! Fun to float/swim through. I prefer going on weekdays during summer when less families and children there.', 'Fantastic hike!  Beautiful views and a very cool cave.  To get through requires getting very wet, so be prepared to swim.', 'I loved this hike.  I will say though is you are out of shape, it will not seem "easy" at all.  I\'m out of shape but thanks to Shaun T have lost 18lbs in the past 8 weeks.  If I had not dropped that weight, I\'m not sure how long it would have taken me to hike up. lol  We completed the hike round trip in about 45 mins (less the time we were sightseeing).   But it was a wonderful experience and worth it when you can see the cave.  We were lucky to have missed the hikers going up and down while we enjoyed the views but I can see how busy it will be during the summer.', 'This was a fantastic hike,not to hard not to long.The caverns(bridges) were amazing.There were about 30 people there when we left.Go early.', 'First time there, it was quite hot today. Only one other car and even then I didn\'t see anyone. The one mile down and back using the end if the road trail can be very dangerous and hard coming back up, FYI. I wish I brought my tevas so I could walk through the whole cavern/bridge in the water. I feel the "back" end is more majestic but the front end was beautiful too. I recommend seeing both ends. Just know that the back end requires steeper slopes to get down and up unless you walk through the middle. I, too, had a pesky squirrel eyeing my trail pack. Being under the bridge was nice and cool, but coming back up the trail was so hot, that it almost erased my "cool" experience so I headed to angels camp for a cool drink. I stopped at moaning caverns along the way but didn\'t have time to do the tour or many other activities they had there. This is well worth the hike and made my day. I will come here again. It was troubling to see a few broken beer bottles and other plastic bottles. So you can see its a drinking spot. I think because of the rim fire  going on near Yosemite there weren\'t that many people on the road. At the end of my hike I did run into a woman with her dog coming down the trail. I will also bring more food with me next time so I can do a proper picnic. The front side has 3 or 4 picnic tables.', 'One of the most amazing hikes I have done! Short hike down a steep hill but worth every step! The water was cold and refreshing and the views were beyond amazing!', "After a short single track you come to a fork in the trail, go right. It's hot and dry this time of year (Aug 13) so it was a very pleasant surprise to find a lot of cool water in the cave. Enough to jump off rocks and not touch the bottom. For first-timers if you get nervous or tired swimming through the cave, to the sides of the cave there are footholds you can grab onto for a breather/regroup. Kids love this. We had a grandma with us and she was able to do this with a borrowed floatie. Floaties are a great idea so that you can lie on your back and look up at the top of the cave. Bring a waterproof cam or a waterproof sleeve for your iphone. You will get amazing pics and have an amazing time!!", "Different paths to get to the cave. Brought both my boxers. Sign at the easier trail says no pets allowed, but as long as you're a responsible pet owner you'll be ok. Water and weather today was amazing. ", 'My 5 star rating is not for the actual hike itself which is quite short and easy, but for the amazing cave at the end of the trail this is the best swimming spot my family has ever enjoyed. The coyote creek is the perfect place to cool off during the hot summer. The trail is so easy to find right on Parrots Ferry road, turn into the parking area when you se the sign for Natural Bridges. The. River runs through the cave which is about 100 feet long. There are plenty of shallow areas to stand, sit or play. It is deep (well over our heads) in the middle of the cave. The mouths of each cave end are great places to hang out. The formations are incredible to look at. Simply beautiful . Hihgly recommend for families with children who are able to dothe 2 miles roundtrip. Word of caution: watch for rattle snakes. We had an adventurous encounter with a rattle snake. Also make sure any snacks you leave along side the cave mouth while you are swimming are sealed up tightly. The squirrels are quite practiced at thievery.', "This a great hike for both families and the adventurous! There are 2 ways to complete the trail; one is a loop that starts at the end of Airola Rd. This one is more challenging of a hike and gets a little steep towards the end, I don't recommend taking kids this way. At the start of Airola Rd. right when you turn off the highway there is an easier trail that gently slopes down to the caves. Both trails lead to the same cave but there is actually another cave if you follow the creek downstream. There is a nice trail and a couple spots to dip in the water. Bring lunch because there is a lot of great picnic spots!", "Awesome trail for a spur of the moment lunch hike! Short and easy hike! Wear water shoes and swim suit if you plan on taking a dip, you can swim under the bridge to the other side too. Make sure to go on a weekday when there's less families and its quieter!", "Not much of a hike.  It's a very short trail, but it is still worth going.  It's a good beginner hike to take small children and the cave at the end of the trail was beautiful.", 'Nice little hike. Family friendly. WATCH OUT FOR POISON OAK/ Sumac.', 'a great hike to a beautiful location.  the hike back was a little more difficult but my 2, 9 year old boys and wife were no worse for the wear. swam the cave a bit but it got very deep.  panned earth from the bottom of the cave and pulled out a few lil treasures. location-wise one of my favorite.', 'this place is SO beautiful... i love it so much. i took my grandpa here and he loved it. it has some good sized fish in that cave too. great hike', 'March 9, 2013. / 11:30am-3:30pm / Sunny 64F (Felt like 70F)\n\nThis was definitely an adventure! My friends and I actually missed the, "main entrance" to the trail which is just after the turn off point to pull in and park your cars. If you drive to the end, you\'ll have to turn around, but there is a gate opening with a trail which is where we thought the start of it was. I\'ll just say, "the best path is the hardest earned."\n\nIf you choose the end of the road opening, it begins with a nice smooth trail, dirt walk/hike, and some scenic views then it becomes very jagged rock area, steep hills, drop off points, and some muddy run off areas. We actually found the opposite end of the Natural Bridges cave which my friends and I believe was well worth it, and much more impressive than the actual trail\'s cave. The trails were empty on our route and we could see some other hikers down below by the river who had accessed the area via the main trail or perhaps one of many covered, lesser traveled trails. A couple people were gold panning, some swimming through the cave, and a couple walking with their dog. DO NOT bring your animals or heavy equipment if you choose the end of the road trail. It is more of a moderate hike and while I did bring my DSLR regretting that I forgot my tripod, later during the hike I was happy that I had forgotten it due to the steep sloping of rocks and hills along the narrow trails. Amazing photo opportunities, but definitely not worth falling down for.\n\nThe cave itself on the intake of the Coyote River was utterly amazing. Don\'t be discouraged if you can\'t immediately find a trail leading down; I was tempted to slide down a steep sloped rock rainwater runoff before my friend\'s advised against it and I scoped out a higher trail that eventually lead down. You can get some great views and see faint light from where the outtake (main trail cave mouth) is shining through and the smooth limestone walls were a sight to see. A small hole shooting water out on the inner left went almost unnoticed until my friend pointed it out. The water is deep here, so tread carefully if you plan on walking through. Truly the gem of the adventurous hike there.\n\nThe main trail\'s attraction, the Natural Bridge, was beautifully laid with limestone and smoothed pebble stones beneath shallow waters accentuated the setting. We hit the time of day just right as the water was gleaming into the cave providing adequate lighting. A miniature waterfall from inside the cave provided peaceful sound among lots of water droplets all around. Be careful if your camera isn\'t waterproof! This area is shallow enough to wade through calf deep (I\'m 6\'5") though I didn\'t have the shoes nor wanted to take the chance falling with my equipment. There are some nice spots to sit as well as a table or two for a packed lunch which I advise as the trail should be explored thoroughly to take everything in.\n\nI will revisit this sometime in the future. Please check out the pictures as I have uploaded quite a few and make an attempt to take an off-beaten path to explore the other end of the cave!\n\nCheers and happy trails!', 'Beautiful place to be. The water was cold but  it was well worth it.', "We went hiking on a fairly warm day in Mid August. The hike was short and really well shaded. It was a fairly easy hike and has multiple splitting trails that lead to picnic areas. It can get confusing at some points but no big deal. We ventured to Lower Natural Bridge and really enjoyed the sound of the stream and a good lunch. We felt like continuing our hiking journey and continued downstream. Not a good idea. Lol It got really sketchy and dangerous. I wore shorts and my legs and shoes came out covered in some type small spikey weed seeds. Had splinters all over my fingers from removing those tacky seeds that stuck all over my shoes, socks and shorts.  So stopping at Lower Natural Bridge would have been a smarter choice. Fun hike but we drove from the East Bay (approx. 1hr 45min each way) and didn't feel the juice was worth the squeeze. Enjoyable but not worth the drive. ", 'I really enjoyed the scenic hike and the nartural bridge. The hike was easy, but I wish it was longer. I did notice a trail going beyone the natural bridge, but I was not sure where it led to. The natural bridge was very unique. The water was freezing, but I could bare it. Definitely worth swimming in! I would like to check out moaning caverns next time since it is just down the road. I really like caves and would like to see more if anyone has a place they would like to recommed, please let me know! ', 'Very cool trail and the cave was awesome!!!! My 3 year old son did great and our 2 dogs loved it. Be sure to bring your swim suits and WATER SHOES!!! Also bug/mosquito spray. ', "An fairly easy hike that has an amazing reward. Seeing those caves were unlike anything I've ever seen. So cool. ", "Great hike. If you follow the water downstream you will find the lower natural bridge. It's well worth the time to hike down to the lower cave. Very cool. ", 'Fairly easy trail.  Caves are interesting but not spectacular.', "It was alright. Bring a swimsuit for inside the cave which is pretty cool. The hike itself was dry and hot but not too difficult. Would've picked something else, but it was worth the bit of exercise.", "Upper Natural Bridge of Calaveras County is a great place to go and cool off for the day. The trail is well traveled and downhill. Going home was challenging because it's all uphill and after swimming all day my dog was even a little worn out.  Beautiful cavern that you can easily swim through to the other side.Careful to stay on the trail because poison oak is all around this area. Other than that, it makes for a great fun day.", 'This was a fun hike.  What made it so great was family time.  It was an easy hike going in, but you had to watch pretty closely as there were lots of tripping hazards.  The creek was running well and it was beautiful.  The cave was awesome, activities included catching frogs and crayfish, splashing, a picnic lunch.  After all that we did some exploring down stream from the cave and found some wonderful swimming holes when the weather warms up a bit more.  \nOn the hike back instead of going back the way you came, at the sign that tells you about the Natural Bridge, keep going, you can use this trail to explore the mouth of the cave.  If to keep taking the trail to the right it goes up and up and up.  While this is much more strenuous than the hike it, it creates a natural loop back to the abandoned road that you parked on on the way in.\nBe sure to check for ticks when you get back, our family of five + dog ended up with 7 ticks.', 'My husband and I went last weekend after he worked in the morning.  It was a good little hike.  We most enjoyed exploring in the cave once we got down there.  But in order to go further you would need a swimming suite.  We accidently went down the old trail.  Park up by the sign and the new trail head is before you hit the bathrooms.', 'This is an easy 3/4 mile hike one way into the canyon to a year-found stream which cuts through the surrounding limestone creating a cave and a "natural bridge".  The inside of the cave with water running from the ceiling creating waterfalls is amazing.  I hadn\'t been here in years, but it was my husbands first time and worth the short hike.  I recommend going early as it gets crowded on a summer day.  Plan on returning in the spring to see wildflowers, and redbuds (alot) in bloom.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
San Antonio Falls Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'rock climbing', 'walking', 'forest', 'partially paved', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'washed out']
hike_description: San Antonio Falls Trail is a 1.3 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Mt Baldy, California that features a waterfall and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['Incredible that this year-round waterfall is only 30 minutes away from the home I grew up in and didn't discover it until years after. This is a beautiful adventure on the mostly paved road. Getting to the lower section of the falls is a breeze, just follow the paved road up until you get to the first viewpoint of the falls then take the flat dirt path down to the lower section of the falls. 

If you are up for a little bit of "canyoneering" you can bear right at the dirt road and head up the rocks to the upper levels of the falls. If you have never seen it or cannot see it, I got some sick drone footage of the waterfall in its entirety here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y59ftztT7mU (towards the end)', 'great little hike, mostly paved until the last stretch to the falls that requires a little climbing and sliding down rocks. my husband, puppy, and i took the wrong way and ended up downstream and walked up the stream to the falls which i was happy to get lost over. nice water flow from the falls.', 'Great little trail. Paved and easy until you get to the very end, where it’s a little shimmying over rocks on a steep area for about 7 ft.', "It was an easy hike, and most of the way to the falls is a paved road. It was a great short hike with kids (5 & 10 year olds). The path to the falls is a bit sketchy. This trail also connects to more trails on Mount Baldy, if you want you can continue up the paved road past the turnout for the falls. There is a campground near the trailhead and a large parking lot with a pit toilet. You need an adventure pass to park and can't buy it at the lot. (I think they're available at the ranger station down the hill.)", "Easy paved trail with a gradual incline. Lots of loose gravel by the path (0.3mi) to the waterfall. Trail has a really nice waterfall at the end. Well maintained, I didn't see much trash on the trail.", 'Nice paved trail until you make it to the waterfall look out. If you have children take them down the rock path to the stream and then climb up to the waterfall. Wear shoes with traction! Rocks are loose. There is a narrow path off of the paved trail to get to the falls but it’s unsafe for children or maybe even pets. Went last weekend and it was a beautiful, crisp day.', 'Free climbed the 3rd tier. Super fun trail and not difficult at all considering half the trail is paved.', 'Falls might b year round here. 10/18 still a nice flow. Fire road all up until falls area. Trail remains fairly easy.  Id recommend this hike to everyone of all levels of hiking. Can’t wait to bring my little ones here. Rock climbed up to top of falls... was too much fun but a bit challenging (advanced hikers only please) may be tricky for some... Very easy to find parkingSeen signs of car break ins but not today. (FYI) Rr @ trail head Lots of places to camp.  ', 'Great quick hike with my dog , beautiful scenery and low temperatures... bring sweater and water...', 'A great quick Sunday morning hike. The incline initially is a great workout. Mostly paved and a small area of dirt with a step crossover. Great area for meditation not too many people.', 'Easy', 'Short, but nicely inclined walk on a paved road. The only dirt you will actually hike to the trail is loose and steep.Small, beautiful waterfall with an upper tier/pool that is dangerously accessible.Gorgeous views!Went on a Wednesday and there were only a couple other hikers. Had he waterfall to ourselves for about 30 minutes.', "Short hike on a paved fire road with steady incline. Great leg and cardio workout. The trail leads to a waterfall which requires careful footing to get to. Don't be hasty; go slow! Hike the rest of the fire road to the Notch and grab yourself a beer and lunch at the restaurant with a view of the valley below!", 'trail to the was hard to hike.  Unsafe in one area.  Waterfall was nice once able to get their.', 'Paved, with a considerable elevation gain for 20-25 min.  once at the falls, there is a bit of scrambling on a dirt trail to get to the falls itself.  lots of water year-round.Once there, it is possible to reach the upper tiers but very difficult.', 'Went on Saturday, June 16th to conquer Mt Baldy and I failed. We got past the lodge, past the steep ski lift climb, to the first major steep incline(drop offs on both sides on incline) and my fear of heights took over. I stood there frozen, unable to move on. How many people I wonder go through this? I will return back to Baldy for another try in the next few weeks. I am so disappointed in myself, my first hiking fail.', 'A quick fun hike. We all dipped our heads in the falls. It was very refreshing.  We continued up the road all the way to the Notch restaurant. We did the trip with kids and doigs.', 'short hike to a good view of a fall.', "This is an short hike primarily along a paved road with an incline at the beginning and once you arrive it's a nice and quiet with the steady roar of the waterfalls filling your ears. (my visit was on a Tuesday so I met only two other hikers while photographing and enjoying the area). Also, there was even a few snow mounds from the previous evenings light snowfall on the rocks when I arrived, but after two hours, they were gone. 
Even though this is a short hike, first time visitors BEWARE. At the end of the paved road, you must traverse a short stretch (15 ft?) of an incline using only hand and foot rocks and this deterred four visitors as I returned from my hike.", 'Short and mostly paved fire road the trail at the end to get to the falls is a bit scary and it’s just all cliffrock, one person at a time.', 'We got so lucky to experience this majestic waterfall with lots of snow. Best part was that it was the easiest and shortest hike on a paved road for most of the trail.', 'First time getting there last weekend love the drive and it was not difficult to get there saw the sign from the road. The trail is near the sky lifts., it’s mostly an incline the water fall is not far from where you started the water was very low for not much rain and snow yet. It is well maintain the trail is a little wide for cars to drive up it to the restaurant so be prepared for that sharing the road. . I did not finish the whole trail planning to go back this coming weekend. Love the great view', 'Hiked here on leg on Mt. Baldy hike. Water is low at this time.', 'Pretty easy hike to the falls! It gets a little slippery during some parts of the trail but nothing too difficult. Make sure you explore further down the creek — the view is incredible.', 'Nice waterfall. Stopped by on my way to MT. Baldy. Not much water falling like in previous years at this time.', 'Lovely views', 'Easy to climb, lovely views', 'Did this with the family late afternoon. All incline until you get to the creek, but very easy with a little bit of hiking experience. Took 20 minutes to get to the Falls from the parking area. Recommend doing it around early Spring for max water output.', 'paved road that starts off a bit steep. Once you arrive at the Fall you can hike in the creek bed or continue on up the mountain.', 'Took the kids today, nice short out and back to see the falls. Looking forward to coming back when we have more time!', '', "Went to see the San Antonio Falls, a lot easier hike than we anticipated.  Another gentleman stated that another 3 miles up was the ski lodge, and we decided to continue on.  I'm so happy we did, it was beautiful hike with beautiful views.  The temp was very cool when the wind would blow and up on top of the lodge area was cool as well.  I would definitely do this hike again.", 'The majority of the trail is paved. Waterfall was beautiful, running crystal clear water. We got to watch search and rescue do some rappelling down the falls. Stroller friendly up to the dirt  trail, due to the heavy rains the trail has some tricky washed out areas...I would say 5 years old max age limit, due to the washed out area. Need a forest parking pass available at the Mt. Baldy visitors center.', 'I wouldnt rate this as moderate. Its a very easy hike. My wife and I are somewhat rookie hikers and she did it with a 20 lb baby strapped to her. A fun short hike for a weekend day!', 'I love this short hike.  Winter time is the best.', 'Beautiful easy hike', 'Gorgeous waterfall so fresh and cold but shortest trail less', "Nice scenic walk, its actually a small paved road that leads u up to the falls. It looked really beautiful up there yesterday because there had been some snowfall. All in all we got some great pics and took in some fresh mountain air.  I think it would be fun for children and families who aren't avid hikers but want to get out and enjoy some nature.", 'Great easy hike out and back. Highly recommend it especially with a strong water flow.', 'Lovely hike with gorgeous falls. Fairly easy to get to. Just tread carefully as you pick your way along the creek bed to the falls themselves once the trail leaves the road.', 'Easy hike, but steep. Very heavily trafficked during weekend. Lot of people use it as a break before going on bigger hikes, but you can get to the base of the waterfall.', '', 'Short walk for an awesome fall', 'Don't use Google to map which road to turn on to the falls because it takes you one street too early. Make sure you search for the actual road name and not the falls name themselves for mapping navigation in Google. My bad!When you're at the correct road, it's obvious since there's a sign thanking you for your adventure pass (yes you need one).This hike is short and up a private paved road (which you must park at the base). I knew from other reviews that the road was paved, so this didn't ruin the hike for me. The views and rocky cliff sides, and the birds and squirrels everywhere still made this a nice short hike.We went on a Tuesday at 10 am and just barely beat a light amount of foot traffic.At the top of the road, there is a great viewpoint of the falls, and the dirt trail begins. The "steep" part mentioned in other reviews is probably 6-10 feet and really no big deal since you're walking sideways with the wall and there's plenty of traction. Once you pass this and round the corner, you're at the base of the falls.And magnificent falls they are. Totally worth this short trek to go see.', 'This trail is mostly paved road.Not my type of hike I like to do but we made the best of it by creating our own trail through the Mt. and Creek in the end we made it a very intense hike loved the waterfall', "Very easy hike, you can't even tell you walked a mile but great scenery. There is one spot that can be hard for some people, is crossing one side of the mountain which is about 4 feet to get to the other side in order to get closer to the water fall. The waterfall is beautiful! Definitely recommend going.", 'not really a "hike" follow along a fire road to a very rocky small waterfall. entire area is mostly just dirt and rock. doesn't give you that "mountain feel". however, if you're looking for a steep spot to go for a walk, this is the place for you. just follow the road to the top and turn around. Elevation gain is pretty high, nice stroll for casual walkers looking for a decent power walk. entire hike is a paved road and well maintained.', 'perfect for a quick little get away', 'Pretty easy hike relaxing', 'Great hike easy beautiful view Kid friendly my four year old did it without promble It is cold And their is some snow ', 'Beautiful views of nature, easy trail to the waterfall. Friendly hikers along the way', 'short uphill hike to the falls. very picturesque. went on 2/7/17 - light snow, but the trail was clear. the falls are really flowing right now, reminds me of falls akin to northern California. worth the drive from Anaheim.', 'Short walk to the waterfall. You can continue onto the trail for a much further hike to the top of the ski lifts.', 'Very easy if just going to the falls, nice views.', 'Short but easy. Cool waterfall.', "really nice road after the parking lot, only 1 mile to get to the wonderful. It's good to enjoying a hot day,", 'It was so awsome. Hiked to the falls and played in the water. Water was so cool breath taking.', 'Awesome views..!', "perfect challenge don't start at the start by the waterfall way more of a challenge", 'Good beginner trail', 'Took a hike to the falls just to loosen up my legs prior to doing Mt Baldy the following day. It was a relatively easy and short hike. I made it 3.71 miles taking Falls Rd to the falls, then doubling back from there and heading up Baldy Road for a little while. I turned down the service road/trail that lead to the top level of the Ski Lift parking lot. That was a very steep down hill and the bottom of it was our start point for hiking Baldy the next day in honor of our disabled veterans "Climb for Heroes Fundraiser". From there I had to walk down all five parking levels and down the road to get back to my car. Again it was an easy day. Great views and the falls were flowing very well. There were two individuals repelling from the falls just I as arrive.', 'Great hike, with great views. We started at the Falls Rd trailhead and took the fire road up to Baldy Notch, from there we headed North West towards the Devils Backbone. Snow covered portions of the trail and crampons were used by some to get to the peak. Views were awesome from the backbone as well as from the peak which was completely snow covered. From the peak we proceeded to the South towards the Baldy bowl passed the ski hut (which has a little outhouse in the back), and followed the trail the rest of the way down to the fire road we started on. The trail down was pretty slick and crampons were used off and on. This is NOT an "easy" hike, there is over 4,000ft in elevation gain and a total of about 10.4 miles. The elevation plays a factor as well. You could call it easy if you take the lift up to the notch and hike a total of 3.2 miles to the peak, but thats cheating. Its not the most difficult hike and the trail is well maintained, I can see why this is used as a training hike for Whitney. BTW check out Socalhiker.net for info on this and other great hikes in socal.', "Easy hike, not too dangerous even during winter (caution and balance are still required). Been here several times and there's always plenty of water running downstream. Best part is touching the fresh water as it falls.", "This waterfall is an unfortunate victim of the same thing as many local spots of this type. Graffiti on the boulders. It hurts my heart when I see it, because years ago this was not a problem in wild spaces. The hike is mostly easy, on the road. There is one sketchy spot that is on the side of a hill it curves around, and if you're not sure footed it could be tricky. I have a bad back and a bad knee, but I managed it. You want to wear hiking boots for safety, and trekking poles might help if you are uncertain.No waterfall in this region is going to be too impressive in the middle of a drought in the middle of summer, but there was water flowing when I was there recently. It's nice as far as a spot to listen to the water falling, and take a few pictures… but as I said there is graffiti. The hike is not excessively difficult. Use bug repellent, or have a headnet, or possibly both. FLIES omg. The reviews I have read complaining about flies at Manker Flats Campground across the road are no joke. The flies are irritating as heck. It's worth seeing if you've never been there but I can't say that I would take the time to go again now that I have.", "This was an easy hike to do. It was a short distance to reach the waterfall which was beautiful and full of flowing water. There was even snow still left on the side of the hill. We continued back up the trail and took it around and down to the ski lift parking area. I'm not sure of the total distance, but it was worth going back to do again. The scenery was breathtaking and we even came across some baby chipmunks.", 'This trail definitely gives you a great work out.  We took the trail all the way up to the Ski lift and ran into some snow/ice on the trail. This trail is a must do trail.....The views are so beautiful!', 'Nice trail. The views alone are worth the trip. It is great for children. And if you want to hike n the area, you have platy of options.', 'Easiest hike did this with my 7 month old son in his stroller great view best place to get away quick . Uphill and off paved road to get to waterfall but worth it', 'Very easy hike!  The footpath is paved for wheelchair access unless you want to break from the trail and touch the water.  The falls are very refreshing in the hot summer!', 'Easy hike. I took it from the road near the ski lifts. Uphill a short distance on a pace road. Went right after a snow storm. The falls are spectacular. I would do this one over an over. My dog loved running in the deep snow and the power of the falls is simply breath taking. ', 'This is a beautiful fall, its somewhat steep climbing to the falls. please be careful its easy to slip once you try climbing the side of the waterfall to reach the top. There are guide ropes to try and help you on the side but i wouldnt trust the bindings. During October 2012 there was plenty of water at the falls.', 'Nice, easy hike to falls.   Pleasant adventure.', "This is a nice relaxing walk. I was able to bring my 22 month old daughter. I had to carry her in some small rocky areas, but it wasn't too bad. She had a blast.", "fun.. and very kid friendly. My 5 year old boy took a couple of rests in the shade along the trail, but it wasn't anything he couldn't handle. I will be going again the waterfall was an awesome sight. ", "http://www.simpsoncity.com/hiking/sanantoniofalls.html

The above link was very helpful.  The gate that you have to pass to go up the paved path is on a side road on your left hand side just past the the Manker Flats camp ground which will be on your right hand side off Mt. Baldy Rd.  This was an easy hike as half of it was up a paved road.  The rock/dirt trail that leads from the paved road to the falls could be a little rough if you're clumsy like me because of some of the rocks.  I also made the mistake of thinking that I had to climb lower to get to the falls, so I climbed down some rocks that were on my left side when I went off the paved road.  Turns out there's nothing but wood and bushes down there.  So I climbed back up and continued on the dirt around a corner of the mountain and found the dirt/rock trail to the falls.  Once I got to the falls I was in complete awe!  Since I came on a day where there was a little drizzle and overcast, I had the whole place to myself the whole time I was there, which was about 45 minutes.  I played in the water, took lots of pictures, and just marveled at all the beauty.  This may be a short hike, but well worth it.", 'Great trail for beginners to get a good glimpe of the San Antonio falls.  There were lots of other pleasant hikers on the weekend.  First half of the trail is paved up to the falls and then dirt/rock trails from that point.  ', 'Nice easy beginner trail with a nice view at the turnaround point.', 'Great little road slightly uphill all the way to the falls.  A few houses off to the left are hidden away and don't ruin the scenery.  I took my two boys 8 and 3 up the hill and the little guy made it just fine on his own.  The trek to the falls fromt he road is a little dicy for small kids, be sure they don't get too far in front of you.  The falls are pleasant.  Quite a number of people (probably due to its ease of access) but my boys thoroughly enjoyed it and my little guy felt like he accomplished something.  I'd take my youngest there again in a heartbeat if he asked, though I'll probably try to find a trail with a bit more of a "wilderness" feel.', 'San Antonio falls is a special place for me. When I was a kid my grandparents took me here and I had a blast! Once I got a car I tried to find it again and I did. Now I hunt waterfalls in every canyon I can get to.', 'Easy and great to do with a loved one. Its the best during the snowy season. ', 'Great Hike to do with the family, although I suggest doing this Hike early before the crowds arrive.  We arrived at the Falls by 8:30 and had the place to ourselves.   Pack in a towell to dry off, highly suggest getting underneath the falls to really experience this place.  This Hike is a short one about 20-30 minutes to hike in so I do not suggest this hike if your looking for more of burn buster.', 'Nice quick hike to a beautiful waterfall. In the winter it is amazing, snow all around and the falls have quite a heavy flow. In the spring you can walk right up to the falls and take a quick shower.. Quite chilly snow water though! Have been there three times in the last year. ', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Lake Miramar Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'wheelchair friendly', 'kid friendly', 'stroller friendly', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'road biking', 'trail running', 'walking', 'lake', 'paved', 'views']
hike_description: Lake Miramar Trail is a 4.9 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near San Diego, California that offers scenic views and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['Easy access. Paved', 'Beautiful place and easy, flat trail', 'It’s an ok location for road biking however there are some sharp turns and the amount of people walking impedes bike travel making it hard to get a good workout in. Go on a weekday and be careful of the amount of potholes on the road.', 'Excellent 5-mile paved loop (with desert, hilly trail options). Easy to get to, easy to park. Great view of city and sunset from the dam.', 'great when it isnt crowded!', 'Great easy walk!', 'It’s out and back at the moment. The dam is closed for repairs until October 11th 2018. Great place though!', 'Easy walk and nice views at sunset. Lots of bathrooms too and free parking.', 'Easy walk with the bob stroller. Plenty of places to stop and take in the view.', 'Nice view and almost flat with frequent breeze I would definitely love to go back', 'Nearly completely flat paved trail. Perfect for a recovery run. Gets crowded later in the am on the weekends.', 'A very relaxing hike. The 5 mile distance will give you a nice exercise.', "Super easy trail to either walk or bike. Pathways are plenty wide for most of the trail, but be courteous of walkers if you're biking. Likewise, don't hog the trail if you're in a group. Parking is usually plentiful, and there are a lot of place to have a meal afterwards nearby.", 'It’s a very pretty trail around the lake. It’s completely flat the entire route. It can be very busy on the weekends, so the earlier you start, the better', 'Amazing ! It’s a must', 'The trail has a paved path and also a regular trail path. Gets too crowded after 9 on weekends.', 'Great trail to get some biking in.', 'beautiful', 'I really enjoyed this walk it was peaceful and not a lot of road noise for the most part my two small children enjoyed it as well. There isn’t a whole lot for them to do because all along the trail are signs for rattle snakes beyond the trail so I did not allow them to go stomping into the brush. And it’s kind of annoying that they allow cars to drive on the path to get to a fishing spot on the other side of the lake. I’m not a huge fan of walking so close to moving vehicles with me two small children. Despite all that it is still a very nice 5 mile walk very peaceful.', 'Great to go on with kids. The parking lot is small and might have to wait for one to open. Also there are paddle boats and such for rent.', 'Great easy hike with a paved path all the way around the lake.', 'Nice easy paved road walk', "It's the best way to go for a great walk or run.", '', 'This such a great loop! Lots of scenic views with the inlets of the lake! Get there early- parking fills us fairly quickly after sunrise on the weekends!', 'Loved this run! All pavement and nice and flat. Beautiful view and very friendly people doing the same, just getting some fresh air!', 'This is a great place for both my pregnant self and 3 year old daughter - flat, easy, mostly shaded with lots of intereating nature sights.', 'I often walk this on Saturday mornings with my dog. It’s easy and pleasant. You’ll see a lot of people on the trail, but it doesn’t feel crowded. My only complaint is the parking fills up rather quickly.', 'Pristine views. Quite and peaceful. A few “off road” trails available.', 'Nice paved trail around the lake. It’s about 5 miles.', 'Nice view and clean road. Some shades as well. Always love to see a goose named Louis at the end:)', 'For an easy walk, this is probably the easiest trail that you could ask for. It is a nice length. I also explored a connecting primitive path up to a little park.', 'Nice trail. FYI was closed on Thanksgiving so you have to double back and park at the library,', '', '', 'Love rhis walk wasy and its almoat 5 miles loviez!! ❤', 'Good for early morning walk', 'Great place for an evening walk, run, or bike ride!', 'This is my weekly running training ground. Highly recommended for training. Great, fun people around.', '', "It's a nice road trail that follows the perimeter of the lake. Took the stroller and the twins and enjoyed it but there's not much excitement. It's predominantly flat and barely any shade. The dirt trail that is by the water is less used but wouldn't work with a stroller. Some spots got pretty narrow.", 'Excellent urban oasis, my first and definitely not my last visit.', 'There exists a 3.5 mile trail up into the hillside. Great for mtn biking and hiking. Photo added so you can see where the trail begins and ends.', "Nice mellow trail, reminiscent of Lake Murray only you can walk all the way around this lake. One thing I didn't like is that vehicles are allowed on the trail/road, making it a little nerve racking with my kids when people didn't keep the 10 mph speed limit.", '', 'beautiful walk around the lake.', "With both pavement and off-road paths, multiple barbecues and picnic benches along the trail, as well as Port-a-potty's throughout, the added incentive of cool ocean breezes and beautiful views makes this one of our favorite places to go for a bike ride or jog!", 'Easy bike ride, pretty views with the flowers blooming.', 'Calm and beautiful. Two different trails. The follow each other. So you can be off-road or on pavement. And you can stop at anytime to dip your feet in the water.', 'Fun five mile loop with scenic view.', 'My wife and I were able to take a relaxing stroll around this lake this morning and had a great time. It is great for all ages and abilities. There were a lot of bikers and people jogging and may others walking like we were. It is a great place to take your dog as well. We will be back!', 'Great place to walk your dog;)', 'Paved road the entire way and half of the distance is jail-like fenced', "There is a trail that was too muddy from recent rains to run on, and there is a paved path/road that all visitors were on. So, it isn't off-road hiking. However, my husband and I went specifically for a run and did not want a lot of elevation changes for this one. This is a great, solid 5 mile run. It was pretty populated on a cool, sunny day, but not so much that we felt crowded in our run. Great for cyclists, especially kiddos. There are port-a-johns at a few points along the loop. It is a beautiful area with a great breeze flowing, shady and sunny spots, depending on what you like. :) Parking lots are not that big, so parking might be difficult. We were able to park in the larger lot without problem.", 'Simple trail for walk, jog and bike.', 'Fun outting. Trail is paved and not too much traffic. Hit a great breeze by the Dam on the way back.', 'Nice and Easy hike, great for kids. Bring your bike, skates, or running shoes. Paved road around the lake, but also a nice hiking trail parallel to it. It is a loop trail, however to our disdain the gate on the other side was locked and there were no signs to indicate this little important fact. We had to go back half way around the lake without completing the loop. Real bummer. Parking was a challenge as we had to park on the road, because the vehicle entrances to the park was closed. We are still wondering who was the "genius" that on such a busy day as ThanksGiving Day, decided to lock the gates on the trail and the main entrance.', 'Very friendly. Lots of portable bathrooms. Make sure you take a lot of water.', "I run here frequently because it's so much better than a treadmill. People who come here are commonly friendly and of all age ranges. Some are training for competition and others are just out for a stroll. Great view of the sunset and beautiful view over Mira Mesa, just be conscious of when the gates close so your car doesn't get locked in overnight. There are portable restrooms throughout the lake loop, but no water fountains. Overall, great place!", 'This is a wonderful little local trail. Beautiful sunsets and views of the lake.', 'so fun kid friendly', 'Nice road, but even at off-peak hours, there are lots of hikers, some of whom insist on walking three across the lanes, or even down the middle, making it hard for bikes to pass.', 'Flat walking trail with a lot of people. Not the type of trail I prefer but the views were nice.', 'Nice relaxing walk', 'More of a walk, but at least it got me outdoors. No shade so take your hat and sunglasses.', 'Better for bikes and roller blades than walking', 'fantastic and safe for kids biking. I loved it.', 'I love it ', 'I went for 6 mile run here with a friend from work last weekend at 6 am Saturday morning. At that point the small lot was already getting full which I view as promising. Beautiful view of the lake and surrounding areas made the run enjoyable. There were some slow moving bicyclists but for the most part there are serious people here ready to work out! Will definitely repeat!', "This wasn't a bad place to walk, however there were a few too many people out doing the same thing. Early morning is probably the best time to go or later in the evening, but keep in mind the gates do close at 8pm.", 'Extremely easy. Beautiful for the area. Nice view overlooking Mira Mesa/Miramar', 'Sweet ride!', 'The lower trail along the lake was well maintained and much more scenic than the upper paved road. Plenty of great spots to stop and enjoy the views and a snack.', 'Already went 3 times in the last 10 days. My favorite spot after Torrey Pines State ReserveYou can run on asphanlt or if you adventurous enough you can take the trail (almost next to lake)Very safe. People always there. Even today (drizzle)Enjoy your ride!!!', 'Very nice trail. You can either take the lower trail (dirt path better for dogs and people who get shin splints from pavement). It felt very safe as there were a fair amount of people & dogs walking or biking around the lake.', "Nice and easy loop around the lake and it's a perfect 5.0 miles. Take the dirt trail below the paved one, that is more fun. Just be mindful of crowds, gets super crowded, parking is tough - you may have to park  in the public library lot across the road. Occasionally you will see some rude bikers and folks who go super fast with no respect to speed limit. Watch out for them and stay at the corner of the road.", "Always and easy go to for me. If I'm looking for not too strenuous then this is the place I go. Mostly flat, always busy and filled with friendly folks. You'll see mom and dads, grandparents, kids and strollers, bikes, skate boards, runners and walkers.

This is one of the more friendly places around to go and get some miles behind you.

If you're also a geocacher.... budget extra time as there are some fun caches along the way.", "It's a lovely, relaxing paved walk open to walkers, dogs and bicycles. This is the very heart of the problem. Because it is such an easy walk, bicycle riders go too fast. I am a witness to a near fatal accident where a cyclist had his head down and was going so fast that he careened off a gate and was knocked unconscious (he remained so for 3 months!). Another recent accident killed an experienced cyclist. My friend was walking and hit by a child on a bike. 8 months and 6 surgeries later, she is still not walking well. 
People don't stay on their side of the walk, they let their dog leashes reach across the path (and don't pick up poop) and create the opportunity for more accidents. 
There has to be more control of bicycles on this walk, or they should be completely banned. I'm a cyclist, but this is dangerous for the walking public.", 'A great way to get in 5 miles and some pretty views.  Take the low trail instead of the paved one if you want to hike in nature instead of pavement.', 'Nice and easy walk around the lake.  Bring water for dogs on hotter days and make sure to wear sunglasses or a hat', "Easy walk around a 5 mile loop. Dog friendly as long as they are on leash. Very clean and there were even bathrooms and trashcans along the way. Bring water -- it gets toasty and there's not a lot of shade.", 'I live close by and this is the place were I train for my half marathons. Did walking, running and biking around this lake a lot since 1997. I consider this my home. Me casa su casa', "Had to put trail running here as they don't have an option for just running.  The loop is exactly 5 miles with gradual easy rollers.  It is paved the entire way, so this is a good way to get a precise run in when you want to time yourself.  I run here frequently.  I will say that this is NOT A HIKE despite what other reviews say.", 'great cachihg and hiking with my friend Steven', "Great hiking, went today and the weather was perfect and the trails weren't too crowded.", 'I really enjoy doing the 5 mile loop. Very peaceful and beautiful views. Lots of people and definitely great exercise outdoors. I do this regularly!', 'I really liked this trail.  There were bike riders, walkers, runners, and rollerbladers.  It was really nice and serene.  We walked on the dirt part of the loop until it was only paved for the last portion but there is a completely paved part of the trail too.', 'Beautiful easy run. Perfect for beginners or anyone training for runs. The loop is 5 miles and paved with asphalt so easy on the joints and knees.', 'Easy walk and great for running!', "The loop is a perfect distance, and there are two options for completing it: a trail and a concrete road. The trail is very shaded, where as the road is in the open sun. It's a great walk, especially for bringing your dog. The lake is beautiful and quite relaxing. I never see many people here either.", 'Perfect for Jogging and easily accessible. Been here several times!', 'I feel that I kinda take this trail for granted since its very very accessible.  I want to take the time to appreciate it by giving a review.  I go here to go running, the loop is a perfect distance and it is very well marked.  It was great to know that when the park is closed, they have a ranger that ensures everyone has safely exited the premises.  The ducks and geese are entertaining and the benches are very helpful.  The bathrooms are well stocked with toilet paper and hand soap-from my experience and I never had any issues with parking despite of the amount of people.  Very family friendly and you can have a picnic if you please.  Highly recommended and take a stroll when you get a chance.', 'Nice easy flat walk, great for the dogs.', "Great place for people to walk/jog/run/or cycle. Can get a bit crowded on the road, but nothing too crazy. Used to place to train for the San Diego Marathon a couple of years ago. I like to come here for an easy cardio workout if I can't make time for long hikes around Southern California.", 'This trail is best for walking, jogging, running or biking considering its flat. The trail surrounds the lake, has porta potties & benches along the way.', 'This is a beautiful lake, mere walking around it is so relaxing. ', 'very nice', "I've hiked, walked and jogged here for many years, and this is one of my favorite spots to do my workouts.

Most of the time I use the paved road, but sometimes I take the trails as well.

This is a flat course and is Easy.  It can get hot here during the midday hours, but the early morning and late afternoons get very crowded and it's hard to find parking (I usually just walk to the lake then continue my cardio workout (sometimes, to avoid the parking problems).", 'Easy, flat paved 5 mile loop.', 'I went biking here, very chill and relaxing experience. Not challenging at all, probably best if youre just looking for a easy walk. ', "There are two trails, both 5 miles.  One is paved all the way around.  There's a lower dirt trail that goes about 2/3 of the way around (then joins up with the paved trail).  The dirt trail can be muddy after rain.", "This is a paved trail around Lake Miramar.  It's good for an easy walk or bike ride.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Panoramic Hill - Chaparral Peak - Strawberry Canyon Loop - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers']
hike_description: Panoramic Hill - Chaparral Peak - Strawberry Canyon Loop is a 5.7 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Berkeley, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.
