user_texts:
["Hike of a lifetime! My best backpacking experience so far.
We didn't resupply during our trip and it made the first few days extremely difficult, until our packs got a bit lighter - think about it twice before you commit to the fully autonomous mode! Also make sure you have a plan B in case your water filter breaks on day 2... but we were lucky and none of us got sick even after drinking unfiltered water from rivers and lakes for two weeks.", "Check out our trip video at Trail Perspective on YouTube:
https://youtu.be/EyCEu-icxrw 
& https://youtu.be/GLPpZOIsYAg

Did a section of the JMT from Happy Isles to Rush Creek (Near Reds Meadow) in September.  Crazy gorgeous section of the trail, wish we could've had the time to go all the way to Whitney.  My favorite part of this section was the last part of Donahue Pass to Thousand Island Lake.", "I did this trail in August with my best friend and it was awesome! It was hard of course, but the weather was almost perfect the whole time. There were a couple rain/hail storms but that was about it. Mosquitos only bothered us a few times, and it wasn't that bad. We did 21 days with three resupplies at Red's Meadow, Muir Trail Ranch, and Independence. Muir Trail Ranch was a disappointment with no services other than picking up our buckets, and we realized later that we should have done Vermillion Valley instead as many hikers said they had an awesome experience.", 'I hiked the JMT solo starting from Yose Valley in 2015, but got off the trail in mile 180 (Kearsarge Pass Jct) because of ankle and knee injuries. In 2015, I resupplied twice: Reds Meadow and Muir Trail Ranch (estimated 9 days of food until Whitney Portal). I finished the last 31 miles in 2016 starting from Cottonwood Lakes to Kearsarge Pass (it’s about 72 miles including Mt. Whitney, Lake Charlotte, and Kearsarge Pass Trail). I didn’t resupply for this 7 day hike. Final thoughts about the JMT: challenging, nonetheless it was an amazing experience. Easier to get a permit going NOBO than. SOBO. Trail is easy to navigate in low snow year, plenty of water sources on the trail, mozzies are relentless in July, beautiful views, mountains and lakes for days, and great people on the trail. Transportation set up: I left my car in Lone Pine  and hitched a ride to Yose for my 2015 hike and to Horseshoe Meadows trailhead in 2016. Getting back to my car from Kearsarge Pass, I hired a shuttle service to take me back to Lone Pine. Reasonable rate.', 'amazing. not to be missed.', "This is a fantastic trail that should be considered by all that love the high sierra.   I did this in July 2015 over 15 days starting south of Whitney and ending in happy isles.  Days where long but not outragous.  I was on my own but never felt lonely.  Lots of people on the trail to talk to if you want.  You can also just hie along and people will leave you alone.  Finding a camp site or water wasn't hard.  I tried to finish my day making it halfway up a pass.  This way I could rest the night and make it over the pass for breakfast the next day.  Be sure to pack lite, I mean really only bring what you need as that pack certainly gets heavy after 15 days on the trail.", 'Not a very hard trail for downhill but it offers a great view of the Nevada fall and the valley. It also has a small cascade which you will walk under that brings you a great experience for the summer.', 'This is my favorite trail so far! I hiked it 5 times alone. I liked it so much that I even hiked it twice in one month (2009). Then I went back to hike it in 2011, 2012 and 2014. It’s time to do it again! I always hiked it in 9 - 12 days. I would like to spend more time on it, like 2 weeks to relax also.', 'hiked this in 2012...it was meant to be a thru hike but partner got sick so we had to leave right about the half way point. I went back 2 years later and finished it. One of the crown jewels in US places to backpack.', "This is the single most impactful trail I've ever experienced. The JMT, when done it its 211 mile entirety, will yield lifelong cherished memories. Its not easy, and you must do months of preparation. Its beauty is absolutely breathtaking. I cannot recommend this trail highly enough. Six stars.", 'I am not a poet. Words cannot describe how humbling gods work is. Over every peak, the trail gets more beautiful.', 'Did this hike in 5th grade and planning on doing it again this year! It was an amazing experience and such great scenery. But extremely difficult and can be tough to follow if you do not have an experienced hiker with you.', 'One of the most beautiful sections of the PCT', 'check out two applications: Guthook JMT for $9.99 and Hikerbot for crowd source information. Both have better and more detailed info than Alltrails.', 'most wonderful, difficult, beautiful, amazing trail ever!  Go NOBO from Whitney.', 'Did the whole length SB July 2016. Completed the thru-hike in 14 days with one resupply at John Muir Ranch. Amazing experience and completely life changing!', 'most amazing experience in my life', 'Beautiful in June. Expect some uphill challenges.', 'Above and beyond expectations', '*Edit from last review

.. rather, AllTrails lists the Snow Creek Falls, Tenaya Lake, Yosemite Valley via JMT loop as dog-legal', 'In doing a bit of research, I found that only sections of the JMT is dog-legal. AllTrails lists the Yosemite portion dog-legal, as per written description and according to map; Snow Creek trail, as well. Having a dog on-trail could result in a fine and possibly being escorted out of the park.

"The National Parks (both Yosemite and Sequoia / King's Canyon) do not allow dogs on any parts of the trails. The only sections that would allow a dog are those in the National Forests. John Muir Wilderness in Sierra National Forest and the Ansel Adams Wilderness in Inyo National Forest. Therefore, you'd have the trailheads from Muir Trail Ranch to Gem Lake (just short of Donahue) to hike with a dog (about 90 miles or so)."', 'Life-changing trip! I completed the trail SOBO from Tuolumne Meadows to Whitney portal and from July 16th to the 31st. This year was a heavy snowfall year which made for some snowy passes and high/fast flowing rivers and creeks, but it also made for an exceptionally beautiful trail! Saw the most beautiful views, met the best people, and had one of the most memorable experiences of my life. Make time to do this at some point in your life, would recommend to anyone!', 'Absolutely life changing!', 'My wife and I hiked the JMT NOBO via Whitney Portal to Happy Isles in Yosemite, with a resupply over Kearsarge Pass to Onion Valley. With the resupply our total mileage was 238 miles.Beautiful weather the entire 21 days', 'Joined up with this trail on my way back down from Nevada Falls and it has some really great views.  I recommend taking Mist Trail up and this one back down to the Valley. I was glad I did it that way because I got some amazing photos on this hike.', 'I love that trail.  I wish I was that forest ranger who worked out of the post in Evolution Valley.', 'Whoa Nelly!!!!', "One of the most incredible things I've ever seen. astounding.", 'Did this while I was hiking the PCT. Summit Whitney. Great two weeks.', "I hiked the JMT in summer of 2016. Solo. North Bound in 25 days. By far, the hardest thing I had ever done to date. An incredible empowering experience that I'll never quite be able to do a good job of putting into words. Unforgettable! If you're thinking about it. Do it. Go for it. After you do your homework and preparation.", 'Incredible views.', 'Amazing trail.', 'John Muir Trail from Devils Postpile to Happy Isles in Yosemite Valley
August 3 – 12, 2015

Monday 3rd:  We drove all day through the barren wasteland of Nevada.  The trip was made enjoyable by listening to Julia Sweeney’s standup, “Letting Go of God.”  Hilarious!
When we arrived in Mammoth, we went on the Reds Meadow Shuttle down to Devils Postpile.  The Postpile was formed less than 100,000 years ago when a cooling lava flow cracked into multi-sided columns.  The basalt was exposed and smoothed by glaciers. 
Our first night we slept at the Whispering Pines at June Lake.  The outside view from the hotel was beautiful.

Tuesday 4th:  Today was dedicated to Yosemite.  We started with breakfast at Nicely’s restaurant in Lee Vining, California.  Then we went to Tuolumne Meadows to drop off our food cache in the bear boxes.  Next, we headed down to Yosemite Valley.  That place was crazy!  It was packed with people, most of them speaking different languages (e.g. the tower of Babel).  People clearly come from all over the world to enjoy this place.  
We took a hike in Tuolumne Grove to see the giant redwood trees.  I had never seen redwoods before and they are truly magnificent, ancient, and massive.
Yosemite is filled with granitic plutons, cooled, hardened and then uplifted and exposed by erosion.  There are mountains of white-gray granite everywhere.  One such rock is called El Capitan.  I think Brennon and Devon should climb it.  
While we were standing there admiring the “big rock”, a mama doe and her two baby fawns walked out of the bushes right in front of us.  They wandered around for a minute and then happily hopped back into the forest.
Yosemite Falls is the highest waterfall in the United States.  Although it was a little anemic (not much water) its sheer height was impressive.
We left the truck and trailer in the Yosemite Valley and decided to take the car.  The only problem was that the car was on the tow dolly and it was completely dead.  Luckily some good Samaritans helped us shove the Mazda off the dolly and we jumped it with Uncle Steve’s truck.  We had gas station burritos for lunch.
At the end of the day we stopped at Tuolumne Meadows to scope out the backpacker’s camping spots and find the trailhead.  Mission accomplished except one tiny problem.  We’d walked around so long we forgot where we parked the car.  After much walking and searching we eventually found the car (in 15 min parking) and headed back to Nicely’s for dinner, and Motel 6 for one last night in a bed.
Day 1:  We left Devils Postpile early Wednesday morning.  For lunch we stopped at one of the small Trinity lakes along the trail.  Each time we stopped to eat we also had to pump water for our bottles.  Lunch consisted of granola bars, trail mix, beef jerky, and craisins.  After a little more hiking we came upon Gladys Lake, which I thought was even grander than the little Trinity lake. 
Along the trail we met some interesting people.  Today was the first time we met our friends from Canada, two men from British Colombia (although the older gentleman spoke French?).  They shared our lunch spot, and they were headed the same way we were; we would see them again before our hike was finished.  We also met a nice couple from Israel heading south.  The third pair of fellow hikers I will call the Swiss Miss Twins (although they really came from New Hampshire).  They were both blond with two braids in their hair.  They were clearly experienced hikers even mentioning a hike they did in South America, but today one of them had blisters.  They were heading to Red’s Meadow to take a day or two off and see if they could rest the feet and continue on.  We hiked 7.5 miles today, climbing 2000 feet, and Rosalie Lake was our first campsite.  It was by far the most beautiful of the lakes I had seen that day.  

Day 2:  Breakfast is a Steve’s Special – a mixture of several different kinds of cereal and a yummy rehydrated milk powder (I promise it tastes better than I make it sound).  We left Rosalie Lake heading north on the trail.  We walked past a zillion switchbacks to get to Shadow Lake.  Next, we hiked along Shadow Creek, over a log bridge and past some amazing little waterfalls.  To simplify the hike experience I will describe it like this: up, up, up, up, then down, down, down, down (repeat).  We strolled past Garnet Lake, Ruby Lake, and Emerald Lake before arriving at 1,000 Island Lake aptly named because it is filled with small little islands.  We were supposed to camp at 1,000 Island Lake, but decided to press on another 1.5 miles to Island Pass.  We were tired when we arrived and it was a little cold, so we made camp, pumped water, and had a delicious Chili Mac for dinner.
Our notable fellow hikers today were two ladies from Germany, one from Berlin and the other from Munich.  We also saw our first trailrunner.  She cruised by us just fast enough for me to ask if she wanted applause – she said yes. 

Day 3:  As we ', 'I hiked the JMT in August of 2016.  However, due to the permit I was able to secure, I hiked the trail northbound from the Cottonwood Pass area.  This is the backpacking trip of a lifetime.  If there is a trail that deserves 5/5 stars, this is the one.

I created a video series about my experience on the JMT.  You can view the videos on my Youtube channel.  Day one of my hike can be found at the link below.

https://youtu.be/fwWzPV0Xg0M', "It's the hike if a lifetime. Lyle Canyon is gorgeous. Donahue Pass .... AMAZING!!! If you want permits just go 2-3 days early and try to get a first come first serve. That's what we did. Happy Isles to Whitney. DO NOT USE MTR IF YOU DONT NEED TO. They are horrible to hikers. Go to VVR. They charge you less for resupply and test you like family. MTR SUCKS!!!!", 'Once in a life time kind of trail, make sure you do your research before you go.', 'Awesome.', 'Amazing', 'Great hike! Took three of my girls (ages 12, 14, 18). Completed the entire trail in 15 days. Took a zero day at Vermillion Valley Resort- great place to stop, shower, and eat a hot meal!', 'Started at Cathedral Lakes and took JMT to clouds rest and half dome before going down to the valley. Great hike, watch out for muirsquitos, they are brutal near the lakes and meadows.', 'Great, had to bail at fm due to pregnant wife but it was fun for the 30 miles I did accomplish.', 'Have been on multiple parts of the JMT.  Planning on completing the whole thing in the next couple of years.', "Hiked 77 miles of the JMT starting from Toulumne Meadows, and hiked from Happy Isles to Nevada Falls before beginning the trail at Toulomne Meadows. It was an amazing adventure. Mostly above the tree line you can't beat the views from the numerous passes. It is a very hard hike but oh so worth it. I am heading back this summer to complete the entire trail. I look forward to setting foot upon the JMT again.", "Spent 12 days on the JMT with 2 friends. it was an amazing adventure & I can't wait to finish. I backpacked from Yosemite Valley to VVR but had to be done so I can go back to work. We had blue sunny sky's & no bugs! The super low water this year made it tricky in a few places but we never went a long time with out any.", 'one of the most amazing backpacking adventure you could ask for.. views and ranges you cant get in just a couple day hikes.. Be prepared for any weather and make sure all food is sent well ahead of time . aug is a nice time no bugs nice temps', 'Done multiple parts of this trail in Yosemite National Park and Maintained parts of it as well. :) Has some amazing views', "Absolutely one of the best hikes I've made.  I'm returning again this year with my wife and brother to do it again.  Going south to north.  Yosemite is a bit of a shock with all the people after such solitude on the trail but the scenery is outstanding.", 'Greatest trail ever! Just took 20 days to complete the 220 mile trek! Loved every moment', 'One of the most amazing places on earth! We spent 5 days hiking this section and I could not stop enough times to take photos. I hope I am lucky enough to make it back here some day.', 'absolutly beautiful, as well as demanding', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Baldwin Hills Scenic Overlook Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'partially paved', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Baldwin Hills Scenic Overlook Trail is a 1.6 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Marina del Rey, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
['Why do the stairs at the gym if you have this option?! Fresh air and beautiful views! Steep stairs to the top. Great leg work out!', 'Great workout! Hike or stairs as an option to climb up. I take stairs up and then hike down. Great view on top!!', 'If you’re trying to get a good workout in, take the stairs! Some steps are high but the workout is so worth it. If you aren’t used to the elevation, be careful. I came back from being in Texas for 4 years, tried to run up these stairs and almost passed out. Lol. The view is beautiful. The trails are fun too. Wear some sturdy shoes, some areas of the trail are smooth. A lot of holes too.', "Easy trail to the top, or a more challenging set of stairs. Either way, you'll reach a nature center and great views of the L.A. basin. Fun quick workout.", 'Great for a quick lunch time hike. Only as challenging as you wish to make it if you combine the trail with stairs or decide to work out to top where you will find pull up bars and exercise areas.', 'Fairly easy hike.  You have the option of stairs or straight trail which is nice.  Restrooms and nature center at top r kinda nice.', 'Good work out. Bring water!!!  I’m happy that they are trying to clean up trail Nice view at top!!!!', 'It’s pretty nice. It’s fun and convenient for a quick little hike. Lots of people working out and getting their sweat on.', "It's an okay hike, great for working out. You can continue on a really cool nature center if you take the trail at the back of the parking lot towards the oil field. I might be more generous with the rating if I'd ever been here on a clear day.", "This is a very popular trail frequented by fitness types and lite hikers on the Westside. Take the Culver City stairs all the way to the top and be rewarded a panoramic view of LA. The stairs are deceivingly a solid workout and will have you relieved once you reach the top. I would say this is the Westside's version of Runyon Canyon a bit. If you are really trying to get your workout on, take the stairs up and run down the paved road to the trailhead and do the stairs again.

Great place to run, walk, or simply relax with the views. You can actually drive your car up the zig zagging road and park at the top for $5 if you are just looking for a place to hang out and sight see.

Afterwards treat yourself to the Mexican fruit stands which are typically at the trailhead.

Parking: Tons of free street parking at the trailhead but can be limited especially on the weekends.

- @justroc @just.trek", 'Well the hike is great,but I was disappointed with the city. We parked on Jefferson blvd we walked to the entrance of the park.  The street was full of trash. The city should  clean it and fine whoever leaves trash behind! Its such a bad impression of Culver City.', 'stairs are killer goodd view on clear day nice family hike', 'The stairs are a killer work out!', 'always a lightweight breezy walk to a small stair climb that makes you pay for the view', 'bring a hat!', 'This is a really easy hike to go on for beginners, and you get a really good view. There is a summer camp at the top + the Culver steps if you feel like tackling that.', "Great, accessible workout in the city. Plenty of free street parking when I go on weekdays. Bathrooms, drinking fountain, and nice city views found at the top. I like to take the stairs up and the switchback trail down. It's a little crowded, but that doesn't really matter since it's just a city stairs workout.", 'Nice hike, nice views', "Good but packed. Once you've done it, not really much to return for unless you're making it a part of your fitness routine. Fantastic photo vantage.", 'My fav', "Nice quick workout.  Beautiful views as you can see in all the pics.  It was around 53 degrees outside when we started.  We got there around 8:15 AM and it was packed full of people!  Drove to the top and  only about 3-4 vehicles parked in the lot.  I guess everybody wants to use the park but nobody wants to pay to park there.  Maybe that's why I seen a ranger on the trail with his ticket book in hand.  They need to make money somehow to keep it up.  It costs $2.00 per hour to park there or $6.00 for all day. 

Anyhow, it was a 45 minute drive to the park from OC but I would definitely go back there again.", 'Great trail for family hiking with great view!!', 'Stairs are a good workout with a nice view.', 'Stairs are a killer for beginners! But this is great for a quick workout.', 'Hike this right before sunset and watch it at the top! it is beautiful with a beautiful view of the whole city and the hollywood sign and the ocean and I am definitely doing this again.', 'I’ve hiked this trail and Culver City steps many times. Great place to get a quick workout near home.', 'Traffic was probably heavier due to the holiday, but I’m not even mad. Holy jeez what a view!!!', '', 'Was pretty disappointed not going to lie...', 'Climbing up the big concrete slabs is quite the workout. Convenient to access. Biggest downside is how crowded it gets - I would rate this a heavily trafficked trail based on the 5 or so times I’ve been.', 'A solid urban style hike in Culver City / West Los Angeles area. Ideal for the fitness types and lite hikers. The stairs are quite the workout.', 'Heavily trafficked trail that is easy and offers cool city and beach views.  I like to do it twice to stay agile for other hikes.  There is still some free parking available.', 'Good workout on the stairs', 'It was great. I was extremely tired but it was worth it.', 'getc', 'Hard', 'Super easy... but the stairs are a real work out. Good hike for kids.', 'Great trail with nice views of the city! Great for hill repeats.', 'Take bands or weights/kettlebells you will feel the staors but recomen doing at least twice then do some workout somewhere at the top', "I went over Memorial weekend so it was pretty crowded but I enjoyed it none the less. Go early in the morning or late afternoon because it could get pretty hot. If you're not up for climbing the steps you can take the trail up to the top. Bring water! Overall it was a great workout.", 'I climbed the steps twice, and then jogged down the dirt trail. climbing the stairs is a great workout both for cardio, and working your quads. I did this on an overcast day, which I recommend, even though visibility was not the best. Great little spot in the middle of the LA basin.', 'Multiple trails and ascents give it variety and the ability to return and have it feel fresh and new...Stairs are a great workout...super cool views!', "it's really a simple one, maybe better do a cross country running, nice views and good weather. Most important thing, don't forget put sun scream on. I've got a terrible sunburn.", 'Steps were awesome workout and view was incredible!', 'Fantastic gem in the middle of the city!! Get there early.Parking can be hit or miss depending on time of day. The mid day heat can be brutal if you are not experienced. Brings lots of water and good trail shoes. Leave the flip flips for the beach.', 'Short and Farley easy. You can take different ways down but going up is really the only fun about it and the view at top', 'Fun climb, not too long but you get a good workout. The view is beautiful.', 'It was very beautiful place to hike afternoon. Not even long tail but it was fun and very beautiful trail. Should go and see top of the place.', 'very easy trail if you just want to get outside for a short while. people are friendly and the views of downtown are beautiful!', 'The road or the switchbacks are the way to go.', "For an workout close to home with free parking and a beautiful view with sometimes a breeze you can't beat it. Stairs are more like climbing a wall in the lower area so work them quads. I do the stairs portion six times up and down and if I haven't done it lately am sore everytime. Kicks my a**!There are sloping sections if your knees are sensitive take the ramps! It gets crowded but it's still the best a** kicking workout within 3 miles of Culver City! Worst part is that people litter like crazy please put your trash in the cans. ", 'Stairs straight up for a short uphill trek. Can be done multiple times for a good workout.', "Basically a free outdoor stair-master! Dogs are NOT welcome, so leave four-leggers behind. No need to bring water, or snacks, the trail is short. Very heavily trafficked on weekends and after work, so don't expect a calm nature walk, more like a busy gym with a view. Also, the trail is super dry, very dusty and dirty, so wear stuff you know you're gonna wash.", 'perfect!', 'Great for working out, neat views', "This is a great leg workout! I wouldn't call it a trail however, it's a set of steep stairs that is relatively busy. At the top there's a nice view of LA and small garden. I usually go up and down several times, it's like an intense stair master that's outside.", "We went here yesterday and it was perfect timing. The trail has no shaded area and because it's overcast the weather was pleasant doing the trail and the stairs. As always it has a lot of foot traffic but if you get there early enough it won't be so bad. Parking is on the street down below but if you want to pay for parking and start from the top there is parking.", 'It's not necessarily a "hike" in the classic sense but the stairs are definitely an awesome workout. There are 276-282 stairs (my BF and I got different numbers each time ', 'Classified as easy but that does not consider the stairs.excellent work out.', 'Love the stairs. Provides a moderate to difficult workout climbing up with a beautiful view at the top. You can choose to go back down the stairs or take the road the long way down.', 'The stairs are an excellent place to work yourself up to some more strenuous trails. Can get extremely crowded though.', "This is a great Workout. I highly suggest you wear terrain shoes. I wear basic tennis and although they worked fine. Better traction would have been better. I didn't do any research ahead of time and thought I was gonna be walking up basic stairs. These are man made with large slabs of cement. Some of them are very high, which is like doing squats. And on weekends it's crowded so walking up the side of the stairs is difficult without traction shoes.I recommend you climb the stairs, run down the paved canyon trail and then do the stairs again. There is also space up top to run a mini boot camp or get some add'l exercise in. The best part was the Fruit Lady at the bottom. There is also a food truck that makes smoothies and breakfast stuff.Parking is free and on the street, so you may have to walk a bit to get to the stairs, but a good work out.", 'awesome overlook here at Culver city', 'I love the stairs! Great interval workout! Definitely recommend it to anyone who wants to go out, do some cardio, and have awesome views of the city. It definitely gets crowded and parking can be a little tricky. I usually find easier parking on the side streets which means you have to walk a little to get to and from your car. If you go early morning (before 7am), parking will be much easier. After that and throughout the day til sunset, is when parking is tricky and the crowds are a bit heavy.', "Fun trail. Didn't go up the big stairway. Preferred the switchbacks.", "This is definitely a popular choice for those who's main focus is to workout. 3 different routes to reach the top which will meet the needs of any fitness level. Once you reach the top there is a resting area where you can catch your breath and take in the view. Free street parking along Jefferson Blvd.", 'Love it', 'Nice! Good trail for a quick, close to home nature run/walk.', 'slow paced. great workout', 'Great incline for a good workout.', 'Small trail with a good stair climb. Good for a workout and beginners to hiking.', 'way to many people. The stairs were grueling. My legs were sore for a couple days.', 'Good work out for legs and conditioning. Big crowds limits your pace, but worth doing.', 'Stairs are good for a workout with city views at the top.', 'The trail is very easy and winding but you get some nice scenery so its worth checking out with the kids. If you want a workout take the stairs.', 'My whole body was hurrying after this I would go again', 'Super easy hike I like it to bring your little one along stroller friendly', 'Beautiful view from the top. Love those stairs!!', 'Awesome trail! It takes you all over the mountain and the stairs offer more of an intense workout. We ran up the trail, walked briskly down and then went up all the stairs! Beautiful view of our beautiful concrete jungle', 'First timer here! I def. like it will be comming here again, super easy to find your way around you cant get lost! You could go alone or with friends doesnt really matter the main work out there is the stairs! Becareful dont trip and fall (i did today ', 'Pretty good, beautiful view of LA.', "Good workout. Feels like I'm on the stairmaster. The steps are as high as your knee. The overlook is amazing with the culver city view. Park along the streets, it is free.", 'Was awesome', 'Nice burn hill need a lot water.', 'Great burn, but really fast. Can do it more than once to get a full hour of cardio. I like the stairs. But parking sucks and it can be really crowded, especially on the staircase.', 'Not much to it but a great little natural oasis. I do little lunch time training hikes up the climb here.

https://hikingguy.com/hiking-trails/baldwin-hills-scenic-overlook-hike/', 'I would have put 5 stars if there was better parking.  Everyone seems to love this trail, so during early evening hours, it is difficult to find a parking spot.', 'leg workout, but tiring!', "Good trail. Great workout...you can really feel it in your legs! About a mile up and a mile back. You can take the stairs or there's a trail you can take. We took the stairs up and the trail down. Great for beginner to advanced. I'd do it again :)", 'Great leg workout!! Nice view of Culver City and you can actually see the beach on a clear sunny day', 'This is a pretty cool trail that has become part of my weekly routine. So many people working out, spending time with family, and just enjoying the view.', 'be warned,  street parking is horrible unless you want to pay $6.Besides that, I loved this very, very popular place. I wished I lived closer so I could do more than 1xweek.', 'I took a nice winding trail up to the top.  Killer stairs, maybe next time!Will be back.', 'Horrible.  Dirty.  Parking is on a busy street next to a swampy canal that is strewn with garbage and stinks with the hot summer air.  Combine that with climbing up a hill of stairs, which would be fun, but is crammed with people.  If you want to move quickly, you are pretty much stuck.  The area seems to be a great spot for the smog layer and pollution from nearby  freeways to settle.  Very dirty air and area.  The photos above do not reflect my experience.', 'walkable route. has steps for people who just wants to climb up.', 'Nicely maintained "mini trail', great view at the top.', 'Great view, safe for solo women at dusk(very crowded at this time actually). Do stairs up, run down. Too hard to run up stairs during peak times.', 'It was easier than I thought so I did it twice!', 'awesome place!', "Loved it! Me and my friend tried this yesterday and fell in love. If I lived closer I would come back more often. We took the stairs up and the trail down. It's much easier on your knees if you do it that way. Great exercise and thigh work out.", "This is a great spot in Culver City to work out. I don't live in the area but on my days off, I drive just for the workout and the scenery of Los Angeles to Santa Monica. It's a great workout, I think it's a total of 280 steps to the top. There's a trail where people can run or bike their way up to the top. Don't worry, there's a spot if you need to go to the bathroom. It is also a good place to volunteer time to beautify and keep the place clean. I've seen where family bring their children, sometimes good and sometimes not. Depends how crowded it can get.", 'A nice way to get ready for longer hikes.', 'I give it four stars based on its nearby location, ease of parking, range of challenge and the 360 degree view of LA. The Hollywood sign and the Pacific Ocean are easily seen from atop this hill.', 'Amazing views stairs not to bad for first time..has also regular trail on sides and restrooms at the top..loved it', 'It was an awesome day on the hill today. The fog just started to roll in as I was completing my 5th loop trip up the stairs and running down the trails. What fun!!', "I love this workout. It is great to do the stairs up and run down the trails. However, it was soooo hot I couldn't believe it! Usually I find it cooler at the top but not so!!", 'The three stars are for the amazing views from the top. I prefer to park on the street and hike the trails all over the hillside. Great for staying in hiking shape when you cannot get away. I call the uneven stone stairway with usually multitudes of people slowly making their way up as the "death march" and stay away from that mess.', "A nice break from the city and a good hike uphill. Highly recommend if you're in the area and you have an hour!", 'It was a wonderful morning. Overcast and cool...not busy on the hill. Climbed up the stairs x5 and ran down the dirt trails. Awesome workout', "Oh My Goodness! I don't even want to share how great this place is! It is a great workout and I hate when its crowded. They have improved the trails and now they have a great grade on them. Free parking!! Free workout!! Helps prepare you for any hiking adventure. Great Butt workout!!
NO DOGS ALLOWED!!  They will FIND you and they will FINE you!!  $500", '+ Free parking along Jefferson Blvd. Parking for a fee available up Hetzler Road for $6. Hours are from 8 am  sunset daily.  + Going up the 300 steps was the best 5-10 minutes of noteworthy burn. Burn, baby, burn!  + Prepare to lunge. Once you master it, try doing it more than once. Afterward, gun it, and run it.  + The beautiful panoramic view and the soothing breeze amped me up for more.  + Push yourself. Itll only get better once you reach the top, I promise.  + All-in-all, a good workout!     [STATS] Summer-July. Noon. Sunny-Low 70s. Heavy.', 'Right in the middle of town, nice quick hike', "This is a great trail if you're into bringing your dog & small children. It's a nice trail & the nature center up top is educational. If you're into nature & solitude & true hiking, then this is not the place for you. It's crowded & popular. A good place to hang out with friends when you want a work-out. This is not the place for nature seekers. ", 'I must agree with Geneva. great trail. if you want to feel a burn come here.', 'This trail was really easy and nice! However the stairs were very challenging! Short people beware! ', 'Free street parking.  Great workout and amazing views.  Go up the 281 steps, take in the view, run/walk down the trail and repeat.  Down side is sometimes it gets too crowded and no dogs allowed.', 'This is a great workout. Do the stairs a few times, run the trail, and enjoy the view at the top.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Visitor Center Loop Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'camping', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'rock climbing', 'trail running', 'walking', 'river', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'bugs']
hike_description: Visitor Center Loop Trail is a 1.4 mile heavily trafficked loop trail located near San Diego, California that features a river and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['Super easy trail for beginners and the scenery is nice. Highly recommend this trail for first time hikers!', 'Very easy trail but with one pretty big and moderately steep hill. I hiked the whole thing with my 25lb kid in a backpack carrier and had no problems with the trail. One of the people I was hiking with did the whole thing pushing a stroller with a baby in it—not recommended but definitely doable. There were a few other people there hiking with kids, and my dog loved it too.', 'Easy Trail with a nice stream nearby to cool down with (after it rained)', 'Super easy, short trail, which was great for my young kids, who are new to hiking.', 'Overall this was a simple hike that is great for getting into the swing of being on a trail. This trail has a decent amount of people on it so you do not feel alone. You get to walk past some varied landscapes and start by the visitor center where you can learn more about the park. 

If you are looking for an easy hike this is for you. If you are looking for something more challenging, there are plenty of other trails that you can probably incorporate segments of this trail with.', 'Great hike for beginners, it was easy and fun. We opted for a pre dawn hike, it was beautiful & surprisingly quiet. We will be returning next week!', "For being in San Diego County, it was surprisingly REALLY scenic and really quiet. I have not been on a hike within the city that was this quiet or scenic. 

I wasn't sure about the loop though, because I parked in this gravel parking lot. So I did a out and back type of hike, but I am pretty sure that that it was intended as a loop.", 'Surprisingly scenic! Plus we got to hike alongside a river for awhile which was pretty awesome. Solid elevation changes, I wore my toddler in a carrier on the uphill and we admired tons of wildflowers. Really enjoyable little hike.', 'great for beginners.', 'Great trail for beginners or someone looking for a quick escape.  Easy trail to merge with surrounding trails and add a challenge.', 'Great short walking', 'Nice easy walk with spots of shade and beautiful views. Connects to the river trail so can cross over and go up the hill if you want something more challenging!', 'It was a lovely and easy trail. I picked it due to my husbands recent knee injury and needed something easy. There was some beautiful scenery. The creek/river was flowing nicely.  Not much luck for animal spotting. We like to herp, and all we saw was a few lizards. No snakes unfortunately. We went around dusk.  Great for family outings and for small children. I’m not a fan of all the foot traffic. Was too busy for my liking. All in all a good short stroll though.', 'Good nature walk', 'Great for beginners! This is my very first hike since moving back to California. This was a good starting point and it offers great views and shows you all the options you have once you are ready.', 'Love this trail good year long', 'Easy trail. Lots of shade along the way and a beautiful view of the creek!', 'Decent. Not too long that you can’t take kids. Fairly small and a light walk', "This is a great hiking trail around the Visitor Center. Don't forget to check out the Grinding Rocks trail off this trail - beautiful layers of rocks along a stream of water. Easy hike & fun!", '', 'Nice for a easy walk/hike. Added the Oak Grove Loop to add a little more distance.', 'Great for a leisurely stroll when you’re not looking for a tough hike.', '', 'Easy short walk with nice scenery.', 'Easy peazy lemon squeezy. This is a nice, short trail with good shady spots every so often.', 'Great little hike!', 'Good short trail. Took my small dog and she had no problem finishing this trail. Good for something quick and easy.', 'Shorty easy trail perfect for beginners', 'Very easy trial and shortGood for little kids', 'Great in-the-city outing. Trail is well maintained.', 'Light trail very kid and pet friendly', 'What a great time of the year to do this hike. A lot of flowers, beautiful weather, easy walk, just beautiful!', "Cute little trail with squirrels, bunnies, and lots of lizards.  Even though there weren't any spots with steep inclines, it was still a decent workout.  There are many connecting trails if you want to extend your hike.Dog poop every 10 feet or so :-/", 'Great, easy walk for beginners. Nice to slow things down a little. There is a steepish hill though so plan accordingly.', 'easy well walked clean trail!', 'Nice and easy short hike with  plenty areas of shade.', "I actually did the North Fortuna hike, I don't know why does the Visitor hike popped up..anyway this hike was a moderate hike. Really easy to feel like you are in a maze:-). Some reviews said there is a waterfall- there is no waterfall at all. Bring lots of water some food. Today was really green all the way, it was beautiful. Only problem that it is close to the highway so some part of the hike was not so nice for me..so far it is a nice cardio hike.", 'A fun little shady hike along the creek.', 'Great hike when you have limited time and want to enjoy the San Diego outdoors - mixed terrain of dirt, rocks & gravel with a spot to see the San Diego River', "Easy, but you can add to it by detouring to the grinding rocks and then also to the Deerfield trail. I've also gone from the visitor entrance to the grinding rocks and then hiked the climbers loop and finished the visitor trail...the visitor loop alone is a great easy hike to introduce new people to the trails and beauty of MTRP.", 'Great little loop', "Great little hike that wasn't super packed.", 'Short easy trail not much to it.', "This is nice if you just want to get out and move for awhile. The trail isn't hard at all, and it's nice to stop by the visitor's center and take a look around.", 'I run here often-great network of trails to get in any length run you want!', "We started at 7:00 am ! first time doing South Fortuna! I'm glad we find three ladies ; they gave us direction to follow the trais! Thanks to them,  we did 5 miles and got to South Fortuna ; came down on Fortuna Saddle Trail & Suycott Wash trail to finish San Diego River Crossing Trail. The  most difficult was doing the stairs; to South Fortuna! Excelente Hike", 'Lots of different trails , ranging from 1.5 walks to very challenging .enjoyed it but the poison oak everywhere freaked me out  !! Make sure not to go off trail and get there early .', 'lots of bees around this season but very beautiful route. the old mission dam is very rewarding however, beautiful site.', 'Perfect!!!', 'Fun trail. Different trails to take. Nice ride.', 'For the first time as a family we decided to start taking our kids hiking. We missed the guided tour so we decided to go on our own. So beautiful and relaxing. Definitively doing this again!', 'Fun easy walk. We went on Memorial Day and it was crowded.', 'Cool to navigate your way around. Rewarding at the peak of North Fortuna. 1 peak down', 'Not clearly marked as others have said walking over a little creek 5 min into  the walk was the highlight.', 'Peaceful!', 'ITS AWESOME', 'An easy walk with fun views of the hills and a few interesting rock faces. Can easily be turned into a longer hike of varying difficulty by taking the well marked turns onto other trails.', 'Visitor Loop is a nice easy hike had fun with the kids and pup.', "I'm a pretty experienced hiker, but for those days that my kids are out of school this is my go to little hike for them.", 'This is a good hike and I just learned the the park has a 5 peak challenge. for more info go the mission trails link. MTRP.org.', "Moderate Hike. Love that there's several trails. Dog friendly.", 'Awesome hike', 'Great for dogs', 'Easy, relating with the river sound and frogs. Very beautiful', "Good for kids and dogs. Pretty scenery but if you're looking for an actual trail to hike then opt for one of the other options in this park like Fortuna mountain or climbers loop. this route is all pavement and cars are driving  through.", 'Great place for all levels of hikers...', 'Most of the time, this is a very warm hike. Bring tons of water and sun protection.', "Not one of my favorite places to hike, but I'm sure that's because I have a strong dislike for being in direct sunlight for very long and as there are NO trees or shade at all here... well, it just doesn't suit me.

But, the trails are well maintained. They're mostly fire trails so they're wide and clean. Some snake action can happen all year long, but... I was able to scoot faster than they could slither.

I don't recommend this trail for those not on the more fit side of things. I'm not very fit so my friends slowed down for me, but MAN it was tougher for me than them.  It's a hike you might want to work up to.", 'Pleasant.  Easy.', "Kind of annoyed by the comments that Mission Trails is 'easy'. If you stick to the fire roads, yeah. Easy day. Which means you're doing it wrong. 
Hike the hellish stairs of South Fortuna and keep it going to North Fortuna. That's 8 miles and lemme tell you, there is nothing easy about it. 
I hike mission trails daily, and never do the same trails twice. If you want easy, you can find it. But there is a challenge to be found there!", 'Easy', 'Nice cool down loop after doing Climbers Loop today. Loved seeing the little waterfalls down at the "river"', 'Challenging and extremely fun for the family.', 'Kid and dog friendly!', 'Very easy hike or trail run if you do the trail twice it makes a decent distance.  Beware the snakes, lots of places for them to hide here.', 'Very easy & pleasant hike.', 'Super fun and easy, Dog friendly and when it rains it has great small ponds to play in.', "I just went recently and the weather was perfect for a morning hike! I was only able to hike a mile in and back but I like how the trail loops around, so hopefully next time I'll complete it!", "My 7 year old daughter and I went out to do this hike this morning.  We started hiking around 8:30am and finished at 10am.  Was nice and cool when we started and I was drenched with sweat when we finished.  There were a few hills that we had to go up and down, but not too tough a trail.

We started out with the intention of just doing the loop trail, but ended up hiking some side trails as well.  We didn't see a whole lot of wildlife, but we did spook something large that went crashing through the brush (probably a deer or two).  We did, however, find a couple trees just feet from the trail that were great for climbing.  My kids love climbing trees so the young 'uns would definitely like the humongous trees for that reason.

Overall, a great place to go hiking, but definitely go in the early morning or late evening unless you just want to get a great workout and sweat it out!  I plan on going again and possibly taking the whole family.", "This says the visitor's loop is 2.3 m? It's 1.4, and I know this because I've hiked it a lot. The main road is 3.6m round trip. There's trails for every fitness level, which is great. You can also bike on the main road and the easier trails. The scenery is all mountain, but cool. I have seen coyotes as well, by the dam. Snakes are pretty common during the summer, so I then try to stick to the road. Most of my encounters were with the red snakes on the visitor's center loop, and one black snake on the bmx trail right off of the loop. They are both poisonous! There's also a much skinnier snake which is not poisonous, though I forget the name of it.There's parking at the beginning of both entrances, and at the visitor's center and a tiny lot at the dam. You can also park at certain spots on the main road.2 days a month, they have free live music playing, usually native flutes or clarinets. Look on the calendar posted throughout the park.There are lots of birdies and bunnies and lizards (usually tiny). Lots of humming birds. I've had one hover right next to me for a few seconds, beautiful! :)Cons: It DOES get very hot in the summer, DO try to make it early morning or evening. There is one porta potty on the road, and one at the dam. The bathroom at the visitor's center has soap and water, make sure to go before you head out on a hiking trail. Do NOT leave your car parked inside the gates after closing! They WILL lock you in! We thought we were safe parking at the dam, but there's a gate after that! Also, the flies are a real nuisance!! You might want to wear some kind of bug repellent. I have found, though, that there are less very early in the morning or when it's super windy. I also hate that there are signs with misleading info, or no signs at all that point you in a clear direction. They REALLY need to work on that! And in some spots, the weeds or trees will overtake the path and they won't clear it, and there's ticks in there, so this just makes me angry. They need to hire me to make this park better! >:)", 'Like others state, lots of options... But also stated in other reviews, trails were not marked and or clear. I felt lost all day. I wasnt sure if a trail was going to be two miles or ten. I started off the wrong way and when the trail ended i turned back. That was a mile and a half mistake. Plus i crossed a small creak and got my shoes and socks wet right off the bat. This all put be in a bad mood. Soon after i asked someone else for directions and they pointed me in the right direction. I did enjoy the stairs.  I didnt feel that the scenery was very nice or special except the part with the creek. But signs warning of poison oak steered me away from there.  Now knowing the trail. I believe i did north and south fortuna and did the stairs. But who knows. Total trip was just over 7 miles.', "I started at the visitors loop and parked there. Then I ran to the mission dam, kept going to the grasslands area, and ran in a big loop up to 52 and Mast blvd. Then came back to the paved road by the mission dam and back to the visitors center. My total run was 7.23 miles. I'd definitely do it again! Probably later this week! Go early so it's not too hot and be mindful of snakes and poison oak! The trails are safe, however!", 'Lots of options here. Very pretty. Great spot to trail run. Kid friendly. Free guided hikes twice a week per the visitor center.', 'Such a great gem! Barely used (compared to the other hot spots) but still greatly preserved. An absolute fav - especially for a quick trail run :)', 'This trail is always fun to wander around on and explore. Love the landscape and the interesting plants and herbs. Mission trails may not be as challenging as others but it is never boring. :)', "Good trails for running. I got lost the first time, so definitely consult/bring a map. Many different difficulty levels, and there's always the road to run on if you get lost and run out of trail (like I did). Like others have said, it gets hot, so bring water.", 'Great hike, awesome view. Everyone was happy and joyful on the way.', 'this was our first time at mission trails, it was really hot with very little too no shade, get an early start and it will be a lot more fun, los of talks to explore, we will be back', 'Nice short trail for young kids. The water features are hard to beat. Your kids will love the wildlife near the water.', "I came here from NH for the summer, and love this trail system. My lab Buck loves it too, very beautiful views.I'm mad at disrespectful dog owners that don't pick up their poop, I have picked up others waste to make it enjoyable for all. I hope the fire didn't do too much damage, want to hit the trails with my boy!", 'this is great and you can make the hike longer or shorter based on which trails you decide to take. We saw a couple of very well fed coyotes so keep dogs leashed. My dog jumped in the stream on the way back, it was hot, so bring water if you decide to take the harder trails. Great hike.', 'Easy hike but if you stay only on the vistors loop trail its too short.  I enhanced the hike by leaving the visitors parking lot and hiking the Oak Grove Loop, than the Father Juniper O Serra Trail to the Old Mission Dam, hopped on the Grasslands Loop Trail used the Crossing back to Father Juniper and the visitors parking lot.  I hiked over five miles by combining the three trails.', 'Lots of trails to choose from. Tends to be a little crowded for me.', "Incredibly beautiful park! Lots of trails. This was the first time hiking here for my wife and I.  The visitors loop trail is pretty good, but it seems like there are lots of trails that would be much better within the park. The loop trail gets a lot of foot traffic, mountain bikes, etc.  It's an amazing pl.ace, and I'll definitely be exploring more of the trails in the park. 

We also stopped at the dam on our drive through on the way out and it as quite relaxing watching the ducks, egrets, and heron that were there during our visit.", 'Decent trails and different things to do (hike, climb, run, etc.), but usually pretty crowded.', "Hiked this trail when my son's class had a field trip. There are some trees that provide shade but for the most part it gets pretty hot during the day, so definitely bring water.

I thought this trail was Easy to Moderate, and the river is a nice feature.  The visitors center is a great place to check-in and get more information about the park.  They sell bottles of water there in case you forgot to bring some.

All in all, great hike. Will have to do this again.", 'I love this trail. In the Summer it can be very hot. Towards Fall  and into  the Winter months  makes for a more enjoyable hiking experience. I have  completed rim to rim in about 4-5 hours, on a cool day, starting out at The Visitor Center.  The views are beautiful from each of the two Fortunas. Bunnies, birds deer and snakes are all denizens of this area. Father Serra  walked this path. Plenty of time for quiet contemplation.  You will run into a handful of hikers and runners. There is a nice fusion of  flat land, low hills, and large Mts. You have options of paths to go on. If you have an hour there is at least one path for you.', "Another heavily traveled trail, it does have a very pretty creek that runs through the canyon. I have two dogs so its a nice break for them to wade in the water on hot days. By the way make sure you aren't in the parking lot after it closes or the gate will be closed and your car locked in.", "I love Mission Trails Regional Park, it's one of my favorite places to go hiking at! Every time I go there are still new trails to visit. Trails vary from easy to hard, most being pretty easy but it's a good place to run if you want a challenge. I'm always telling people about this place, its incredible how many people dont know about it!", "Mission Trails is not a trail.  It's a park with an extensive system of trails.  The trails range from easy to strenuous.  (Please ignore my 'difficulty' and 'time' entries - they can't apply to a trail system but the site won't take a review without them.", "This was my first time mountain biking here and it was great!!! Not too technically but just enough for a good challenge.  Trails are awesome!! I found that there are many switch backs that take you every where.  It's a gradually climb with rocky spot with some following a dried up river bed.  The down hill is fast and rocky and a bit more technical. I plan on going back this weekend.", 'I went 4 miles out and 4 miles back on the main trail. It is a nice gradual climb going out (about 550-600 ft over 4 miles). Mostly dirt trail with some rocky patches. I turned around and came back along the same path, it was a much faster coming home and much more technically challenging to maneuver while going faster than the ride up. Bring lots of water for the ride up, not so physically demanding on the way down, but definitely requires lots of focus.', 'I love to take my family hear it a couple minutes away from the city and if it was not for the freeway they but in that runs through it now it would be perfect still for a fast trip to some nature trails. It has a good number of trails and history sites we love the old dam area but it is a great little park to hike or bile', 'Mission Trails Regional Park. I have visited Mission Trails Park quite often. I always seem to find a different path or Trail. Great views always something different.to see.', "This is a great trail. You can park at the Visitor Center or at the Mission Dan entrance. There is parking available in each area. I have been utilizing the Visitor Center entrance as of late. The trail is scenic with oak and maple trees , a beautiful stream  to cross over. An uphill climb awaits you after all this. This climb will take you into the heart of Misssion Trails. From here Fortuna W. mesa. will be on your left. Another hill will take you to it's mesa. Crossing the mesa to the end will take you over to No. Fortuna. There are signs that will help with directions. No. Fortuna Mt.  has a uphill rocky path with railroad ties  giving you foot security up some of it. From the top of this Mt. you then can travel down the other side and up and across to So. Fortuna Mt. At the end of So. Fortuna you will need to go down into Sucott wash. I have seen Mule deer along this trail. Snakes are in this park, but , just keep your eyes and ears open. They are far and few in between. Don't poke them. In the wash is a lovely little picnic area. After a snack/rest there, you start your way  back up  towards the Visitor Center. Mission Trails is a sensitive habitate area, so there are many areas that are corded off. This does not distract, and actually enhances a hikers journey . I went at a slow to moderate pace. I ate lunch at the top of No. Fortuna. The views from  atop the Mts. are spectacular. I took about 4 hours, going at a slow to moderate pace including lunch. I do this trail often", 'This trail can wear you out!!! The service roads are steep and mildly dangerous. The single track and shared trails are great. Lots of hike-a-bike for the "average" fitness level person. River crossing can be brutal if not impossible during high water times.  Lots of options to ride all day. Bring plenty of water as it gets real hot, real fast.', "Though we did not walk the entire trail what we did walk was easy and well maintained. The damn was very interesting for it's history. We will return and do more.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Deer Hollow Farm Trail Loop - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'muddy', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Deer Hollow Farm Trail Loop is a 2.7 mile lightly trafficked loop trail located near Cupertino, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
['Very suburban and crowded. Nice once you get on the smaller trails', 'Suitable for family and kids. Make sure to have all trails map handy as there are lots of forks and waypoints in the path', 'Such pretty view and kind deer.', 'Like the PG &E trail.', "My local trail! I have been walking this trail since I was 4 (now 25) and it never gets old. It can be hard to find parking during peak hours (weekday evenings and weekends) but always worth it. The woodsy environment is the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of the Bay Area. The uphills/downhills are manageable for any level. I frequently come here for walks with my mom. Runners love this trail (I personally don't run but my mom and cousin do). This is a very popular trail, so if you have headphones in please be courteous of runners or those moving faster than you!", 'My daughter loved the animals. We would definitely do this hike again just to visit with them.', 'The trail was beautiful and it was nice for a Sabbath walk/hike. The hikes/walks are different from the hikes I like to do on any other day of the week. I actually slow down on Sabbath. It was my first time there, I will go back. The farm was a cute unexpected surprise on the walk. ☺The advice I can give is, go early it was hard to find parking, it was full.', 'Just a pretty little stroll through the woods, easy and the farm is such a COOL place to take your kids, especially in the Spring. All the baby animals are out and they are so fun to watch. If you have kiddies, grab a pack and some snacks and take them here. Leave no trace, please!', 'parking is really bad. get there early!!', 'Very nice views and lot of trail options', 'The farm was the best part!', 'Relative flat trail to enjoy nature with deers roaming, woodpeckers chipping and wild turkeys!', 'very nice at the first half, but less shady at the second half. The farm is interesting, but quiet stinky.', 'Fun casual hike with family. Our 2 year olds both did this hike many times with little whining.', 'Nice trail', 'Ran the 3.1 mile loop counterclockwise, and overlapped so that I made the farm my finish line. Great warm weather trail as it is mostly shaded with exposed area consisting of level or downhill terrain.', 'Easy but fun, especially when the pigs are out and about', 'My favorite hiking running walking trail at Rancho.  Ran this trail with a off-road jpg stroller for years. Walked it with my kids. Team with a running group. Hiked it alone or with friends. Beautiful. Great forest feel yet right in there city. Sometimes there stream is running. Always a great placed to be.', 'nice and easy family friendly trail :)', 'Great trail options', 'Great hike!', 'The entrance and the first Mile or so are very family heavy to get to the farm. but then you can pick a trail and the crowds dissipate. The hike to the vista point is moderate to hard depending on your fitness level.', 'Paved and Unpaved walking trail for kids and parents. Spotted lots of turkeys, deers, squirrels on the way. And animal at the farm were a treat. My 3 yr old walked  75% of the hike', "It's an easy hike and ends at the farm.lots of animals to see. Good fun with children.", "This is called a Coyote loop trail rather than a Deer Hollow farm trail. I would rate it as 'moderate' rather than 'easy' for novice. Heavily used during weekends and holidays. It can have a few slippery spots during/after heavy rains, but it is good for running and hiking.", "This is a good trail that I would rate as 'moderate' rather than 'hard'. Heavily used during weekends and holidays. It can have a few slippery spots during/after heavy rains.", "Absolutely beautiful trail! It's so nice because you feel so far away from the city. All sorts of birds, squirrels and deer roaming around. Nice vista points. I personally would rate this trail as moderate, rather than difficult. It's on the longer side (depending on which loops you choose) but it's not anything that new hikers/children couldn't do. My only complaint is that it is a very heavily trafficked trail (however, I went on a Sunday morning) Overall, 5/5!", 'great', 'Great hike with beautiful views', 'Very beautiful! Got to see lots of amazing animals and plants!', 'I walk this trail several times a month. I like the hills and the wildlife', 'my favourite trail.. covered with trees..gives u real hike feel..', 'worth trying', 'Really easy even with baby in toll', 'Nice trail; not too tough, but lots of people!  Worthy views if you go on a clear day.', 'Great trail', "A lot of incline.  Challenging, if you're not in shape.  Some shade.", '* PG&E trail: By far, this trail is the toughest and steepest of the three, though it is wider than the other two. A nice shade by trees in parts. This trail provides a lot of vista points for views of the valley below and beyond. You can see the bay water.
* Wildcat Loop trail: Single-lane trail, completely shaded. Almost no incline. Seems to be a very popular trail; there was more traffic here than on the other two trails. No vistas from this trail because this is at the bottom of the hill.
* Coyote trail: Single-lane trail, completely shaded. There is a bit of incline before it joins the PG&E trail.

An elevation gain of 928 feet, as reported by Garmin.', 'PG&E trail was pretty tough for me but definitely worth it!! Next time I will go all the way up!', "This is a nice walk. It's primarily a fire road that makes for easy walking. The first couple of miles climb about 700 feet, so be prepared to work from the start. Once you get to Wildcat and Coyote, things become more single track trail and are mostly downhill. Don't forget to stop for some breathtaking views of the valley at around 2 mi.", 'For practicing half-dome, we trained on PG& E to Black Mountain via Quarry trail; round trip of 13 miles with elevation gain of 2500 feet.', 'Quick moderate hike with nice views.', 'This was first time hiking here at Rancho San Antonio Preserve, chose PG&E trail. It was a good hike up and down hill with lots of deer to see along the trail.', 'This is a moderate hike. if you want a little challenge,  once you get to the top of the trail take the Black Mountain trail which is quite steep and difficult. Its an additional 2 miles and estimated 1100 ft elevation.', "Deer Hollow Farm Loop is an easy trail for anyone especially those with kids. We go there often and my sister brings the off road stroller for her son. There are many other trails around that become moderate to even difficult, so it's a great place if you want a variety of trails. I think the trail is in about half shade  and half sun. It can get really hot during the summer, bring lots of water, sunscreen and a hat. We've also hiked during the winter, wear layers and good shoes, it can get icy on the ground. There's a covered picnic area that's perfect for lunch or a snack. It's fun to see the animals at the farm and see what's growing in the garden. The loop is fairly flat and is good for walking and running. Again there are adjoining trails to make your walk/jog longer. Rancho San Antonio Park is very popular, even though there is a lot of parking it fills up fast. Get there early or you might have to circle around waiting for someone to leave. There are bathrooms near the parking lots, I think there's outhouses near the farm. If your just doing the loop you might not need to wear hardcore hiking gear/shoes. Good walking shoes and light layers should be sufficient. Have fun and take your time on this easy loop with your family.", 'NIce and moderate hike.  Lots shade and a farm nearby.  Can mix in my diff trails like wildcat and Upper meadow to make this over a 6 mile loop', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Seven Springs Trail Loop - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'camping', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'bugs']
hike_description: Seven Springs Trail Loop is a 2.6 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Cupertino, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['Gets SO muddy in the rain! Went when it was pouring today with my puppy. She was in heaven! I was slipping and sliding. Limited parking for when the weather is actually good, but I’d definitely do this hike again', 'Great hike, very limited parking at the trailhead', "fun trail under 3 miles but has a decent incline to make up for it. good if you're interested in a quick one. not very crowded after 10:00am. dog friendly.", 'Nice hike. But, only some of it was shaded and watch out for the bikers.', 'Good trail for a morning workout. Parked at Prospect road lot. Was very crowded when I arrived at 9.15am but luckily got a parking spot. Parking gets freer during later hours. Trail was well marked.  Not shaded in quite a few places.', 'Went there with my dog. We arrived very early on a weekday so we had no trouble finding parking. Morning sun was not too hot so we were fine even though there’s not too much shade. We made a detour to Hunter’s Point and the view from there ‘s wonderful!', 'Great trail, good shade, moderate, good for dogs on short leash (shared with mountain bikers).', 'Not a bad trail, but not a lot of shade for pets and lots of bikers passing on a narrow trail.', 'Pretty exposed. No rest. Not much in the way of a view unless you like looking at Cupertino and spaceships.', 'great hike, limited parking', 'Nice short loop for trail running or hiking with older kids.', 'We enjoyed the hike. Enjoyed the views and single track hike. Lots of animals, birds and butterflies out. Forest got some love at Hunters point (not on but nearby the loop).', 'Great afternoon hike with the family', 'good trail to walk dogs', 'Dry and muddy trail. It was fun hike. Nice weather. We had a great time there.', 'Very nice trail. It took us 1 hr 25 with our 3 kids (7, 9, 11).', 'Good morning walk. Parking is very limited.', 'easy trail. parking is limited on weekends. view of South Bay.', 'Good leisurely 2-3 hr hike in the morning to wake up.', 'Great hike. The first part is uphill for some time but it is worth it for the view!', 'Fun hike in the morning with a bunch of other friendly hikers/bikers. Saw an abundance of deer and lizards scattered across the trail. Be careful as both sides of the trail has poison oak that is prominent throughout the trail. Very fun!!!', 'great place to hike, mountain bike and run', 'Simply amazing!', 'HIke was easy. A lot of people in the area so YYMV depending which trail you take. One thing to note, however, parking can be very limited.', 'Very muddy, but wide open trails. Nothing strenuous.', 'nice trail. 1,5h maximum. even saw some deee', 'Moderate hike.   Amazing views.  Saw deer and a newt.  Early spring  so tons of wild flowers.', "I have done this hike regularly for the last twelve years, as it's close to my house and dogs are allowed on the trails. It's a great hike with beautiful views and just the right amount of hills to be a workout. I prefer the Creekside Trail route at the beginning and end though.The only downsides are:
1) The treeless section as you climb the hill can be deathly hot in summer. 
2) This same section can be deeply muddy and rutted from bikers after a rain.
3) Seven Springs Trail is narrow in sections and can get very busy on weekends, especially with bikers.", 'This was a great hike! Beautiful scenery, and it was a pretty quiet trail, although there were a few others. The trail was pretty muddy in areas, due to the recent rain.', 'Beautiful trail with some amazing views! The trail is pretty narrow so be aware of bikers racing around the corners.. Other than that 5/5', 'Had a good Sunday morning hike.', 'We liked it a lot', 'Great trail for a quick hike, mountain bike or run. Lots of good views, good footing, not technical at all. Can be narrow at places.', "I've been here a few times with my friends.  Lovely trail, no shade though.  Have to go early morning in the summers to enjoy the trail.  The view from top is beautiful, very limited parking though so a star less...", 'Nice trail. I will do it again (both running and mountain bike).', 'Too many views of McMansions and electricity wires but a decent day hike nonetheless.', "the view was amazing and it's very good for beginners too", "Hiked up to Hunter's Point - the view was AMAZING. Definitely coming back!", "We saw a mountain lion and it was SOO scary!! It didn't see us but we saw it looking down the hill and I had my lil dog and my husband with me! We ran away and they said not to but it didn't see us so we just tried to get away as fast as we can. So I probably won't go hiking there anymore.", 'Love mtbing this trail, I may suggest going clockwise from hunters view point', 'Perfect 3 mile mtb ride single track is fast.', "some shade but it's all about the view!", "Quick if you don't have a lot of time", 'Easy to moderate hike with great views. One of the nicest hikes in the area. Specially in the spring!', 'Hike', 'Great view', 'This is a nice hidden trail in Cupertino/Saratoga. Way longer then 2 miles. Seven Spring trail has a nice vista point (Hunters Point). If you take the Hayfield Trail on the other hand and touch the Tiny Loop Trail, you can reach the Stevens Creek Reservoir. Great place to go running or mountain biking.', "Gorgeous Hike! Fairly easy going hike with some challenging moments. We did the Seven Springs Trail and then added on Hunter's Point. The add-on to Hunter's Point is only 0.2 miles and includes an amazing view of the bay area. It was a clear enough day that we could see Downtown San Jose and further south all the way up north past the Dumbarton Bridge. Definitely worth doing. We completed the loop in under 2 hours, with very little stopping. Highly recommended for a nice easy going hike!", 'Easy to moderate, pleasant quick workout trail. It shaded most of the time, with little sun shine at top. One side of trail is dry so little extra gravels to watch out for.', "Hiked this park on an overcast Saturday in February. The views were spectacular. You get a panoramic view of the entire Bay Area. As for difficulty, this hike was relatively easy and we only took a rest to look at the views. Traffic was not too heavy, but be aware, there were quite a few mountain bikers on the trail. As a bonus, there was free parking off of Prospect, but the lot was small. Although this isn't my favorite trail, I would return.", "This is a great spot. Not too much parking though. The hill climb in the beginning on a mountain bike is definitely challenging. The back side of the mountain has some banked turns and jumps on the down hill which is fun but watch your speed because there's always hikers there.", "This trail is sunny and has lots of hills. Most of the trails are pretty wide. You could take a stroller if wanted to actually push it up and down all those hills. We saw several people with strollers. There's also lots of cyclist but they won't get in your way because the trails are wide enough. There's some shady areas but its mostly sunny. A good hike to do in the morning or cooler months. The driving directions took us to a trail head on Regnart. It's on the left as you head up the street. There's parking off the street for maybe 5 cars. If you want the main parking lot it's on Prospect not too far away. There's also 1 outhouse there. There's tons of trails connecting all over those hills and they are marked well. You could make your hike as long or short as you wanted depending how many trails you connect to. I would definitely go here again. It's a good workout. ", 'This is about 8 miles from where I live, so rode my bike there, but did see the parking lot was full on a nice Saturday afternoon.  Had planned to run the trails, but decided to try a little off-road riding. Trails are well maintained and would consider the hike medium  in terms of needed exersion. Many dogs on the trail, but saw little evidence of their droppings.  Thank you thoughtful dog owners!  Nice enough views of the valley.  Would go back', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Rustic Canyon Loop Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['birding', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'partially paved', 'river', 'views', 'waterfall', 'muddy', 'rocky', 'off trail', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Rustic Canyon Loop Trail is a 4.6 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Riviera, California that features a waterfall and is only recommended for very experienced adventurers. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.
