user_texts: ['Amazing trail!! Dewy, but not wet. Road full of cars, but only saw three people.No matter how many times I do this trail, it still kicks my butt!! Short trail, but the change in elevation gets the heart pumping. I generally follow the trail out towards Cool to get a little more  distance in for the day.And running back down the hill makes the hike up soooooo worth it!', "Short but very steep hike. I did the shorter version but next time I'll push myself to go the extra .7 miles. I wouldn't recommend for beginners.", "did this today after some rain. Trail fine with hiking boots though I can see some parts being slippery with other shoes. The first part is still steep (I keep on thinking it's changed) but very doable, just take your time. Not much scenery until the top and on the way back but still very nice.", 'Great place for training. Go counter clockwise twice for a good workout.', 'Nice trail, steep incline in the beginning but if you’ve been hiking for a while, it wasn’t too bad.   Lots of trail runners, watch out, if you get in their way, they get a little grouchy!  More moderate than hard.', 'very hard hike but the feeling of accomplishment I had when I completed it!!! woohoo', 'Incline', "Labor day started with some exercise hiking. we did second time this year and also did clockwise - not like last time  . it's not easy when it's hot outside.  spring time was much easier and nicer when everything  was green. but overall it's great exercise  and hike . its pretty dusty trail.", 'Keep Breathing my friends ', 'It’s very fun to hike here . Also lots of views', 'It’s a very adventurous hike', 'Love this trail for training like hill repeats.  Good for training for races like Spartan.', 'Great demanding trail and not for the faint of heart.  I’m just starting to get back in shape and this trail really challenges me. Due to time constraints and my current capabilities I took the shortcut using the Pig Farm Trail route which made it about 1.5 mile hike round trip.', 'I have a love / hate relationship with Training hill, it’s great for hill repeats. And it’s close to a bunch of other trails. Great stuffBring water, especially during the warm time of the year.', 'That first 1.5 miles is a killer but great workout and beautiful hike. Was a little hard to find, didn’t realize you had to take another trail to get to it.. but recommend. Dog loved it!', 'Another weekend  with other hike experience.  Nice 2 hours of hiking and 4.5 miles made . Best way is to go  clockwise so soonest you reach the split make right and go about 1 mile uphill and then enjoy 2.8 miles of easy going.  watch for poison oak and a of horse manure on trail.', 'Got here around 8:30am on a Saturday and it was easy to find parking. You don’t have to pay just FYI! You have to walk along the river to get to the trailhead. As everyone said, one way is REAL steep and the other way is a gradual ascent. We did the steep way and it was pretty rough for an in-shape person. After the 1.5 mile grade, it was really easy the rest of the way - all downhill mainly. Beautiful scenery... and the dogs loved it too!', 'Definitely lives up to its name! My boyfriend and I did this trail to train for a backpacking trip we will be going on. There are six, very steep summits to the top. It was quite the workout! We will definitely be back here very soon.', "Feel the burn in the first mile then beautiful trails and streams for loop back. Do it twice cause it's so nice.", 'Great trail!! Lives up to its name and kicks some butt (in the beginning). Definitely worth the trek as once you make it to the "top" it opens up into a beautiful expanse. There are several other trails to follow that are pretty flat and easy to maneuver. The trail is clean and clear of brush. Saw one dead snake on my run today, but otherwise nothing other than some birds. The grass and trees are all still so green and quite lovely!! Gonna go back again next week!', 'great hike! perfect balance for a good workout and not too long as well. after the first mile,  its easy. Depending on fitness,  would rate it as moderate to high.', 'Perfect training hill! This is steep and gets your blood pumping.', 'Great trail! I love the challenge going up Training Hill and then the Loop is easy! In the Spring there are nice little waterfalls along the way!', 'One of my group’s go-to trails for incline training. We always do it counterclockwise (steep hill first) and the easy decline after you reach the top never gets old. The trail is easy to follow. Watch out for poison oak!', 'Decent short hike for a workout! Climb up the steep hill and then easy hike back. Weather is good today for a hike. The trail is green with wildflower and butterflies!', "good challenging hike for the first half mile or so, and then it levels out and starts to descend towards the end of the trail. there are 4 waterfalls on the trail you can't miss them. best time to go would be in March when it is raining.", 'great trail! If you chose to hike counterclockwise the first mile or so is definitely a straight up hike with very little level ground to recover on. Once you do reach the top of the hill it is smooth sailing from there. Today was my second time hiking it and it was a beautiful time of the year to explore up there, not too many people and I did encounter snake.', 'Great trail... straight up...', 'A really tough hike that’ll get you ready for fire season.', 'I got a good sweat in and beautiful views.', 'Great hill for a workout. Very steep starting out, then rolling hills afterwards.', 'The best workout/training trail. I will usually take it to the top of the hill and turn around and do the descent on Pig Farm (easier on the knees). Get to the trailhead either early on the weekends or late in the afternoon (parking is a bitch but worth it).', 'I think that the reviews that consider this easy maybe run this thing backwards lol.', 'It gets really steep at some spots. Can’t wait until it dries up a bit so it isn’t as hard to run down.', '', 'Really nice trail to get the heart pumping!', 'Great trail in the heart of the Auburn SRA for a good workout. Came early like the reviews advised and found plenty of parking at the trailhead. It was a steep grade but the fog and the water runoff made the trail muddy and wet. Had to turn off at Pig Farm to shorten the trek due to uncanny weather conditions higher up the hill. Will definitely start using this trail in the warmer months!', 'I wouldn’t consider hard.... maybe moderate. Good views!', 'This trail was really fun', 'Best hike I’ve been on yet!', 'They definitely mean steep! Fun, beautiful hike. Just challenging enough. Several other trails you can break off and go down to extend the hike. I saw 3 others hiking but only crossed paths with one other person. Get there early because parking is very limited at the trail head.', 'This is a steep climb, make sure you are physically fit. Happy trails!', 'Great hike if your looking for a little challenge. Well shaded and nice scenery!', "Steep uphill climb to get the legs and lungs burning. Pleasant at the top after cresting the hill. Enough shade for a summer run. Good option to cut the loop short at Pig Farm for those who aren't up to the whole thing. Only downside is the end of the trail sits right above the 49.", '', 'This I good trail run not to hard and not to easy. Trail is in good condition for running, hiking. I will be back again', "I absolutely love this trail. I've been here 4 weekends in a row, and I can see my progress. It's a great trail to test your ego and endurance. After the first time, I used the Stair Master two days later and ran out of energy a lot later than usual.This trail is also great for trail running. I tried it today from the top to the bottom. Lots of fun :) You can wash off your shoes and legs in the river afterward.", "This is an excellent trail if you're training for an event or just need a challenge. It is as difficult as you would expect, but if you're in decent shape, it is totally doable. The hills are challenging and the breaks are few, but merciful. We did the loop from gate 150 and turned left just before the bridge. We took Training Hill all the way to the top, and continued on the intersection with Olmstead Loop. From there, we took the Western States/Wendell T. Robie back down to the parking area. Most of the difficult terrain is in the shade. Views are few and far between. Overall, a great hike.", 'Kicked my rear!', 'It was good. River was absolutely stunning. going up was a good work out! got a little lost in the beginning though', 'This is my favorite trail if I want to have a quick steep uphill or downhill training. The hill is about 0.9 mile. The rest of 3.5 miles is mostly flat and in the shade. The trail is popular but not crowded at all.', 'Great trail for a exercise. Went up Training Hill and proceeded around the loop then cut up on Pig Farm for another good uphill to where it intersects Training Hill then back down. Total leg workout. Would not be fun in the heat but today was perfect weather, mostly overcast and cool.', 'Great workout! Tough first half followed by much easier second half. Not much scenery until latter half of hike. Would do it again!', 'Very tough trail, definitely earns its "hard" rating. A great workout but not much of a view. Only good view is actually at the very bottom on the bridge. Mostly shaded though so it\'s great for the summer. Best to go in the early morning in the summer.', 'If you want a work out, this is it! Prepping for Kilimanjaro and this is my local go-to for this. If you want to go longer, take the Olmstead Loop with this hill and you are guaranteed to be sore the next day.', 'You climb about 1k in .9 mile at the start of this,  no switchbacks and some flat/downhill stretches in that section, so the grade can be pretty steep in parts. Great training hill if you are a trail runner, and a blast on the downhill stretch.  You can take pig farm trail on the left, partway up if you want to shorten the loop', "The uphill on this is a butt kicker but after that it's an easy walk", "The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because I got lost. I didn't want to go back down training hill due to the steepness so I figured I'd go on cool trail to loop around. Did that walked for around 3 miles just for it to be a dead end. TH itself is not for out of shape people. It's very steep. Half the trail I walked on my tippy toes. Loads of black butterflies. Great work out.", 'A nice challenge almost one mile straight up. The rest is about 3.5 down. You will pass a few waterfalls, its very beautiful. Stay left and you will circle around.', 'Great work out, beautiful scenery, wildlife.  I recommend it to anyone who loves a challenge.', "The only reason this isn't a 5 star trail is because it's not full immersion. That being said, I LOVE this trail. Great cardio, fresh air, multiple trails, moss and Manzanita groves.", "Getting ready to hike the Canadian Rockies this summer. This hill was a good reality check for the type of training I need to continue to be ready. I'm definitely tired.", "The training hill climb is incredibly steep and tiring. Be prepared. The rest is easy and mostly downhill. Towards the end there is a waterfall that we went up using the rocks, it's a really cool experience so definitely try it.", "We ran this loop twice (8.68 miles), made that hill climb twice. My Apple Watch said I climbed 190 floors/2000 feet elevation. It's leg day, whether you like it or not. Straight uphill for about a mile. After that, pretty much downhill around the rest of the loop. Loop is, 1 mile up: 3.5 miles slow decline.", 'Definitely a butt kicker!  Bring your hiking sticks,  to help with the steep incline and decline. I went after all the heavy rains in 2017 and trail was muddy with stream flowing through and along it.  Nice views,  small waterfalls and shady parts.', "Incredible and challenging hike. The first mile was a steep incline. There's a nice clearing at the top for a quick snack. With all the recent rain we got to see several waterfalls. Such a beautiful day for this hike. I will definitely do this one again.", "Awesome awesome loop trail. Im in ok shape and it wasn't too hard. After first mile it's pretty much downhill.", 'Not for the weak. I went today and struggled. Only made it half way before I turned around and came back. There are some open spots with beautiful overlooks of nearby Auburn. \n\nI will come back when I gain more experience.', "Skip the stair stepper!!  This is leg day!! I took my dad here the day before yesterday and My legs are sore.. I can't imagine how my dads legs are... ", "Definitely a little soggy and slippery.  I wouldn't want to do the Training Hill portion going down!  Beautiful hike and lives up to its name.", '', 'This is a difficult but satisfying hike.  We hiked this the day after a hard rain had fallen and there were several really lovely waterfalls and a number of small streams that cross the trail.  The first mile is a real heart stopper though!', 'Nice an steep, just as I like it. had a great hike. It was my first time in this area and will look forward to the other trails in the area.', "Kick ass hike. Good workout and beautiful views. It's always cold in the morning, even in summer. Love it", "That first mile+ is definitely major kick-ass but doable by this ol' gal.  The rest of the trail is beautiful and primarily downhill.", 'This is a really good hike. I liked the steepness and I can see why this one is named "Training Hill".  I would recommend doing this Loop as a trainer for something like Pyramid Peak. Saw lots of runners and plenty of horses. Will do some side and connector trails next time.', 'wow, this was a really good workout, worth it if you go all the way around. first 1.5 miles is uphill, lots of elevation gain but the rest is a steady decline..... make lefts at the forks and you should stay on the trail.', 'Trail changes all the time but the experience is always great. Watch out for cats at night!', 'This trail was more difficult than expected which is why I fell in love with it even more! The first time I hiked the trail I came across a rattle snake, so keep your eyes peeled in the evening when it starts to cool off. They like to come out at that time. The second time I hiked the trail we did it twice, which was killer! But great! No rattlers that time. The trail is truly enjoyable.', "Went with my sister and her dog. Not many people on it because it goes straight up. Very steep and difficult. It was enjoyable but no views and doesn't really lead anywhere besides Cool.", 'The trail was quite difficult for the uphill portion.  The incline is quite steep but luckily has plenty of shade.  The back half has a steady decline down which was great for jogging down.  Sadly not too much in terms of excellent views, but a great workout.', 'In all of its various seasonal changes, I love this for a great workout close to home.  When I have time I do the loop but for the benefits, last time did the up and down....oh my sore shins!  The WST section is really pretty thanks to some rain!', 'GreAt I recommend going either for the sunset or sunrise', 'Great! It was definitely steep but worth the workout!! Moderate to difficult depending on your level of fitness!', 'Great work out!', 'great peaceful hike especially in may', 'Great hike. Scenic views. Moderate incline trails. Some erosion on the steeper trail. Just watch out for horse & dog droppings.', 'Always a great workout. I agree with other reviews that this is not a pristine "destination" hike. But rather a locals spot. Nice snow cap mtn views winter and spring and plenty of shade in summer on the steep parts. Someone asked about pay parking if free spots are filled. Two options 1) Coming down hwy 49 from Auburn instead of turning right across bridge to the free spots - go straight. Pay parking (or use your annual Poppy pass) is on right side of road sort of on shoulder a little past the bridge - or continue a bit further and there is more spots by the bathrooms on left. 2) or you turn right across bridge and continue past the free parking on right and you will see a turn off road on your left to more pay parking.', "Great challenge & nice and shady most of the way...would love to work up to looping around multiple times in one visit but I felt good just finishing the loop once. I never did see Folsom Lake as another reviewer said could be seen. I was able to find free street parking sort of late in the afternoon on a Wednesday but I am confused where I should park if that area is full. I know there is supposed to be paid parking nearby but I can't find anything on it. If anyone has a tip (or a link) on finding the paid lot coming from Sacramento on 50 I would appreciate that!", 'A good quick thigh burner when ya need one.Great view of Folsom lake and sac from the top.Great exploring beyond the trail at the top.', "The hill is no joke! 2 beautiful waterfalls along the way. Great variety from woods to open flat terrain. The hill is a killer but if you need a workout it's hard to beat!", 'Just when you think you are at the top, your NOT! Great training loop.', 'Very fun moderate trail, was conducting with 50 future Marines in the rain at a 4.5mph pace. 5 miles round trip from the road and back.Highly recommended for a quick and moderate level hike!', 'This is a great work out!', "1st hike of 2016. Tried a new park and took AllTrails app for a test run. End result: miles of trails covered w/ a smile and a cool trail map to boot. I always enjoy my hikes no matter where I go or what the trails bring, but this park is not an absolute repeat for me. If I lived in Sacramento, then yes, absolutely, I'd visit and trek it multiple times just cause it's close by and has ample trails and nice steep hills to keep the legs in check. However, not a destination I'd recommend for anyone further than an hour driving distance from this park. I find that this is more for the locals. Someone from the Bay Area or Central Valley where they have easy access to Mt. Tam, Muir Woods, Big Basin, and Yosemite to name a few of my favs for the same driving distance would be disappointed if they drove all the way out here. If you're looking to get away from the hustle and bustle of roads and freeways then this is not the place to go. Most of the trails are within ear distance of one of the nearby roads. Great park for crossing bridges, though! I enjoyed that and the steep-steep trail to get up to Foresthill Road Bridge. Steeper than Training Hill trail, though that was a fun grueling for the legs and lungs way to start off my hike on this day. If you're going to be in the Auburn area then I recommend you check out Hidden Falls park in place of this one. The trails are easier. Nothing steep. But the views of the creek are fantastic and you get to be in the rolling hills of the quiet countryside. Check out my review and pics. To sidetrack a bit: If you're a camping kinda person then I recommend checking out French Meadows past Georgetown. Super secluded. Great for those summer camping days by the lake. The kind without the motorboats relaxation. Go earlier as the reservoir does get super low by end of the summer season especially with the droughts we've been having in CA. Good fishing, though, I'm not a fan. I just really enjoyed spending the days chatting it up with friends and cooking gourmet camping meals then relaxing by the fireside at night. Of course, somehow every year we ended up with some crazy camp story like the year the breaks went out on the rental van.", "Not the prettiest hike, you can see folsom lake at a small lookout when you get the the very top. Great for working a different set of muscles in your legs. I've done it 30 times at least and always bring my dog. Tons of ticks though.", 'Me and my wife did this hike, was really great! First mile seemed all uphill, but whenever there is an uphill there is a down ', 'Still my favorite "guaranteed to kick you" hike. \nPerfect training hill for the Half Dome. \n\nSummertime: go early morning. \nParking: free off the side of highway 49.', 'Very good workout!', 'Great workout!  We brought our 2 and 5 y.o. and they loved it.', 'LOVE this trail.  Mainly single track with views of the river.  It is called training hill as there is a 1mile section straight up hill - I LOVE this section.  Great for running.  Or put your full backpack on and train for your next outback adventure.  Go early in the am to beat the heat.', "Lots of poison oak so stay on the trail. Keep dogs on leash. Trail runs along a HWy so it's kinda noisey. Not what we were looking for really. Would be great for a quick trail run with moderate difficulty.", 'Great Hike, the first part is 900ft incline in .9 of a mile. The fun part of this hike is making it up the hill. :)', 'Butt kicker on the way up!', 'Great workout and endurance hill. Starts at the river and has a steady incline for 1.5 miles. The trail is pretty well kept but it is definitely for the moderate to advanced hiker. The best part is the dip in the river on the decline. Great way to end the hike.', "Great training hike or run.  I'd agree about the recent reviews about signage, but like others have said if you just take left hand turns after you get to the top you will do a 4 mile loop.  Shortly after you get to the top there is a small clearing to the west of the trail that opens up to great views down canyon and to Auburn.  Also, if you have a Golden Poppy pass (or don't mind paying the $10), a good place to park is the Quarry Road trailhead, and then cross 49 to a short spur trail to the loop.", 'Great challenging hike , but the signs need to be improved.', 'Great trail, very challenging first mile and beautiful last three. The trails are not very well marked, so be sure to grab a trail map, we ended up going 11 miles instead of 4.', "I have a love/hate relationship with this trail. Ok, mostly hate lol. The name says it all. This is a training trail. No matter how many times you do it, it never gets any easier.\n\nDon't turn back when you get to the top. Just keep going and hang left at every junction and you'll make a nice easy loop that brings you back to the foot of training hill.", "My boys (13&11)and I completed the training hill loop today for the first time. Weather was awesome. I have to admit I didn't believe the hype about it but this trail is legit and will test your fitness. It is the only time I couldn't keep up with my boys. Definitely going back for some more abuse.", 'This is my absolute favorite hill yet. So beautiful and peaceful never get tired of it, fast hard intense workout.....', 'Excellent conditioning. I like to do this trail 1-2 times a week. There is a short uphill before you get to the actual "Training Hill".  This can be pretty intense. Once you\'ve made it the 1.4 to the top, it\'s an easy run downhill from there and offers an abundance of shade. Be prepared...as much as you read about how steep it is, it will never prepare you for what you see when you get there. You will make it to the top and it does get easier, believe it or not. Once you\'re done, go soak in the beautiful water below.', 'Great workout. This is becoming a regular trek for us. Kicks my ass but what a great feeling when you get to the top. Recently encountered a black bear on the way back down pig farm trail. We rounded a corner and there he was a mere 15 ft from us. Scared the crap out if us. Whew.', "I've done this trail two times.  The first mile or so is elevated, but the rest (if you do the loop to cool and back) is flat and manageable.", "I did this 6-2-14 and that first mile is an asskicker.... Does anyone know the trail head to take back to make it a 4mile loop....I couldn't find it and just went back down. GREAT WORKOUT!!!!!!!!!!!!!", "Did this in March. Everything was nice and green. They should rename this heart attack hill lol.  I loved the workout, however my husband who was carrying our 25lb daughter in a backpack was struggling. I give it 4 stars for the exercise. Views were good. but I didn't like how loud the cars were at the beginning and end of the trail (close to the confluence). This particular loop wasn't too crowded tho it was hard to find a parking space at the confluence. We met mostly runners on the trail and a few horses. I would not recommend this loop for anyone with small kids who are walking or anyone who isn't a regular hiker or in descent shape.", "They use this trail to train horse's.  that should give you an idea of the difficulty of the initial climb. Sign states .9 miles almost all up hill shortly after beginning the trail, but like others have stated it evens out at the top.  Recommend trying this in the spring when the grasses are green. Bring water or purification as there isn't any reliable water source once you climb away from the river.", "BEASTMODE on the way up. Once u get to the top there's easy wide open trails to run. ", "If you want to know the shape your heart is in go up this and pig farm trail. If you're still alive you're good hahaha", 'Tough hike up, excellent workout for your lungs and legs.  I like to do this hill a few times a month when preparing for trail races.', "There's a reason why they call this training hill. It's a pretty steep incline the entire way, but it's a great workout!", "This trail was pretty challenging. My legs will definitely be feeling it tomorrow. If you're not into a decent amount of incline within a short amount of time, then I wouldn't recommend this trail. If you're up for a little adventure and challenge, then you will for sure want to check it out!  ", "This is pretty tough!  Try doing it with a 40lb pack on!  Perfect for training to climb Mt. Shasta.  Once you get up the steep hill side, it levels out.  You can take Pig Farm Trail Loop back up for those looking for an extra challenge, which is also very steep.  I'm rating this a 5 star for degree of difficulty. ", 'This is a challenging hike.  Once completed you feel great. I do this trail at least once a week. ', 'this trail is not for the light hearted or cardiac impaired; it goes straight up for 1.4 miles. After that it is all a piece of cake and the body feels great. we use it regularly fora cardio workout. the waterfalls (esp in the spring are fantastic.)', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Rodeo Valley Trail To Miwok Trail Loop Via Coastal Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['birding', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'beach', 'forest', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Rodeo Valley Trail To Miwok Trail Loop Via Coastal Trail is a 11.3 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Mill Valley, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
['My favorite backyard hiking area! Easily end up with 15-20 miles. Coastal scenery is top notch, especially sunrise/sunset hikes. Lots of challenging hills to choose from. Great day hike', 'There are so many trails; even though we follow the direction, we still got lost 3 times and had to trek back. At one point the trail showed on the map/GPS doesn’t exist. Wasn’t sure I was going to make it through; but I did, yay! We got some sun, fog, and rain, too during our hike. Was a great hike though - loved it.', 'The part that goes from parking lot to Rodeo Trail is wrong— the path is covered in brush, unmaintained and impassable. I backtracked and went further along the road to get on the trail. After that it was good. Karl the Fog was in full effect. I got lost as usual. Couldnt run strava cos of battery drain but it feels like I ran at least 13.1', 'Great for mountain biking not much for hiking.', 'Nice views, fun to explore and wasnt too hard of a hike.', 'This is my first longest trail route. It has lot of trails inside you may end up going into some other route ensure you can carry gps trackers. In this trail route you will see golden gate and Pacific Ocean. Good for moderate level hikers to start with hard levels', 'NOT HARD. Moderate at best. We were expecting a challenging workout, but were disappointed. Never even broke a sweat.', 'Great hike/run. I enjoyed going first thing in the morning as the sun was burning off the fog.', 'This was great. Very serene hike. There were probably some incredible views on this hike, but I didn’t see them because there was so much fog. I quite enjoyed the fog, though. It made for a very eerie and isolating experience. There was a short time where the fog broke and gave me a glimpse at Sausalito. It was breathtaking.I saw quail, hawks, ravens, and a ton of little chirpy birds. Some of their calls were really beautiful. There were also lizards, a group of bucks, at least 15 rabbits, and plenty of slugs.As far as difficulty, the main thing here is that it’s long! I was sweating a lot by the end, but there was never an incline that made me feel like my lungs were on fire. Anyone can do this hike.I’ll definitely be back, and highly recommend this hike for people with at least 3.5 hours to kill. Don’t be scared off by the “hard” label or the long distance. It’ll hurt, but you can do it!', 'Great hike, great views. Not a lot of shade on the trail, so bring plenty of water for you and your canine companion.', 'Great workout, but not the best hike to bring your girlfriend on for her bday - bring lots of water and apologies.', 'This is a challenging hike, it’s long and it has numerous steep climbs that are each 1-2 miles in length and there is no tree cover.  I parked at the suggested trailhead near the roundabout off Conzelman Road and hiked clockwise.  My total hike was 12 miles, 4 hours 20 minutes.', 'Nice view . Very good workout.', "I'm not one to go hiking much but I did the entire trail suggested by All Trails. It was foggy out most of the time which was pretty cool, but not much to see looking outwards from the trail. It was long and hard in my opinion as a non hiker but completely worth it just to say you did it.", 'Nice, moderate trail. Pretty much exposed throughout whole trail, so great spring hike', 'Best views are before the run below the parking lot.', 'Fantastic loop. It was nontrivial to figure out where the various trails connected, so i often consulted the app. The trail that connects to the loop is having some sort of construction work done at the very end, which made it a bit sketchy. You can either power through or walk along the highway, which was a bit sketchy in its own right.', 'I love this place', "Very nice hike, worth noting that you can also drive your car down the hill, take a left and you can find parking with access to Rodeo Valley Trail which takes you to the Miwok / Bobcat intersection. Views are great at the top, you can see the Bay Bridge and Golden Gate through the hills. When you're down, its worth a drive down to the beach", 'Views are spectacular! Perfectly challenging, not too difficult for my nine year old son.', "This is a combination of a few trails, so if you're just going off signs it's easy to get lost if you're not familiar with the area (I'm not). The AllTrails map helped me stay on track though! Beautiful views at the top of the loop, great place to stop and eat lunch if you're making a day of it. The end of the trail is along a windy road, so be careful on the tight shoulders, otherwise great!", 'One of my favorite hikes.  Pretty steep climb most of the way, with very little shade so bring some sun protection.  You can get a great view of Marin and the Golden Gate Bridge at the top of this loop!', 'I started from the Coastal Trail, then the Bobcat Trail, and continued to the Rodeo Valley Trail for a total of 7.8 miles. While I was hiking fog was rolling in so it blocked the Sun and keep me cool all the way. It was a great afternoon hike.', 'Would have a been a great walk except for the road part at the end.  Otherwise it was great! Lol', 'Good, nice wise single track, good mix up uphill and descent , nice views', 'Awesome', 'Super nice', 'Hiked early morning - heavy fog made for a cool hike but blocked what I would assume are incredible views', 'Great view, and easy trail!', 'Did the Tennessee valley, part of coastal trail to the top and then back down to Tennessee beach a total of 7 miles. Good hike, parts of coastal pretty steep, Tennessee valley is an easy hike. Wide paths, just no shade so wear sunblock and a hat on a rare sunny day in the bay.', 'I love hiking here! It has awesome views of marin;)', 'It was very beautiful. Great way to get away from the city.', "Oh my, I can't say enough about the Headlands!  You can be in downtown San Fran, and then in minutes be in the middle of nowhere/everywhere in the Marin Headlands.  Just amazing that we were able to protect these lands from development so close to such a large metropolitan area.  Great for biking, hiking, walking along the beach, spectacular vistas, the smell of eucalyptus, oh my.", 'Great trail for everyone who wants adventure, likes learning about history, and wants different paces with the trail at a time.', 'RRRRRRREEEEEEAAAAAAAAALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLLYYYYYYYYYYY GOOD TRAIL!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! I did this trail last year just watch out for poison oak at the top of the trail.', 'Beautiful.', 'These hills offer endless possibilities for walking, hiking and running. A good area to come back to at different times of the year so you can see how things in nature change and find new vistas each time. Great for a 3-4 hour run! Hills everywhere!', "This was a great trail. We didn't do the whole 24 miles (maybe 7), but it was gorgeous. We headed down the tennessee valley trail and then climbed up to the summit and came back around. 

The trail is well developed and not too strenuous with stunning views at the top. 

Make sure to come early if you're coming on a weekend because there are a TON of cars and parking is rough if you park at the tennessee trailhead. We went when there were a lot of people and was a little discouraged, but once we got on the trail....everyone dispersed and it was very peaceful. 

", 'Awesome cardio trail & gorgeous view =)', "Primarily steep fire roads great for cardio, climbing, and training, but fun factor for me is low because there is only 1 single track trail here (it's called Old Springs Trail, great 1.5 mile downhill you can bomb at the end of your ride if you start at the stables). The trails are wide open providing excellent views of the landscape. We did see a Coyote her too! This place would also be great for intense trail running too but it is also extremely windy here.", "I went to the Marin headlands and it was all fire roads and so easy.   So if you are looking for fun single track trails don't go to Marin Headlands.   If u are any better than a beginner mountain biker this trail stinks (MarinHeadlands trail).  I went exactly where this app told me to go when you hit directions.   It was a total waste of time.  However I met a guy who said there were some good single tracks near this trail near Mill Creek area.   This is a hiking trail if you go where the directions tell you to go.", 'There are several trails here.  I have been on 2 so far and both wildly beautiful and dramatic.  If you can catch it on a sunny day, all the better.  Can be very windy and parts have a steep climb.  Take a map!!!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Inspiration Point - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'partially paved', 'views']
hike_description: Inspiration Point is a 2.9 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Santa Barbara, California that offers scenic views and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts: ['This trail has a steady ascend and is well marked.The views at the end are amazing and gives you a great perspective of the entire Santa Barbara.', 'This hike was very pretty. I loved the summit and exploring the paths and panoramic view of the coast. It is worth every step. For beginner-intermediate hikers, my friend and I took our time going up to the point. There is a good amount of shade along they way. We passed a creek with little water and saw small groups of people frequently. The entire hike was about 6 miles for us. Parking on the side of the streets can be crowded in the weekend.', 'The first part of the hike is on a road which is not so nice, but the trail is pretty good to walk on after that. The views at the top are cool!', 'Love it! I walked it many times.  Wear sturdy shoes and use walking sticks. Trail is rough and rocky in places.', 'very easy  good hike for cardio and good one for beginners too', "This is a fun hike - pretty easy and mellow for the most part. The parking made it seem like it was going to be crowded, but we didn't really run into anyone here. We brought out pup and she had a blast!", 'BEAUTIFUL views! Limited parking space if you go in the morning.', 'Easy hike with a beautiful view of Santa Barbara at the end.', 'Nice hike with beautiful views', 'Easy trail with gorgeous views', 'This was harder then I expected. It’s really uphill and pretty bumpy/rocky. Some beautiful views along the way. It’s 2.8 miles to the top. Would recommend when it’s not too hot out or cloudy day because there’s no shade.', 'On an overcast weekend morning, starting out at 9:15am, it was not crowded on the trail though parking was pretty full. A beautiful hike even with some clouds. The trail forks about halfway up. Stay to the left.', "It's the same starting point as a few other hikes, and a great one! I did this hike in mid August. It was really hot but doable and short. The view at the top was worth it. I also wasn't as crowded as I thought it would be.", "Details: There are actually two different starting points for this trail. The one mentioned here is off Spyglass road (3 miles RT), but the other one is off Foothill Road (about 7 miles RT). This review is based off the shorter version from Spyglass Road.Pros:- Great views- The first half is mostly flat - Dogs allowedCons- My biggest complaint, regardless of where you start, is that there is no sign or indication to let you know you've reached the finish line. You just have to assume because of the view and the path everyone else is taking.- At least half of the trail doesn't have shade- It is very crowded, but the longer version is less crowded. Even when I left today around 8pm, all the parking spots were still full. - Not enough parking.- Not well marked. I got turned around more than once because there were a couple forks with no clear indication of which way to go.", 'I’m a beginner hiker and this trail was perfect for a first hike!', 'A great trial that unfortunately everyone knows about. Not great for hot days due to lack of shade though. Always high foot traffic, and parking is usually frustrating; pay attention to parking signs because cars Will be Towed!... It ends with a stunning view that everyone should experience at least once if they are local, and my dog loves this trail as much as me and everyone else.', 'This is my go-to hike in Santa Barbara. It is the right blend of difficult and beautiful. Doing trail runs on this hike is a huge part of my plan to get in better shape.', 'Amazing! I was so sore the next day!!', 'Great views. Too many people and unleashed dogs for my liking though.', 'Very nice short afternoon hike with spectacular Views over Santa Barbara', 'Beautiful views of Santa Barbara', 'Beautiful trail and views!', 'Very convenient place to hike if you’re visiting Santa Barbara and live in the area but don’t want to venture up to San Rafael Wildnerness or Lake Cachuma.', 'Highly recommended!', 'Short hike with beautiful views!!! Highly recommended you can also do trail run or bike ', "Great view! Took us about 2hrs round trip.  Going up was a tad difficult if you're an average hiker, but great workout!", 'Good for stomping out stress.', 'always a great go to when I want to get a quick trail run or hike with the pup. beware of brushing up on poison oak on the sides of the trail.', 'It was a very nice hike. we went at 7am, perfect', 'love this hike', 'Good Solid hike. uphill on the way there and down on the way back, pretty easy good for everybody', "Such a great hike and a rewarding view. Not to hard I've seen young kids make it to the top.", 'love it', 'This is a long trail. There is a cement road that technically leads to the trail head. In total I did almost 4 miles. Pretty much all uphill and rocky. Extremely hot because your in a canyon with rocks. Definitely bring water, wear big spray and wear a hat. Very worth it, I got a great workout.', "I am here for work and by myself- so I wanted a safe, clearly marked. Trafficked trail and it was exactly that! Met a few friendly people along the way too who gave me the helpful hint of always stay to the left!! (There are several splits and you don't want to go to the right). I got there on Sunday at about 7:30 am and barely found parking as someone was leaving. By 9 when I left people were parked a good half mile down the road.", 'Great hike for the view at the top. Good beginner to moderate level', 'Great hike for the view at the top. Good beginner to moderate level', 'Great hike for the view at the top. Good beginner to moderate level', 'I had a good time, but I wish the signage was better. I ended up going to a different peak with a really steep hill so got a bit of an extra workout, but Inspiration Point itself is gorgeous. I knew it would be busy so I went early, but was still surprised by the amount of people on a Sunday morning. Beautiful spot though, especially with the recent rains filling the small stream in the canyon, so definitely worth it at least once.', 'Extremely average and heavily trafficked hike compared to all the amazing sights in the Los Padres. Good hike for beginners though', 'Awesome scenery.  Great view from top. Straightforward relatively easy hike.', 'not a bad hike.', 'Awesome views!  Go early - it gets hot.', "An SB classic, can't go wrong here. Usually crowded though.", 'great view. dusty. hot. recommend going early in the morning or late evening. took us 37 min to reach the top.', 'Great overlook hike for visitors, Not too strenuous, but often very crowded.', 'Great', 'Definitely a workout. Did it while wearing my 25lb toddler on my back so the "up" to Inspiration Point hurt, yikes! Careful with the lose rocks, hubby rolled ankle on way down. So happy when it was over! The view at the top though... So worth it!', 'I went Jesusita Trail to Inspiration Pt. about 3.5mi each way with a bit over 1600ft of elevation gain. Some parts were too steep to run.  Trail footing a bit loose but there were 3streams to cross along with a water fountain at like mi 1.5.  Miles 0-1 easy, 1-2 harder and the best for last 2-3.5 was challenging!!', 'The trail was a little washed out from the rain...a good hike once you get past the paved trails.', 'Washed out from the rain, but still very fun.', "If you come after 8 you'll probably end up parking 1-2 miles away from the trailhead. Got lost a couple times. There is a fork in the road and I went right which leads to a dead end. Go left which takes you up higher. Obviously the views are incredible but if you come really early to get a good parking spot, you may not get the best view because the sun may not be out yet.", "The view is magnificent.  Try to wear high tops because it can get a little rocky/gravel-y and easy to roll an ankle.  Also, try to avoid the weekend. This might be SB's busiest trail.", "This was our first family hike for 2016 and we all loved it. The view at the top is amazing and sunset  is incredible. The only thing I didn't like so much was that is too busy, but overall a fun hike everyone should try!!", "Phenomenal! Worth the journey for young and old.  Bring a stick to help with steep grades and wear good shoes with plenty of traction. BRING WATER if you are going to the top which you absolutely must do!! Great family outing for free just bring snacks and keep you trash with you unless it's fruit or veggies.", 'Always a great brief hike!', 'Did this hike today and even tho you get a pretty good workout it is still doable for most. Offers lots of shade until you get close to inspiration point.', 'Good trail. First section is paved road. Then changes to dirt trail with rocks.  Good amount of uphill climbing with a lot of trail traffic.', 'Inspiration Point was fantastic! It was easy to find and just strenuous enough to feel proud of yourself once you get to the top. To top it all off, the view at the top will remind you how beautiful Santa Barbara really is.', "A Santa Barbara classic. Relatively moderate distance and elevation gain with an absolutely epic payoff in the form of a 180 degree panoramic ocean view. You won't be disappointed.", "I unexpectedly went to Santa Barbara today to run an errand and made time to hike this trail. I'm happy I did! I decided on hiking Tunnel trail that takes you to Inspiration Point. It intercepts with Jesusita Trail that you can also hike to the point, but it's 3-4 miles longer if you start this trail further down the canyon. I figured 4 miles would be fine for this hike. ;) I was lucky to snag a great parking spot, otherwise I can see why it would take an extra mile or so to just walk to the trailhead because parking is very limited. Tunnel trail starts out on a paved road, then turns into a wide dirt trail, and then for the final mile is a narrow rocky trail that leads you to Inspiration Point. I almost missed the turn off to the left that takes you to the top by the dried up creek. It's not clearly marked but just remember you need to get on the narrow trail that goes up. Even though Inspiration point isn't the top of the peak you still gain more than 1,300 in elevation. I loved this trail because it wasn't so long that you're exhausted, but you still get a great workout. It was really humid in Santa Barbara this evening so I got an even greater workout. I would recommend only doing this hike when it's cool. I was really warm going up and I started at 5:30 pm or so. However, annoying bugs seemed to follow me up the trail lol probably due to the humidity! I hiked this trail close to sunset and the views of the Pacific Ocean were beautiful. This happy and inspiring trail was a great way to look at Santa Barbara from up top and observe the beauty of the sea, mountains, and skies beneath me!", "Great morning hike! Short, but strenuous enough to give you a bit of a workout. It's better to go when it's cooler out because this hike does not have much cover.", "Don't be fooled. This hike can be exhausting. Add another mile due to lack of parking. We had to park at least one half mile away. The uphill climb is a constant incline. I loved this joke because it was a work out. Be careful coming back. It is a fast decline. We saw one injury and could have easily injured ourselves two or three times due to speed. Bring water and bars. Our dogs literally quit on us. For those not in great shape take your time. I give this hike 4 stars because there is not enough ocean views. Definitely recommend for a workout.", 'Make sure to take plenty of water, but the view is definitely worth the hike.', 'Being from WA I was not used to the heat. I run trails all over WA. This hike was amazing but I got exhausted fast. I think I just needed extra water and to slow down. Out of towners definitely go just take your time and bring lots of water!', 'New here in the area and this trail is our standard now. Nice strong constant climbing but no real hand climbing with a wonderful payoff at the top! Really busy on the weekends and we suggest parking lower on tunnel road and getting the extra uphill warmup! If friends are in town, this is the spot for inspiration ;) ', 'Great hike!! Not too strenuous but not to simple. Definitely recommend this hike.', 'Nice workout, parking on tunnel rd might be difficult, you will be going up cement road first then you will reach the dirt path. There is a really rocky trail that goes up the mountain after the cross section, its a great view up there ', 'Very moderate hike, good well marked trail, pretty view of Santa Barbara and the ocean.', "Was a good workout but not too strenuous. I hiked this on vacation with my cousin and her boyfriend. He proposed at the top. So it really isn't extremely difficult. Such a beautiful view from the top. ", 'Trail was rated strenuous but at least for this time of you it definitely was a moderate hike. Not to much to view on the way up however the view from the top is amazing. Parking is limited so you may have to walk a bit to get to the trailhead. ', "I wouldn't classify this as extremely difficult, but it did wear us out. The view from the top is awesome. We went on a clear day and could see all the Channel Islands. Parking is difficult on weekends. ", "This is an awesome workout. The trail itself isn't gorgeous but the view at the top is well worth it. Plan on hiking from your car to the trailhead!!!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Alum Rock South Rim Trail  - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'river', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'bugs', 'over grown', 'rocky', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Alum Rock South Rim Trail  is a 4.3 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near San Jose, California that features a river and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
["easy to moderate hike. lots of shade and picnic areas near the visitor center. there is a fee to park near the visitor center but there's a couple of free parking lots half a mile before the visitor center.", 'My son loved this walk!', "I can't believe I waited this long to hike this trail. Beautiful trail!! Hiked along a stream. After that you're in a nice park. Then you're looking at mineral ponds. Super cool!!", 'This trail is quite easy to do and has nice views. Kid friendly.', "Probably one of the most shaded walks I've ever done. Nice view, bearable elevation and very easy to complete within 2 hours. Great place for picnic, biking, hiking and running. Will definitely return.", 'Beautiful walk. Nice and shaded. Plenty of places to catch your breath and enjoy the views', 'Fully shaded hike even good sun light. Great terrain for training endurance track', '', 'Love this hike, but the trail has been closed for construction :(', 'a fav on a cool morn!', "A Nice Hike to go to on even on a hot day. North Rim trail was closed so took the switchback trail to south rim trail. Wasn't too disappointed though. The switchback is a pretty good workout in itself. The park as such is a really good place to plan a group picnic. A lot of Picnic spots and tables with nets for some outdoor shuttle or some volleyball. Loads of trails and biking routes. Many alternatives to lengthen the trek. Definitely looking forward to coming again and doing another trail", 'Good tree cover. Fun hike!', 'Loved this trail! All the tree coverage made it a very pleasant hike on a hot day, and the scent of wildflowers and herbs along the way was intoxicating :) Can’t wait to go back!', 'Love this trail although closed passed the switchback', 'The ascend was beautiful, shady and calm. Lovely hike for mornings. Park has two free parking lots and you get a spot if you are inside by 10.30am. You will have to walk a mile from the parking lot to reach the trail head.', 'A great walk on a warm day, lots of shade and plenty to see', "People complaining about to this park, just a bunch of whiners. There's no resaon to post review as a 3 *** or 2 park. This is an AMAZING place to hang around with family and friends. Live to the fullest people!", 'Pleasant shady hike.  Nice to be by the creek and then get some elevation after the switchbacks and see a great view of San Jose.', 'It’s a nice trail especially If you are not used to do a lot.  It’s considered as moderate but l would say it’s an easy to light moderate trail. Great for families with kids who want to do more than just a walk. Nice view on the valley, 75% of the trail is under the trees canopy. You will love it during summertime .', 'The trail map is wrong', "Alum Rock park is one of my favorite it's the first park I  started exploring on my own great to bring kids & family.It is considered A moderate hike,It offers free parking,water fountains,restrooms& playgrounds for children.Take the trail  to eagle rock park where you can overlook San Jose & enjoy the sunset! For those who enjoy mountainbiking alum rock park is A great place to do that too! I always bring A new or returning friend & they love it", "I'm used to mountain biking in Washington so maybe I'm a little biased, but I didn't love this as a mountain biking trail. Some great views at the top, but very little technical work required, mainly just brute leg strength. It was also a little too crowded to get any good speed up without someone being in your way. Not a bad ride, but also not great.", 'Good uphill climb, beautiful views!', 'Love it up there great place to hike or mountain bike!', "Great morning hike with enough elevation to get the heart rate up. There's lots of shade but it's never too covered up. Tons of small wildlife scrabbling about.", 'Super fun single track when Penitencia Creek trail turns into South Rim trail. A little too much pavement and can be crowded along Penitencia Creek trail. Some of that can be avoided by taking the North Rim trail and connecting to South Rim.', "My very first hike ever back in 2009. Starts off gorgeous, then the sun kicks your ass as you trail uphill lol it's a gorgeous hike with a well-earned view. Don't bring your rookie friends in this hike if you plan on making it to the top.", "Some easy trails. There's a playground, so its kid friendly.", "South rim trail is closed indefinitely, don't waste your time if you are heading there.", 'There is a notice on the trail head saying south rim trail is closed due to 2017 winter storm.', 'So nice right now. The bridges are stunning.', "One of my all time favorite hikes. Not too hard. Great hiking through tree shaded north slope trails. Beware: I have personally had all too close brush with a rattler here. I've also heard credible reports of mountain lion sightings on this trail. Two words: Situational Awareness.", "Wow it is real beautiful here.  The stream runs all the way through and it's so peaceful.", "This was my 3-year olds first hike. I'm from San Diego where most hikes are desert (full sun, no trees) and so this beautiful hike with all the trees and the fact we saw deer gets this hike 5 stars!  My son made it to the top. I'm so proud. He asked to be carried one time but that lasted about 10 minutes and then he wanted to walk/explore on his own.", 'Great views of the hills and city.
The South Rim switchback (eastmost part) is currently closed because of a landslide. Looks like you could walk over it but I just turned back as the signs recommended.
Parking is $6 for a day.', 'Wonderful views of San Jose and off-roading was nice', "Parking is paid and the parking area is usually not very busy, except when groups or families book the picnic grounds for a party.
The trail is understandably dry and dusty this time of the year, but the views from the hill-tops are quite amazing. The trails can be very narrow, especially in the switchback routes, but overall the risk level is not high. If you hike before noon, you'll find that most of the south rim trail is shaded. Elevation is also okay, but it can get somewhat steep in the switchbacks.", 'The trail is partially closed due to land slide', 'Very nice for beginners or moderate hikers.Nice shaded trail with medium incline. The view is excellent through out. Also nice picnic area in the starting point suitable for group activities and barbecues.By the way the first three parking lots are free and the third (closer to trail) is paid.', 'nice challenging uphill run, killer view from the top', 'It is a great place to hike:)', 'South rim trail has nice elevation changes and beautiful scenic views. As I felt like I had not had enough I extended my run to the North - easier and more crowded.', 'Great moderate hike overall hike from sycamore to  south rim to historic mineral springs and a little bit up the north woodland back to our car at rustic landing which has free parking from now until sept 2016 is about 6 miles. Scenic, shady, and light incline but get you worked up within 2 miles in. Great for kids about 10+ and plenty of rest areas. Got to see the groetta mineral springs. Good place to hike in San Jose. A little bit over 2 hours for the hike. No dogs. Bikes and horse back riding trails accommodation.', "Good for the kids we started a little farther back cause we were to cheap to pay for parking. My 7 10 and 11 year old kids did it like nothing it's a good start off trail to build staminum", 'Very good for newcomers to build up endurance.', 'It was nice. Saw wild turkeys on the trail, exciting! A little chilly under all of the trees.', 'Lots of shade, easy incline. Great for beginning hikers who are building up endurance.', 'Great', 'We had a wonderful hike.  Absolutely beautiful.  Took all of our kids and hiked all over.  Climbed Eagle Rock, did North Rim, Penticienta and the Mineral bath trail.  Everyone loved it, kids included. Will be going back for sure!', 'It was beautiful and so green. We got to see some cows and birds.', "This is a nice hike. Depending on which side you start at, it will steep switchbacks at first, and then easy and fairly flat after, or vice versa. The trail has a decent view, but does not go to the top or any peak of any mountain. Highly recommend. It's a good hike for older kids (because it's a little tough at parts). Alum rock park in general is good for kids. It goes along the creek for a little bit and crosses the bridge with a cute bridge.", "Fun mix of hills and flat area. It's easy enough for most older kids, and has some great views of the valley from the top of the trail.", '', 'Great spot right in our own backyard. Lots of different trails & interesting history.', 'Great option so close to the valley. Lots of trails. Good for picnics, running, biking & hiking', ':)', 'Easy hike. Pretty views and cool historical sulfur baths.', 'Starting to get brown and dry but still plenty to see. Great view from the eastern side of the valley at the top.', 'Pleasant hikes, we hike: Penitencia Creek Trail, South Rim Trail, and Sycamore switchbacks ~ 9 miles for 3.5 hours.', 'Fun and good for the kids', 'kjhl I up', 'This was an amazingly calm and beautiful trail, lots of shade and plenty if deer to watch.', 'Awesome park, good for hikes, jogs, and much more. Their is also two playgrounds a volleyball court and lots of picnic tables. Good for hot days with all its shade and great for family gatherings.', "There is parking outside the park. You can walk in through a side gate. It's a bit of a walk to get to the actual campground but its a nice walk. Shaded on some parts. Creeks along the trail. After going past all the picnic area, you will see the path to the hiking trails and see all the old grottos and water outlets. Lots of blue jays. Saw a baby deer.", 'Alum is half park half picnic area. Be prepared for lot of trash, noise and under prepared people. A decent view of the South Bay, but go in spring or fall for less people and heat.', "Not too difficult. Nothing much to see, the view not being something extraordinary.

If you are looking for a view, then don't do it in the afternoon as the sun will be directly coming from the Silicon Valley thus spoiling the view.

Lots of shade, lots of trees.

Saw a wild coyote, too.", "Nice place for a hike to eagle rock the view is beautiful  on a clear day , there's also 2 water falls  but u have to hike off trail . I don't want  to tell anyone the location cause people will trash it  sorry people ", "i was really impressed with the size and variety of trails here.  and all so close to the city, yet for the most part, you feel out in the wilderness.  lots of wildlife (a couple deer, turkeys, a snake, multitudes of birds, squirrels, etc, a few lizards and thankfully no mountain lions), clean, well maintained.  some challenging areas, though not technical.  for hiking this place is beautiful.  did the south rim, creekside, woodland, part of the north rim and the eagle rock trails.  a great afternoon.  next time, will do the rest of the north rim, with the extra loops which go up to the summit of the ridge on the north side, more exposed, less shade.  will need sunscreen up there, and a cool day i think.  the south side is nicely shaded and pleasant.  gains several hundred feet of elevation, but not too steeply.  good for someone who hasn't done much of this in far too long.  though, after all those trails and ups and downs, the knees were about shot by the end.  
anyway, great photos, loved the park and the history behind it.  
Update:
did the north rim trail with the Todd quick trail and the Boccardo loop up to the sierra vista open space preserve and the summit.  hot, dry, pastureland.  nice views from the top, but swatting flies, sidestepping cow/horse manure and dodging a couple of rather perturbed bulls who did not appear to be in the mood for company- the pawing at the ground and feigned charges gave a distinctive Pamplona feel to the hike.  it was a knee-killer coming down from that elevation.  if i do the north again, it'll be on a bike.  
have done the south rim again and thoroughly enjoyed again.  definitely my preference of the 2 major trails.  and there are numerous smaller trails all well-worth the taking. ", "Alum Rock (Penitencia Creek Trail to South Rim Trail Loop) is perfect if you live in San Jose and you want a brisk hike but don't have time to leave the area. It's a great casual-but-uphill hike that only takes about 2 hours. If you have allergies, take your meds and bring Kleenex.", 'Not sure what the first commenter is thinking. The trail I describe is indeed an official park entrance and is part of the official hiking trails. You can see the entrance clearly marked with trail maps available. Also, go here and you will see the map: http://ca-sanjose.civicplus.com/DocumentCenter/View/30229', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Bronson Caves - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'cave', 'views']
hike_description: Bronson Caves is a 0.6 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Los Angeles, California that features a cave and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

user_texts:
['great starter goes young kids, they love the cave', "Really neat nature walk (considering it's roughly 0.2 miles one way lol) it's a very interesting cave. Despite it being really short it's a definite must visit as the surrounding area is really interesting as well. Got to see a group setting up the area for a future Toyota commercial so that was also cool.", 'A pretty short and neat trail. Just for some walking and great for dogs. The cave is pretty cool and small. Would go back again. Lots of parking if you come around 7-7:30. After that it gets packed on a Saturday.', 'Fuck ya', 'Honestly, the "hike" itself -- a short, gentle climb up a very wide fire road -- is nothing to write home about.But, Holy Mackerel, Batman! It leads... to the Batcave! At least in the campy 60's TV series. It's still a fun place to take out-of-town visitors or young kids. In addition to the small cave, stone labyrinth, and views of the Hollywood sign, you have a good chance of seeing some kind of shoot, as the caves remain a popular filming location.', 'This is a short hike with a bit of history. The Caves were leftover from mining operations in the 1920s and later used in the campy Batman TV series. Remember... "To the Batcave"?', 'Neat family friendly path with a connection to the nostalgic Batman show;  https://youtu.be/xIxRC8AQeEUEnjoy!', 'Super easy hike. I usually jog there from my apt since I live nearby. The caves are really to look at. Plus, it is the original BATCAVE', 'Short and easy trail but the pay off is that you can say you went to the original Adam West Batcave! Very cool Also saw a bunch of little animals on the way, which was fun.', 'Easy and short. Caves are semi cool, and you can see the Hollywood sign after you pass the caves. Good place to bring out of towners who can’t handle much incline or long treks', 'Super easy nice warm up', 'easy.', 'Super easy! If you’re a beginner on hiking this is a good place to start. Easy mellow very chill, early mornings are best, super  empty so you feel like you’re there alone. Good for dogs and kids, awesome pics on a clear sunny day.', 'Super easy walking trail and open space for kids to explore', 'Great easy hike with 3 1/2 year old grandson, loved the Batman caves. Playground at parking lot entrance which was nice.', 'Short, but sweet. Came early and parked in the first lot to the right. Free parking. Ton of people walking/hiking with their dogs. The trail is off to the right, but if you miss it and keep going straight there is a map and it’ll direct you back. There is one entrance into the cave, but three exit points! Pretty cool.', 'We parked outside the gate and walked to the marked trail head. It was just a dirt road up to the caves, but they were fun to loop through for the kids a few times and we also climbed up a small hill to get some good pictures with the Hollywood sign, which also got them excited.', 'Very easy hike. Great to do with kids. The cave at the end is fun for the kids to run around in and explore.', 'Sweet, easy trail. Great for photos and Hollywood sign is visible if you climb a bit.', 'Quick and easy hike. Parking is tight. Very cool cave and view of the Hollywood Sign.', 'Great light hike. Awesome views of the Hollywood sign.', 'awesome low traffic super easy hike to see some cool caves and view the hollywood sign', 'good place for family...', "Very easy hike that takes you to the cave where the 1960s batman cave is located.

PARKING:  it gets really packed and filled quickly.  I arrived around 10am and it was dash to wait on someone leaving.  

TRAIL HEAD:  kinda easy to miss cause there aren't signs or markings unless you have GPS.  but as you continue walking down canyon drive, the first wide path you see to the right will lead you up to the caves.  the hike itself is really short but there are less visible hikes once you've reach the caves - but as the description up there mentions, its really steep with very loose gravel so mind your step and take your time if you're planning to prolong the adventure to a higher elevation.

Has anyone else seen the new Batman Ninja trailer?  THAT WAS AMAZING!", 'Going to this cave is like having sex for the first time there is a lot of build up and then 2 seconds later it’s over. So it’s nice if you are a fan of the 1960s Batman series, but there is not much to this hike.', 'It was quite underwhelming after reading all the hype. if you happen to stumble upon it or want a SUPER easy walk to something a little interesting it is enjoyable.', 'Nice easy trail. Great for kids. The caves are fun to explore.', 'Very easy short hike. Cool cave.', 'Easy trail with cool caves at the loop. Also really nice views of the Hollywood sign.', 'Super fun for kids!', 'Beautiful caves and scenery surrounding, highly recommended!', 'Had an awesome time walking through the caves!', 'Super easy. Used it as a cool down from the treacherous other trail', 'Good hike for kids. Not much of a hike if you really want to get in some mileage. Definitely good for little ones, nice place for them to run around in and explore the caves. You can also get a small view of the Hollywood sign if you hike a bit towards the rocky section.', 'Very short but great for kids', 'A quick and sweet hike', 'Great hike with the kids', 'Super short hike. Not much to see, but a nice easy hike.', "It's fun to see.  Super easy. Not really a hike.  check these out,  then go to the Hollywood sign!", "Although there were a lot of people on this hike and in the caves when I did this, I didn't find it to be particularly impressive.  The tail is really more of dirt road.  The distance to the caves is so short it hardly counts as exercise.  I'd recommend doing this only if you are also going to hike up to the Hollywood sign after making this trip to the caves just a quick side trip.", 'This is a really easy hike that you can enjoy with your children. There is s big parking area also therefore is perfect for couples of hours outdoors.', "It is easy so for me it's only to stars. They really are tunnels but nevertheless fun for the kids and plenty of hills to scramble up-and-down all-around them. Make it a Hollywood day and the Batman Caves fit right in", "Perfect for little ones. This hike is very short, but Caves we're pretty cool to see. You can find other trails that can lead to the Hollywood sign. A bit muddy because we went a day after a rainy day. Parking at 1pm wasn't bad at all. Friendly people on the trails.", 'Quick, easy walk/hike.  Dog friendly! Caves were pretty cool and plenty of little off-main trails to climb to the top of the canyon.', '', 'Very easy hike ! And short', '', 'fun and very easy', 'Easy trail to hike and awesome to see the Bat Caves.  You can climb up a few other sides near there for great views of the Hollywood sign. Go on a weekday as parking can be limited during the week.', 'Simple quick and easy', 'Simple and easy trail, great place to take pictures', 'Very simple and easy. Nice picnic tables before the trail. Great view of the Hollywood sign.', 'Fun and scenic views of the Hollywood sign. Super short but a great little warm up mini hike.', 'The caves are pretty cool. The hike up the mountain is pretty fast. A great view of the Hollywood sign.', 'In and out, nice view of the Hollywood sign, I think they filmed the old batman movies around these caves.', "Amazing hike, and one of the best views of the Hollywood sign! Must go on this hike if you're a true Batman fan, or want an awesome picture of the Hollywood sign.", 'Loved it!!@ChrisWillEmpower Approved', 'Classic walk to get an amazing view of the Hollywood sign. Extra points for being the original Batcave too.', '', 'Great hike. Not as busy as Runyon and lots of shade for dogs to rest. The wishing tree was pretty cool too', 'Super quick Hike. Good for pictures. Go towards the right for Batman Cave. the trail straight through is towards the Hollywood sign. There is also a fruit lady on the streets on the way down. great snack for a day hike afterward', 'Fun hike to add to your hike to or from the hike to the Hollywood sign.', 'Super short and easy hike to get to Bronson Caves. Easy parking. Best view of the Hollywood sign. Great for visitors.', 'Ended up accidentally doing this hike. Pretty cool & super easy. Go for it!', 'My kids loved this hike and even though it was too easy i still give it 5 stars just because my kids had such a great time here.', "For those interested in parking this site offers it. The walk to the caves is short  one. There are 3 caves to walk through. It's kid friendly. I recommend this hiking for those are want to start on short hiking trails.", 'It was too easy but the view deserves 5 stars. ', 'Very very short hike. The caves were pretty cool and dark inside. The caves are iconic as it was the original batman cave.', 'Short hike and very easy!', 'Batcave is cool, the hike after it is a long climb on a hot day.

Park at the 2nd parking lot', 'short hike to the caves. Once there, you can find a few man made trails that go uphill. Very good hike if you take those trails that go uphill, definitely a workout! The man made trails eventually connect to the main trail that can either take you to the observatory or Hollywood sign.', 'Great hike for kids. My toddler loved the wide trail. Pack a snack and blanket and picnic inside the cave, or bring a ball and play in the large open area outside.For more adventuring you can scale surrounding hills, or you can continue on to Hollywood sign. From Camp Hollywood parking lot walk back down road to red painted bridge and trail starts there.', 'Great hike if you park on Bronson or canyon and home all the way up to the Hollywood sign. Stay to the left and you will end up underneath it...not very close but great photo op! To get to the caves you take the first right and you will end up there, not much of a hike but cool to see because a bunch of movies have been filmed there. If you take the second right off the main trail you get to the observatory! A must do...easy but still a great work out!', 'A must do ! For the workout and photo enthusiasts !  the pics you can take behind the Hollywood sign are awesome !', 'Not much of a hike at all more like a light walk....The cave was cool though so not to bad', 'A little disappointed, but still managed to get a few legit pictures. Climbing the mountain directly next to the caves was a lot of fun :) ', 'This was a nice side trip on the way up to the Hollywood sign. Note that many things were filmed here, including some Star Trek.

https://youtu.be/STQbaSjVJ_g', 'The caves is nice but is to small  and short hike  ', "A really short and easy hike. Don't expect too much. Caves are located at the very end. Used to be the set for the movie PLanet of the Apes. You got park at the end of the parking lot and the hike trail is located 300 feet away. ", "Didn't find the caves but a great hike all the same, overcast and a nice breeze made it the perfect day to do this hike, but once to the top the view was covered with haze. Horse land minds all over but over all a great hike!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Coastal Trail, Miwok Trail, and Bonita Lighthouse Loop - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'paddle sports', 'road biking', 'scenic driving', 'trail running', 'walking', 'beach', 'partially paved', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife']
hike_description: Coastal Trail, Miwok Trail, and Bonita Lighthouse Loop is a 7.8 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Sausalito, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.
