user_texts: ['Beautiful hike, highly recommend making the short hike to see the Nike Missile Launch site. It’s the only one in the US still open to the public. Open Saturdays 12-4pm', 'This is by far the best trail I’ve had the opportunity to hike. The views are astonishing. Some parts were steep with lose rocks but overall this hike was easy. Not very crowded and very quiet. Will definitely be back several more times.', 'We are tied to hikes that allow dogs.  We are running out of places but happy to find this trail.  Coming from the East Bay in Walnut Creek it was very pleasant to have a sea breeze and a touch of fog.  Not the typical trail found in the east bay.  We loved it.  Only managed 3 miles but a nice get away from home.\nLots of birds, brown pelicans are abundant here.', 'Really enjoyed the first 2/3 of this trail... the steady ascent up the Miwok worked our lungs but didn’t overwhelm us, and the views as we picked up the Coastal were lovely (we were lucky enough to get a fog-free, sunny day). We were tired and cut over back to the parking spot along the Lagoon trail instead of going down to the point, will have to check that out next time.', 'The bottom part of this “hike” is a confusing mixture of parking lots and unmarked segments of “trail” some of which join up with each other, some of which just wander off and dead end. If you, like me, hike to get out in nature and away from people, don’t bother with the bottom third of the trail. Park near rodeo beach and go from there. If you’re looking for the scenic, tourist spots then that’s ok too and the bottom third of the hike will be perfect for you. Once you get out of the crowds, this trail is stunning, even on foggy days.', 'Just had a little time in the morning so we just did the coastal trail out to the lookout point and then back and up to the batteries. Very pretty, cool history with the batteries. Love the west coast shoreline.', 'Hiked clockwise from the parking lot across from the east side of Rodeo Lagoon.  Hiking time: 2 hr 34 min.', 'Great view of the ocean and great weather for hiking. This is more of a hard hike because of it he distance.', '', 'Beautiful scenery. This hike is relatively easy (some parts uphill), and goes through various landscapes, from coastal views to historical landmarks. Perfect time of the year to catch the blossoming flowers. Make sure to go to the lighthouse. Unfortunately for us, NPS only allows access to it on Sundays from 12:30pm to 3pm this time of the year.', 'One of my favorite hikes', 'Beautiful hike that includes histrionic elements along the Nike missile site and the gun battery.', 'Great trail , beautiful views , other trails you can take for more scenery , love the coast views', 'great bridge views, little crowded, very windy', 'Hiking my in the fog', 'Nice hike.  Early morning fog provides some drama to this hike.', 'This trail map should not include Point Bonita Trail. There\'s not a direct way to get from the Wolf Ridge-Lagoon Loop to Point Bonita without walking on the side of the road and through parking lots. Also, while the Miwok/Coastal/Lagoon trails are all dog-friendly, the Lighthouse Trail is definitely not. Just cut off the Lighthouse trail from this map and you\'ve got a perfect day hike loop. A lot of confused people go into the park looking for the "Marin Headlands Loop trail" but won\'t find that. Just look for the Miwok or Lagoon trails to get started.', 'Outstanding hike and views! Just a great day!', 'Excellent hike with two distinct and very different parts.  Park at visitor center per the trail map guidelines, then hike the loop clockwise.  First part of the hike is out to Pt. Bonita lighthouse and back and is very scenic.  Note that the Pt Bonita lighthouse is only open Sat- Mon starting at 12:30 and only stays open for a few hours.  Second part of the hike is moderately steep going up from Rodeo Beach almost to the top of Hill 88, then loops back down the Miwok Trail and back to the trailhead.  This second part of the hike is more typical of a Marin Headlands hike.  Hiking time: 2.5 hrs.', "Gorgeous trail! I'd recommend going around the big hill counter clockwise first, so that you get to see the full ocean view right after climbing uphill -- a beautiful reward after a hot walk. There's basically no shade so be aware of that. Also, there's a portion of paved, sort of king pathway that you can't really walk around because of the dense shrubbery around it, so beware if you are bringing a dog. But I did see a lot of dogs around and they seemed to be doing ok. Just a thought!", 'Going downhill the hast couple of miles on the miwok trail was great!', "Great first 4 miles- beautiful views. Last 3 mile leg of this route is a little ridiculous. There really isn't a trail all the way through and you will be walking through a lot of parking lots. At one point you are walking through the YMCA property grounds and playgrounds just to stay on track- really bizarre ending to the hike.", 'Great trail with magnificent views. Off leash option was definitely a bonus for Bella', 'Take the long way around up the right hand side if Gerbode. Easier grade', 'One of my favorites ever for a clear day. Not difficult, and views on views!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Wildcat Creek Trail, Havey Creek Trail, San Pablo Ridge Trail, and Belgum Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'muddy']
hike_description: Wildcat Creek Trail, Havey Creek Trail, San Pablo Ridge Trail, and Belgum Trail is a 7.2 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Richmond, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

user_texts: ['The winter rain left some muddy parts to forge; but hey hiking in winter aloft the expanse of the Bay- who cares? A great get out of the hub-bub and hike kinda place. You’ll have cows on the trail to skirt around but they seem oblivious. Saw dogs chasing a Coyote and wondered about the owners, but not too long. Great open hills to climb.', 'This is basically my backyard and I love it.  So much here to explore', "Lovely long walk with varying difficulties, and so close to the city! Traveling clockwise will put the hard hills first. Dogs can be off leash, just beware of roaming cattle. The forest section can get a little muddy and slippery at times, so wear decent footware if it's rains recently.", 'Great place in the middle of city! Lots of cows and people. Some inclines to start and finished through the woods. Great view of the city! There is a portion of pavement which is my least favorite but on this route, it’s minimal.', 'Take the loop clockwise for the best views. Take it counter clockwise for more gradual inclines. Overall this is a nice hike, a scaled down version of some of the more demanding, more beautiful hikes in the Bay Area.', 'Havey Canyon is currently impassible due to a downed tree. Had to turn back.', 'Nice workout!  Good views & dog friendly', 'This is a beautiful hike with thigh burning climbs that bring you to hands-down, the best panoramic views in the Bay Area. Bring water because there is limited shade and layers because the wind can be gusty at the top.', 'Great trail with beautiful views of the cities!', 'It was a great hike! Like the previous comment said- go clockwise so you’ll hit the hardest part first.  The views and breeze were amazing!', 'Quite good!', 'We completed a nearly identical 7 mile loop from the main staging area for this preserve - Alvarado Area in Richmond. The loop comprised of Wildcat Creek Trail -> Havey Canyon Trail -> Nimitz Way -> San Pablo Ridge Trail -> Belgum Trail -> Wildcat Creek Trail. A moderately difficult hike with 1200 feet elev gain.\n\nDetailed Blog: http://shompens.com/canvas/1500412325985', "Bring water, and avoid going on a really hot day! For much of the hike, you're exposed to the sun on top of the hills with no shade. If you pick the right day - it's perfect. Go clockwise and start with the difficult part, leaving the mostly flat and shady area for last!", 'A nice trail that I did with 4 friends.  It goes in and out of trees and mostly wide open spaces with some pretty good views.  Most of the trail is old roads with a small mix of single track connectors.  We were there at the wrong time watching a couple of bulls going at each other until one decided to chase us.....  Fortunately there are some huge power lines there and we were close and jumped up on the cement supports and got out of harms way.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Old Zoo Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'kid friendly', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'trail running', 'walking', 'cave', 'partially paved', 'wildlife']
hike_description: Old Zoo Trail is a 7 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Los Angeles, California that offers the chance to see wildlife and is rated as moderate. The trail is primarily used for hiking, walking, trail running, and horses and is best used from August until October. Dogs and horses are also able to use this trail.

user_texts: ['Trail was very confusing at points and covered with horse poop for the first 2.5 miles. Most of this hike is directly next to roads, but the zoo part is cool and the trails are pretty', 'Nice view and wild flowers. There s a part where there lots of trees. Beautiful.', 'Very cool trail that leads you through the old LA Zoo', 'Took our kids yesterday and it was a great hike! There’s some type of bridge at the very top of the mountain. We didn’t hike that far but looks cool!', 'Straightforward loop, with the Old Zoo as an interesting note about halfway through. Difficulty comes in length and long ups and long descents.Go early and bring a hat because there are some unshaded parts.Also do the part up the hills to the Old Zoo first, because the half near the highway is long and flat, and the hike up is both more tiring and more fun.Great long hike though, I recommend it!', 'I wouldnt say this hike is 7 miles long. we parked in the parking lot right in front of the old park. it takes under 5 minutes to get too and 20 minutes to look through. there is a look out point up on the hill,which is a lot of fun to get too.', '', 'This an 8.26 mike hike, not a 7 mike hike.  It also gets confusing when you get to the zoo area because you have to cross the parking lot and the grassy lawn to get the the crosswalk in order to get to the other part of the hike, which is where most of the horses go.  We loved the first part but once you follow the side of the road then behind the Autry, it get boring.', "First off, the address on this app is wrong and took you to a train stop 8 min away. Just type in “old zoo” info your phone.This place is lowkey ratchet. I walked past it and didn't even realize, got lost trying to go up the upper zoo trail and found my way back. Even regulars say that they still get messed up trying to remember where it is, even though it's literally right next to the parking lot. I thought it would have super cool graffiti, as I am a big fan of street art, but this was just poor quality vandalism. I thought it was a slap in the face to see that people had tagged the trees, rocks, and the signs that could point you in the right direction/tell you about the history of the zoo.The old zoo itself was super dilapidated in a not cool way (can you say old ANIMAL PRISON). It also smelled terrible and I even saw a bottle of piss. Then there were these hoodlums blasting metal in the picnic area and hidden in pockets on the hills smoking weed and drinking beers, which they probably littered. I would probably come here if I was a goth kid in middle school trying to find a place outside my parents house to drink keystone ice and smoke cigs. Also, there's coyotes roaming around so that was also sketch.TLDR: you will leave this place wanting to make sure you put on hand sanitizer and wanting to dart out promptly before dusk. And the hike itself was underwhelming.", 'Way too many horses and the trail is covered in horse $hit.', 'This was good. Started at train town walked towards highway. The back half after the old zoo is not flat. It gets hilly!', 'Long one but a good one. Old zoo ruins everywhere. Many movies have been filmed here. Free parking. The benches at the park are a plus.', 'No incline, dont see how this is moderate.', 'Fun and creepy! Great for kids!', "I posted 3 pics of a mountain. It has caves. I've found several secret trail to get up there but idk if there's mountain lions or coyotes.  Has anyone been up there ? Does anyone know the name? Please send feedback thanks", "Lots of creepy old abandoned cages and confines to see. The stairs leading up to Amir's Garden is a great way to get in a quick cardio workout.", "Ugh. Started from travel town and hiked along the trail next to the road through Griffith. Was fine for a while. Then you are dumped out in parking lot mess and tons of people. The last half of the hike you are hiking down the stupid horse trail not 5 feet away from the roaring freeway.  Don't do the loop. Go back through the park and stay away from the freeway, unless you like breathing gas fumes. The zoo is cool is a depressing graffiti way. Why do I still live in this city?", "It's ok.. old zoo cages.. kind of depressing.", '', 'Very interesting hike! Good workout!', "Got pretty lost. But that's because I suck at directions! Pretty Erie but dope", 'Very easy and fun for kids to walk. We only walked one side, which was about 1 mile and 1/2. And we bumped into many friendly people, which was a plus.', 'Perfect Hike for Newbies', 'Fantastic', "The old zoo was fantastic ! We had a surprise in one of our pictures around 9 pm.... A face appeared in a picture that we took!! Also up above the enclosures there is a lone cage... Something bad must have happened there because just in that area... The temperature dropped and the hairs on my neck and arms were on edge... I also had the sensation of spider webs brushing across my face... There was no trees in that area for spider webs... I've often heard that spider web sensation with out actual spider webs are usually an indication that there is a spirit around you or touching you.... That was the grand finally after being stalked in the mountains buy what sounded to me Like a big cat... The growls were very prominent.", "The trail can be as long or as short as you want it to be, as easy or strenuous as you want it to be. However, the pay off is high. I have been on so many trails, and this one is definitely in the top three. The animal cages would not be the same, or near is neat, if it didn't have all of the graffiti. Great place to take pictures;  minus the smell.", 'This is a fairly easy hike. It does not have much of an incline and what incline there is, is quite gradual. We parked over in the parking lot by the carousel and the golf clubhouse. There is a trailhead that starts there and takes you to the park where the old zoo is located. From there you can continue on the trail. We stopped taking this trail and head up to bee point. It looked more interesting then the rest of the old zoo trail. The old zoo itself is quite small and has been turned into a park. This hike would be a good hike for children. There is an actual park with grass for them to run around on. Also, they can explore some of the old exhibits. Bee point was pretty cool. Worth the trek up. The trail was a bit steep at points. Heading up to bee point, I would say is a moderate level hike for most casual hikers. It was overcast so the views were so so. But on a clear day, it would offer some excellent views of the valley. Happy trekking!', "This is a nice leisure hike for beginners. It's about 2.5 miles with very little incline. It's a paved road. Good places to take pics and even pack a lunch.Go to Griffith Park via Crystal Springs Drive. Look for the signs where it says Carousel parking. Right above the parking lot you see the the trail. To get to the Zoo, take the trail on the right or that looks straight. And stay towards the right. When you walk around the top of the trail he will start to see the cages and enclosements. Some of the structures have cool graffiti, so don't be afraid to climb, walk, or go inside them.The end of the trail leaves you at the Bear enclosures, which is on the way toward the left of the parking. So you can decide to park closer to the end of the trail. and be closer to your car when your done. Or just walk back to your car across the parking lot.", 'nice trail. enjoyed the hill sections and the old LA Zoo area.', "It was a great mountain trail, great views all through out the trail, very good for running except this app doesn't put you exactly where you have to start, you'll need to find it on your own with a little exploration skills.", "It's wide and easy hike up and down.", 'Have gone on this hike several times. Very sad what the animals went through, but an awesome place now to explore. Always enjoy this hike.', "This app didn't take us right to were we needed to be. We asked a few people on exactly where to go because we up to see the old zoo. Once we started it was great! My friend and I went and we brought our boys who are 11. They had fun and you could spend hours here going on all different trails. Next time I'll do a little more research on exactly where to go for the trails. This was my first time using the app to get my to a trail. We'll be back to explore some more.", 'it was a bit difficult but it was a good experience and draining.', "loved the hike from town travel to the zoo! zoo itself was little disappointing but it's definitely worth coming at least  once :)", "We ended up walking through a lot of horse droppings so that wasn't pleasant. But walking through the zoo was fun. Not sure I would hike it again, though.", 'It was beautiful and so many hike trails you can take parking was not difficult to find .', 'Was great beautiful ❤️', "love the scenery, first time here yesterday, we got lost trying to find the trail its self, to be exact is near the mary go round, we had to stop and ask some rangers for directions because there are many different trails in this park, people are nice, the trial its self is a little challenging if you are new to hiking I wouldn't recommend to begin with this trail, but its a must to complete.", 'Holy crap! The old Zoo was so crowded  on Saturday... We ended up retreating up into the hills and hiked to the Griffith observatory instead.', 'Awesome!! Really spooky', '', 'Really cool treat to see the zoo enclosures and to be able to actually walk and play in them. Went with my girlfriend and had a blast taking pictures. Just to let you know in advance, the soulless has left many graffiti all over the place. Such a shame cause these idiots give the graffiti art a bad name.', 'The most fun part of this park is wandering through these animal enclosures. The trails along the park are very walkable and peaceful, the coyotes and bunnies enjoy walking here too.', 'It was good but longer than 6.7 miles', "It was ok except for the trash all over the place and people who don't pick up after their dogs ", 'Fun!  Taking pics in and around the enclosures make it unique.', 'Good hike but not clearly marked. We were required to go thru parking lots, along the road and trail.', 'The trail is not marked, so plan to backtrack while you follow the red line. We did 11.5 mi total.', 'Very interesting also included Bee Rock. 5.85', "This is a great hike in LA and a nice break from the regular Griffith trails near the observatory! Park at the Merry-Go-Round and check out the old animal cages. They're empty and graffitied - pretty cool, slightly creepy. Then take a dirt path up. It's pretty steep, and you'll get a nice leg burn. Great trail for dogs—my husky loved it! So much to smell, see, and lots of trails for people to explore. The only downside is the way down is walking on a wide road with a gradual decline. I ran most of it with my dog, but was hoping for a more rugged terrain on the way down. Great views of the city though!", "My favorite place to relax when there isn't so many people around. It's a blast from the past. A must see if your a local or just into enjoying Griffith Park. Park in Merry-go-round lot and hike up from there.", "More of a sightseeing walk than a hike, but the Old LA Zoo is worth visiting nonetheless! Go inside the cages to see the graffiti - it's a fun experience.Also, during October they go ALL OUT with decor for Halloween Hay Rides. I highly recommend visiting around that time of year :)", 'the address on here is completely wrong. go to the Merry-go-round parking. it was a good hike. got lost cause I tries to make my own trail. all in all good semi easy if you follow the trail.', 'Good hike', "Had to look it up online! It's no where near the directions on here. Regardless, good trail. ", 'I absolutely love this trail. I stumbled upon it by accident looking for another trail and was amazed. It was the old abandoned LA Zoo! Complete with cages or all kinds for birds, lions, ect that had signs with a bit of history. Very fun to explore and let your imagination run wild with you! Its not to strenuous either.', 'Start the trail through the old L.A. Zoo and discover a hidden world.  Notice the man made rock formations that will remind you of The Lion King. Explore the old zoo before your hike. Have fun', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Burney Falls Loop Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['kid friendly', 'birding', 'camping', 'fishing', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'nature trips', 'walking', 'forest', 'partially paved', 'river', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'washed out', 'no dogs']
hike_description: Burney Falls Loop Trail is a 1 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Burney, California that features a waterfall and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from April until October. Horses are also able to use this trail.

user_texts: ['easy trails beautiful fall', 'Burney Falls is amazing, the trails around it decent. There is a parking lot on Lake Road which is a five minute walk up a paved slope, so the falls are easily accessible, though there are a few stairs. We parked at the parking lot off of Clark Creek Road which gave us a ten minute hike through some of the surrounding forest before reaching the lake road parking lot and down to the base of the falls. The hiking around the surrounding area is decent- but you’re really here for the falls. Since it is on the more accessible end of Oregon waterfalls, expect to see a lot of people.', 'Must see trail for NorCal.', 'Great trail!', 'Excellent hike easy some of the path is paved. The park was beyond very busy and they had a line of cars out on 89 just to get in. We took Clark Creek road from 89 and found a dirt  parking lot that was less than full and provided easy access to the trail. You can walk in about 1000 feet and the trail splits go either direction to access the park.', 'Easy hike, pretty falls', 'Very nice scenery one of the best Falls in California.', 'was BEAUTIFUL hiking', 'Amazing waterfall.', 'We enjoyed this short hike and it is an easy loop for those looking for an outing and a bit of exercise.  Beautiful falls to enjoy close to the parking lot.', 'great short and easy hike with amazing views', 'Easy hike even with kids. Don’t let the steep downhill walk discourage you from going to the bottom of the Falls. Beautiful views and breathtaking photo opportunities. The Falls loop is easy enough for small children but keel them close as you climb the steep hill on the other side of the Falls. Several spots are straight down. Several resting spots along the way for those who wish to rest. Great hike for the experience hiker or just someone wishing to view nature.', 'Gorgeous waterfall and an easy hike around the loop. Walk the creek and look for trout, watch people fishing at the falls, see the falls from below and above. Pay $8 entrance fee/car. Worth it to see the falls. We went early in morning (10a) before parking lot filled up. By the time we left (11a) lots of people were just showing up.', 'Nice hike', '2018/05/26 - just hiked to the bottom and back', 'One of the most beautiful waterfalls I have ever seen! Short hike down to the base, but still fun. You are so close to the falls the spray from them leaves you a bit damp. Feels great on a hot day!', 'beautiful hike the falls are awesome', 'Easy hike to a beautiful waterfall. The loop trail let’s you see the waterfall from all sides!', 'Super easy and well maintained, great for families. The loop is a nice walk and the grounds are beautiful !', 'Awesome waterfall!', 'easy short hike not the most diverse', 'Easy hikeGood views', 'Great hike', 'It was a great waterfall and view hiked the whole loop, very easy', 'Great hike! The falls are stellar. I went in late September but hope to return another time in the fall when the leaves have changed!', 'It wasn’t too cold until we got close to the falls because of the mist. Definitely can’t wait to go again in the summer!', 'Lovely loop around the falls. Went in mid October. Cold and sunny. Perfect walking weather.', 'This is one of the hikes, you would be wanting to do time and again. This hike caters more to the falls than the hike. Some where I wonder that the mention of this falls as the 8th wonder is appropriate. The flow of water in the falls is captivating.', 'absolutely beautiful', 'great views!', '', 'Best waterfall I have ever seen in person!', 'One of the most beautiful falls I have seen. The loop trail is short.  It is possible to hike through  to lake Britton,  keeping in mind that parts of the trail may be closed due to erosion.  Swimming is not possible in sapphire pond; it is possible at the lake.', 'the waterfall speaks for itself', 'Yes #1 Falls Hike however not much of an actual hike - more of a destination. Easy to find but parking was a mess because it was really busy.  Did the short loop.', "Easy with the kiddos (we had 8 kids with us from ages 2 up to 18) they all loved the loop! There's just a couple places we needed to hold hands since the trail narrows along some of the steeper climbs.", "Easy trail.  Paved most of the time.  Beautiful waterfall with easy access.  Crossing the creek on the two foot bridges makes it easy and fun for small kids.  Worth the short hike, don't pass up this one.", 'A great place to spend the day.', 'A bit overcrowded but impressive. Bring your fishing pole and make sure to grab an ice cream cone. They are delicious and not ridiculously over priced.', "This was by far one of the best places I have ever visited. The waterfall is so amazing. It only cost $8.00 to enter the camp site, after that it is so beautiful. It's not a hike at all, just a walk down and walk back up. A must see place. Two thumbs up!", 'This trail is in a state park. You have to pay an entrance fee and then deal with swarms of people.  The trail is heavily used and goes around the waterfall.  The waterfall is beautiful.  Just know that it is very busy.', 'Great hike with the kids!', "Amazing waterfall, you don't even really have to hike to see the waterfall as it's right out of the parking lot. However, the trail afterwards is very nice and mostly level walking that handrails a beautiful lake.", "Very easy hike to the waterfall. We parked on the side of the road that didn't require entrance fee. Waterfall itself was just breathtaking. Very rare to have waterfalls that look like Burney Falls in California.", 'Amazing view of the falls! My friend and I were able to get close enough to be attacked by the mist coming from the falls. Very easy hike and would definitely recommend checking out the trail, which consisted of two bridges as well.', "The falls themselves are impressive, but you don't have to do the trail to get to them. It's a short trail, but if you're going to have a look at the falls from the base, might as well do the trail too.", 'Drove up from Marysville today. Great little hike and so gorgeous!  Tried to go to Lake Britton, but that part of the trail was blocked due to erosion from the storms this winter.', 'Beautiful especially when it is completely empty.', 'Beautiful waterfall❤', 'I love going here. They have many activities during the summer. Be sure to check out pioneer days. My family and I visit multiple times a year.', "went down to the base of the falls on mine and my dad's trip to the re Reno Air Races.  it's a nice cool place to relax and see the sites and creek leading to the base of the falls.", 'Easy peazy hike-ish trail around a natural wonder', 'The Burney Falls are STUNNING!  Plenty to see, the falls, various species of trees, plants and foliage. The Rainbow bridge is a great stop to enjoy the sights and sounds of the creek and trail. Worth the hike.', 'Beautiful falls. Beautiful trail. Very well maintained. Easy hike. I recommend taking the scenic hike to Lake Britton, too.', 'Beautiful but can get crowded.', 'My husband proposed to me here! My most favorite trail ever!!!!!', 'The front side of the loop trail is very crowded with people going both directions. once you get down to the base of the falls and down stream a bit, the scenery is amazing and much quieter.  It was a great little trail.', 'More of a walk than a hike but still very nice. A most stop if you are in the area.', 'Breathtaking, and a little chilly.  Great way to start a day!', 'This was a short and very easy hike, which I was thankful for after hiking in Castle Crags the previous day. Lots of great views of Burney Creek and the falls themselves. We waded out into the waterfall pool to get some better pictures. The super cold water felt great on a hot August day. I would recommend this to anyone. The falls are stunning!', "Dogs aren't allowed on trails... Smh", "Majestic! these are the most beautiful waterfalls I have ever seen. we drove 2 1/2 hours and it was well worth it. we arrived at 11:30 and there were not many people there, however, when we left at 3:30 it was very full. we also did the extra 1.5 miles to the lake but we're very disappointed as it was very nasty looking. we walked back to the falls to cool down and then headed home. next time we will take the falls trail loop and see what it has to offer.", 'Absolutely stunning!! The mist that comes off the falls is sooooo refreshing!!', 'Beautiful and well worth the drive, 4 stars for hardly being dog friendly.', "The walk down n to the Falls is steap, but short and easy. On your way down you will have several vantage points. If you want to get crazy with it, scaling the steap trails to get the the base of the water is common. A few people were seen doing so. Otherwise the trail gives you at least 4 good vantage points, to see the waterfalls from. I've never seen anything quite like it. It's majestic.", 'Awesome view!', 'Views for days and easy terrain!', 'It was nice but it was snow in may', 'Fun hike for all!', 'BEAUTIFUL!!!', 'The waterfalls were so BEAUTIFUL... the hike was easy ...my mother and kids loved it....WORTH the drive from Wadsworth, Nevada', 'Beautiful views, great trail and my group decided to trek over to Lake Britton. Plenty of photo opps and nice temperature for an August hike but the water is sooooo cold!', 'best!', 'With all the rain this year, the falls are Roaring !!  Very pleasant loop hike, lots of photo opps ! You can hike a little farther down the trail to visit Lake Britton . Worth the drive ~', 'Great hike with little kids and very pretty.', 'Breathtaking Waterfalls! Easy hike! Lived It!', 'Nice easy trail into Lake Britton with several fishing spots along the creek (two trout limit with required barbless hooks). The trail loops back into Burney Falls SP along the Rim Trail.', 'Beautiful trail with terrific view of the falls! Also links up with the PCT.', 'Simple walk down to falls which are spectacular.  129 foot waterfall.', 'Waterfall is amazing ! Can have a picnic and admire the view.', 'Favorite waterfall in California!', 'Nice and easy hike around the falls.  If you follow the creek upstream you can see where the water is coming out of the ground as well since part of the creek was dried up.  Beautiful waterfall.', 'Nice and easy hike around the falls. If you follow the creek upstream you can see where the water is coming out of the ground as well since part of the creek was dried up. Beautiful waterfall.', 'Easy and beautiful!!  Well-maintained trail and was not busy the day I was there.', 'breathtaking falls and such a short hike so worth taking the time to see if you get the chance. 8$ fee and no dogs are aloud on the trail.', 'Beautiful Falls. Trail was easy. Falls Loop about one mile very easy hike. 8$ fee to enter.', "This trail was a pleasant and unexpected surprise. We were just driving through the area and, being a fanatic of waterfalls, I happened to notice a sign off the side of the road for it. I quickly made the turn and found myself in this amazing oasis that is the McArthur-Burney Falls Memorial SP. Wow! I have seen a lot of waterfalls in my days and this one is now in my top 5. Do NOT let this hidden beauty pass you by. It's breathtaking, beautiful in every sense of the word. The small lake of water at the bottom is as serene as it is refreshing, being fed by a series of falls that together make up the wonderment that is Burney Falls.", 'I was speechless when I saw thi, very easy hike and yes fun for a family with little ones. Amazing one of my favorite small hike that I love. Worth the trip up North', "Ben hiking thru Burney falls all my life. what a wonderful hike, very light hike if you wanna just get out and have a chill day with your friends or family. It has a very fresh clean vibe aswell as an ancient one too. this is home to a very widespride area of local native Americans, so you'll feel a strong spiritual presence the whole time. there's a very big hole at the bottom of the falls super cold water, get in If you feel like cooling off after your strenuess hike. lol", 'Beautiful!!!! not difficult, can do with kids, consider taking a picnic in back pack, once your down by the falls the air is cool.  In my opinion much more awe inspiring and enjoyable then falls I had hiked farther to see in Hawaii!!!', "Very easy trail, great for a day out with the family.  The trail's a little steep on the back side which means you'll probably be carrying the young 'uns for maybe 1/4 - 1/2 a mile, but still not bad at all.  Of course, the main attraction is Burney Falls itself... which always amazes me every time I go up there.  Beautiful scenery for pictures, and if you're going up through Burney, it's well worth the stop!", 'I was born and raised in Redding which is not to far from Burney Falls, This place is great for the family or just to get aways and relax.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Grays Peak Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'birding', 'camping', 'hiking', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'lake', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'bugs', 'rocky', 'scramble']
hike_description: Grays Peak Trail is a 6.4 mile lightly trafficked out and back trail located near Fawnskin, California that features a lake and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is best used from April until October. Dogs are also able to use this trail.

user_texts: ['Did this hike with my son (11) and two dogs.  I thought the phrase "Are we there yet?\' was limited to road trip, guess not. This trail is on the easy side of moderate.  Nice clearly marked trail with steady inclines.  The trail is also a favorite with trail runners.', "we did the hike in 3 hours 15 minutes round trip ages 8 to 56, 11 people was a great day a coulpe Marines an Army RANGER  and Family's all in all good day RLTW", 'What a nice hike. Beautiful view and autumn all over. Trail is well maintained and easy going out and back.', "We did this hike today! Perfect weather since there isn't much shade. Our Runtastic  app did say that it was about 8.1 miles total though...not 6.4. Not sure where the discrepancy lies but it was excellent!", 'We did several trails this weekend. This and Bertha peak are pretty close to each other. I think this is harder than Bertha. It’s a pretty lengthy steep climb for about the second half going up. I got pretty winded. Still a great hike. I had done it once before and will do it again. Great view from the top.', 'Great trail, gorgeous views. Can be a bit difficult if you’re not used to the altitude, or a bit out of shape.', 'Great hike. Not too difficult. Perfect day and great trail.', 'Great hike - well maintained and generally well marked trail (tho the All Trails app was definitively helpful);  gorgeous views along the way, nice diversity of plants trees rocks and bushes.  We had a bald eagle soaring above us for a while which was awesome.  Took us 2 hrs to the top and maybe 1:40 back.  Nice mix of sun and shade for us.  You need an Adventure Pass to park which costs $5 and is available just a mile up the road at the Fawnskin Market.  Highly recommended hike.', 'A mostly mellow hike to one of the smaller peaks near Big Bear. Lots of trees. Trail is well maintained. The best panoramic views are actually to the west / north on the final mile or so to the peak. An Adventure Pass is required to park at the trail-head.', 'Beautiful hike. Not very shady. Can be quite hot during midday. We went in the late afternoon. A good option to consider.', "Beautiful trail but don't go mid day. Hanna Flats all the way up to Gray's Peak is not worth the view at the top.", "Hiked this trail today with our 8 and 5 year old kids.  We made it about 1.5 miles up (elevation change of about 250 feet).  We stopped at the turnoff for the Gray's Peak trail.  Kids complained, but that's what kids do.  I'd say it was a moderate hike.  Nice way to spend an afternoon.  Lots of views of the lake along the hike.", 'Loved this trail.  Hiked with my 16-year old daughter and my black lab. Fun and great views!!!!', 'My first 14er, the challenging hike was worth the views !', 'Great hike. Wasn’t able to make it the whole way because of a large thunderstorm.', 'Easy gradual incline. Great views through different types of terrain. Tracked my hike at 7.0 miles', 'Great hike that is 7 miles with a gradual uphill climb. Great for a morning or late afternoon. Also kid friendly if your kids have been out hiking a few times.', "The views and scenery on this trail are top notch; you won't be disappointed. We started it in the late afternoon and came down at sunset; the conditions were perfect. It ended up being around 7.2 miles for us, not 6.4 as this listing shows.", "Moderate to Difficult. Took me an hour and 45 minutes, but we'll worth the views at the end.", "it's everything you'd expect from Big Bear fresh air pines swaying clear skies and Epic views of BB lake... they say thiers 300 days a year of Sunshine Up here its true, love this part of my World", "Did Gray's Peak this morning. it's currently open for the season, it opened during the memorial day weekend. it's a great 7.5 mile round trip hike and I definitely recommend. It's a moderate to difficult hike with a lot of shade. located in Fawnskin (north of big bear lake)", 'this trail is currently CLOSED as of December 1st until june or july next year. it is a breeding ground for bald eagles and the forest service has banned people from entering that part of the mountain. they will fine the people who ignore the notices and still hike the trail. Butler Peak trail is open and only about a mile further into Fawnskin.', 'Good distance, incline, nice view!', 'great mellow hike, beautiful views, good elevation gain. trail is super easy to follow.', 'beautiful, mellow, and spectacular views', 'Really Nice Trail.  Well maintained. Perfect for jogging or walking your dog. Open views, everything is nicely spaced and it has great views of the lake and surrounding areas.', 'This hike was well rounded! Scenery is beautiful.  It is moderate in difficulty. Great distance.  Wanted something different than Couger Crest so this was perfect! Will definitely do again.', 'Great trail, beautiful view..', "Great mountain and lake views from the north side of Big Bear lake. It's a long hike but worth the views at the end. Parking pass is required.", 'cool trail .', 'My girlfriend and I and our dogs did this hike again yesterday. We got a late start and it was a bit windy up at the top but what a fantastic view and scenery all the way up. It rained on us on the way down but only lightly and the weather was still very nice. Great elevation gain and nice marked trail.', "I did not find it scenic. trail is pleasantly strenuous due to the elevation gain. So return trip was quick. at the top it was windy. views from the top are interrupted by the trees etc. imo, it's not worth climbing up expecting views in the end. trail looked good for the mountain biking. also dog friendly. I encountered no mosquitoes. was wearing vibrams and tank top to beat the September Sun. we were busy having conversation and lost our way going up, only to realize after a km that we were on the wrong path. markings are pretty distinct though. parking could be limited. 15 or so spots. parking pass for $5 can be picked up from the convenience store half a mile or so towards the north shore. don't park off the markings. we saw 3 vehicles getting ticketed for parking in front of the restrooms.", "Although it's long, it's a fairly moderate hike. It is a steady climb with amazing views and ever-changing scenery. The top is a great place to capture some views and stop for lunch. Would highly recommend!", 'My favorite hike in Big Bear so far!', "Such a great hike!! Beautiful views the entire way up with the grand finale being incredible! Trekking up 1300ft then down again isn't easy on your body so wear good shoes, comfortable clothes and bring plenty of water! The summit (unlike most others) had plenty of sitting area! Happy Hiking!", 'Had a great running hike, with beautiful views... and friendly people along the way! Will definitely be back again!', 'great hike, best view of big bear lake you can get, well worth the hike to the top.', "Beautiful scenery especially in the Fall. Watch the mountain bikes some of those riders go fast and before you know it  they're on top of you.", 'Super nice trail. Started early in AM on a Wed. and did not see a soul until the peak. Would do this again. My Aussie was off leash the entire trip. Came across a high school x-country track team. Very nice kids.', 'Nice hike to the peak with lovely vistas! Sitting atop of the boulders at the peak was so peaceful and inspiring!', 'Beautiful hike, well marked and maintained. Scenic with varying climates.', 'Awesome!', 'This leg is a great addition to Hanna Flats trail out and back.', 'Good hike with some good views at the top.', 'I enjoyed this hike because of the scenery. It was relaxing and a great workout at the same time.', "One of the best trails I have done in California.The trail around and at the top isn't very great for a view and is blocked by many trees.  If you venture of the trail slightly when your around the top you will have breathtaking views all around you.", 'Amazing views! And they kept getting better towards the end of the trail. Took me bout 2 hours round trip, but mostly because I stopped often to take photos. Great experience!', 'Great hike! Beautiful view from the top!', "Well marked trail. Pretty much a moderate climb on the way up. It's about 7 miles round trip. Felt long on the way back! Beautiful view at the peak. Travels through an old burn area. I only saw a couple people on the way up, but several groups on the way back. Several well-behaved dogs. Everyone was very nice. I was hoping to see some eagles but no luck. Lots of little animals and birds. A coyote actually crossed the road on my way there. Parking area is a little small and requires adventure pass. Nice restroom in the lot. Overall a great hike! I believe it closes for the eagle nesting in Oct. so go now.", 'Low traffic on a Wednesday morning in mid September. Moderate rating due to elevation gain only. Footing mainly good, with a few rocky patches and minimal rock scrambling at the peak. Nice lake and forest views. Took 1 hr 45 mins up, 1 hr 35 mins down. Would do this again.', 'I enjoyed the various views from the trail.', 'Moderate climb all the way to the top, great trail!', "My husband and I went today with our 4 yr old daughter, 8 year old son, and 6 month old dog. We went out 2 miles and back 2 miles. Trail is narrow and rocky at the beginning. Tons of traffic on a Sunday afternoon. Trail gets wider and smoother after about 3/4 of a mile. Can't wait to leave the kids and dog at home and go the distance.", 'L', "semi LOTR scenery! well cared for trail that's dog friendly and great for kids seven and up.", 'We really enjoyed this trail. It was a Saturday and there was a good bit of traffic. The trail was very easy to follow and seemed well maintained. The views are amazing and you can even witness some of the burned area from the 2007 fires. The weather happened to be amazing for it being the middle of August... Definitely an enjoyable hike!', 'Good trail to get away from the summer heat. Started at 6:30am was 54* ended at 9:30 it was 78*. Easy to Moderate trail.Would recommend this trail. Great view of Big Bear Lake at the top. Had a couple groups of trail runners, other hikers and a mountain biker pass by but not too crowded for a Saturday morning. Flush toilets at the parking lot. There was a drinking fountain at there also but it was not working. No water along they way', 'Was a nice afternoon hike!', 'Trail was great, left at 11am which made for a rather hot hike but not strenuous. Definitely recommend this hike. You will also need a 5$ adventure pass that we picked up at the beer/wine store in Fawnskin about a half mile up the road. Only saw about 8 hikers on the entire trail but it was a Tuesday.', "July 2016 Went today, excellent hike. Parking lot was full at 9:30am, we made do with a 1/2 spot behind another parked car. We had a few groups of mt bikers coming down at the beginning of the trail, but everyone was polite, used good trail etiquette.  After about half way up, we only saw a few more hikers & bikers. Very serene. Warm day (80's) but intermittent sun/shade made it  comfortable enough.  Would definitely do this hike again.   P-lot was half empty when we returned. Also, remember to get the $5 Adventure Pass for your car (bought ours at Fawnskin Market).", "This was an enduring hike but we didn't give up and we made it all the way up!", 'Great hike! Steep at the beginning but levels out after that. Beautiful, mostly shaded hike through a really pretty area. Very nice views at the top. Best to start early, gets hot in the afternoon. About 7 miles RT. Take your time, enjoy the experience. Great little day hike.', 'great little single track', 'great view', "Took this trail to Gray's Peak with my 10 year old daughter.  Well marked trail - shady peak with some nice views.  All in all great day.   Good hike for my younger one who is starting to take longer hiking trips.  7-8 miles round trip - depending on which map/guide you read.", "This was a fun hike and I was able to bring my pup with me. The first portion is intimidating because it is a steep switchback but once you get past that the trail isn't too bad of an incline. The views all around are great. I went in November so the weather was perfect and all the trees were just turning orange, red and all other shades. It was a great hike and eating lunch at the end was a great choice on the large boulders.", "I did this 2 weeks ago when it was a heat wave in so Cal but it was very nice (75) on the trail with a slight breeze. This trail is the best. A great workout but can be difficult for dogs and kids. My phone battery ran out before I did so couldn't take a pic of a deer I saw. Lots of shade and great views. Take plenty of water and protein. There is a section that uses the forest road but the trail will pick up a little ways on the left.", 'This trail is very long. Started at 8am and it was already getting warm. We had a 7 year old Chocolate  and an 11 year old Black Lab with us and they got sunburned even with sunscreen on. They also got dehydrated, exhausted from the sun and length. We had to keep stopping to cool the off in the shadey areas (thank goodness they were there.) They are good hikers and it was tough for them. And me. I only brought two waters and had no food. Bring lots of water, wear sunscreen, and start very early. The views are nice as would be expected, but the terrain is varied and great! Saw some lizards, blue jays, cotton tails. The hike is not hard but it is very long.', 'I did this hike yesterday. This was a great hike...I would definitely do it again. Great weather, and beautiful scenery!', 'This is a great hike. Took my experienced 7 year old son who is an avid backpacker and camper. And he did great. And said he really hiked it. Funny though I tracked this hike with Strava and it came out 7.9 miles. Granted we started at Grout Bay Picnic Area.', 'Great hike. Just long enough for the family to have a 3 hour adventure. Had lunch at the top with a great view of the lake.', 'Great views throughout the trail, not a lot of people, with a brisk hike up the trail. A little confusing when the trail met the road, but easily figured out.', "my 5 year old daughter being the beast she is did this one with her mom and I.It was so amazing at the top and throughout the entire trail ,I'm so proud of her conquering her first mountain with her own 2 feet. gorgeous just gorgeous", 'Great!', "It's a great place to spend time with the family and get away from it all!", "This hike has a consistent climb in elevation and offers amazing views throughout. I thought it was great. I took my dog and we saw a man riding his horse and a couple guys biking with their dog. We went at 4pm and arrived back at the parking area at 6:45pm we didn't spend more than 5 mins at the peak but this hike is definitely recommended!!", "Great trail.  Didn't take too long and had a great view from the top.  I wish I read these reviews earlier because someone mentioned a canister at the top that has a notebook in it.  We sat and ate lunch on the very top starring at that canister and assumed it was trash the whole time.  Wish I could go back in time and look at it.", "Really well maintained trail, dog friendly, with plenty of great views of the lake and diverse scenery. It's a little under four miles to the peak, with a steady incline, not overly challenging but still a good workout. Once at the peak there are plenty of flat rocks to take a seat and enjoy the surroundings. At the very peak keep an eye out for the Easter egg(a protein powder canister) with a little notebook in it so you can leave a note that you were there!", 'Let me tell you. this is NOT 7 miles. Its 8.7 miles from the parking lot to Grays Peak and back. Beautiful trail. Lots of fun.', "Grays Peak Trail is open as of 5/11/2014. It was a pretty good hike with a steady incline. I didn't see too many people on this hike, granted I went around 3 in the afternoon. Still, it was a quick 3 hours. Easy trail to follow, there was even a couple cleaning up the trail while I was going up.", 'Grays peak trail is closed until May 23rd due to eagle nesting. In addition the parking is closed at the base .', 'Great views at the top, however they are a little obstructed by some very tall trees. There is a large area that burned some years ago about mid hike. The burned area looks desolate which goes to show the power of forest fires... Still a good hike because i think it has some of the most diverse views.', "Good hike for views of Big Bear Lake.  I didn't think it was a beautiful hike for various areas burned some time ago.  The peak area is beautiful and we saw some great hawks and other smaller wildlife.  Take lots of water.        Dog friendly trail.", 'Absolutely a fun, easy, and beautiful trail. The view is worth it when you get to the top. We had 3 dogs that we were able to let off leash and they had a blast also.  ', 'This is one of my favourite trails to do when I am up in Big Bear. This trail winds past wonderful Jeffrey Pines and the views of the Lake are awesome. It seems there are a lot of variations of terrain on this trail....forest, rocky views (see photo), some burnt area, some cactus desert areas. It is a good workout and there isalways the hope of seeing an eagle!!! Just be sure that the trail is open before you head out. I tried to go this year in June and the trail was stillclosed.', 'Pretty easy trail, very easy to follow. ', 'Pleasant short hike with rewarding views along the way.    More heavily used than what I prefer but it was mid summer.', 'Went before the trail closes for the season to see if there were any eagles to view. No such luck. There was still quite a bit of color but very little wildlife to see. Only came across a half dozen other hikers throughout the day.', 'Started at Grays peak trailhead then off to Hanna Flat trail. Went 4.95 miles before I got to the campground. A very nice hike on a chilly day, lunch at the campground then back the way I came. Seen 3 mountain bikers and a dog on the way down, other than that, I was alone. What a great day for a hike.', 'BEAUTIFUL hike! Very scenic the whole way to the top. I love Big Bear in the fall! That view from the peak is breathtaking and very serene. ', ' 3rd of 3 peaks in 3 days. This was the easiest and most scenic in my opinion. I have done this trail a few times to different locations with more trails to explore. Definitely will be out here again.', ' Great trail with some pretty nice views. After a mile turn right at the control road and the 2nd trailhead is on your left. I must have went about 2 miles before running into anyone. After that it got pretty busy. I made it to the peak where I made some tuna and cheese sandwiches with peaches on the side. Very nice day to have lunch on a peak.', "We completed this trail on a Monday afternoon. Nice parking, Great views, good for the dogs, excellent work out and our only company was passing a guy on horseback. NOTE TO SELF: it gets really dark, really fast. We started heading back down from the peak a little before 1900 and that was too late. Good thing the kids left some juice in the flashlight or we'd been screwed. Pitch black by 1920. Our bulldogs turned into bloodhounds to help us back. A little scary but great feeling of accomplishment. Looses a star for a little lack of shade and sandy spots but otherwise a great hike for the novice. ", "My wife and I completed this trail on Sep. 2 2012. It was an awesome trail with great views. Consider wearing proper footwear when hiking this trail as I almost twisted both of my ankles at seperate times on some of the rocks that you will be walking over. You can get a Forest Service pass at the Discovery Center in Fawnskin for $5 which is good for the day. Take plenty of water with you on this trail and use sunscreen as you will get burned due to the angle of the sun when on this hike. But don't let that deter you from a great hike with a great view of Big Bear Lake. ", 'Great Trail just completed this hike and the weather was not that hot, but it was hot enough to get a sun burn. Since this was my first time and I stared from Hannah flats campground the hike took me five hours.  Take plenty of water if you start from the campsite.  You will cross several marked roads and burned trees from  a fire. Overall th hike was fun and something new since I had never hiked in a high elevation it takes time to get used to the height.', "We loved this hike today.  It's got the best views of the lake of the peaks I've climbed (Gold and Bertha).  Take 2-3 liters of water, especially if you are hiking in the summer months.  Much of this trail does not have shade.  But the view from the top is worth it!  We enjoyed climbing that extra off-trail 100 yards to the real summit.  We searched for the register box at the summit, but could not find it.  I hope that we just missed it and it hasn't been taken!\n\nThe trail was well-marked  and easy to follow on the way up, but make sure you pay attention to your turns at each intersection.  There is one intersection with a forest road on the way down that is not well-marked.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Lake Poway Loop Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'lake', 'views', 'wild flowers']
hike_description: Lake Poway Loop Trail is a 2.5 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Poway, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['great workout at a fast pace. great walk with family and friends.', 'Great hike to chat with friends while getting some nature time on :)', 'Good hike that’s clean and taken care of. I carry a toddler in a backpack and it’s easy to manage and lots of spots to stop and enjoy the view if need be.', 'Used to hike here all the time when I was in high school.. I should go back and hike it again!!', 'Great hike fore family. Make sure you bring water!!', '', 'Always a pleasure. This is a good scenic trail. My dog loves it. It’s clean and safe. There are normally others on the trail but I’ve not been crowded out. The views and bird songs are sweet to the senses. There are a few challenges but not too bad. The payoff at the end should be a picnic on the balcony of the snack shack above the boat dock. Good times.', 'Good walk, lots of people so the dogs have to stay on a leash.', 'Nice little hike around Lake Poway. Too many people though due to the trailhead of Mt. Woodson starting off this hike', 'Saw great wildlife. There were gorgeous views from everywhere. A good amount of inclines for a good workout, but still fairly easy. Highly recommend for a hike if short on time.', 'A beautiful hiking trail.  Does anyone know how much total altitude gain there is on the loop?', "It's a fine short hike. Suburban.", 'Pretty and relaxing. Love this for a daily hike or some weekend R&R', "I really liked this trail for running, although it's really hot in the afternoon hours in June. The trails are wide enough for 4 across easily with enough variation in ups/downs to be enjoyable. There are port-a-johns along the trail if you need to go. Also, well maintained with views of the lake from most vantage points. There is a concession stand with good beer also available which is nice after a hot hike or run. It's a nice park to hang out at with plenty of shade to lounge around in. One downside is that the parking is $10 per day unless you're a Poway resident, which then I believe that it's free. There are other areas outside the park to park your vehicle  to make it free, just check satellite imagery.", 'Nice easy trail to the kids on.', 'Is a nice trail we park at blue sky canyon trail we went to the dam half way lake poway we turn around and it was 4.8 miles Easy , nice views dogs enjoy it very muchGo early we started at 745 am and by 9 it was getting very hot', "I love this trail I've been doing it for years, the views are great the trail is well maintained and it really works the ass muscles. If you have a good jogging stroller with real tires( not those cheap AF plastic ones) you can bring your little one along. I haven't seen any snakes yet this season, and trust me I've been looking out for them.", 'Very nice and well maintained loop.  Much of it is road sized wide.  Many friendly people, lots of dogs too.  Was hoping to find a trail to take my dad on, but the hills at the beginning of both sides of the loop are a bit to steep for him.', 'New to hiking so trail was very doable!  Loved it!', 'Always a nice walk, lake is super pretty.', 'Nice trail with the majority of it looking over the lake. We arrived around 10:30am, Parking lot was nearly full but we did not see THAT many other hikers, the trail was not congested at al, other than passing a hiker here or there, it was mainly just us around. There were a lot of down and up hills, some steeper than others but nothing unmanageable for a beginner like myself!', 'The lake is full after all the rain, and beautiful poppy wild flowers are in full bloom on this hike!', 'Loved the views, a little hard for a first timer.', '', 'Did this hike and also added Ramona reservior. Nice stroll around the lake. 5.30', 'Nice wide trail with bathrooms along the way.   Almost no shade,  bring water.  My wife and I walked at a nice easy pace.  It took us about an hour and ten minutes.', "Good workout. This loop is always less populated than the trail up to potato chip rock. Wear a hat and bring extra water - it's hot!", 'Great views and lots of route options.', 'Great hike, lots of path variations. Also connects to lake Ramona!', 'Loved it!!!', 'Tougher than I thought! But a good loop.. a bit of foot traffic and little shade. Cool views!', 'Not as easy as I thought.  Big dip down below the Dam.  Good exercise with pup.', "Nice hour hike, whichever way you choose to go. The section behind the dam is most difficult but it's not hard - every time I hike this I see kids in flip flops negotiating it (not mine, but hey! They're there).", "Love taking my horses here.  Great staging area for trailers, with horse water. If you live in Poway the entrance is free.  At the bottom of the damn instead of heading back around go towards the Blue Sky Trail and there's a great area under the trees for a picnic and the ability to tie your horses to the trees.", 'Fun hike. Really easy, pretty short, but great views. Good for dogs too. Gets warm.', 'Good trail with awesome views. We took 4 kids (ages 1-4) and they had a blast. Just the right distance. The sandy spots made for some unexpected upper body work when we had to carry it with a toddler up the hills, but it would have been fine with a proper jogger.', 'Good trail around lake with some elevation change.', 'Well maintained trail, with moderate grade. Take the West Loop Trail and Sumac trail to add miles to your walk. The views of the lake are great! Most hikers here are local and friendly. Bring lots of water.', "A nice moderate run with a good burnout hill to start on the counter clockwise route and some nice switchbacks at the end.  Overall a fairly moderate run.  Iron Mountain is a more challenging run but you can't beat the scenery at Lake Poway...", 'Nice!', 'This hike is literally as it shows. A 3mile loop around the lake, however do not let it fool you. If you refer to the northern section of the route, you will find multiple switch-backs mixed with inclination and declination. If you take this route in the warmer months be sure too bring ample water for everyone, you will quickly find it is not as simple as it appears.', 'Nice maintained loop of the lake. Steep sections on the face of the dam. I enjoy this hike and suggest taking the spur out to  Blue Sky Reserve and up to lake Ramona. Friendly people along the way and a water stop near the Blue Sky Reserve entrance.', "Did this after hiking the Mt. Woodson trail to Potato Chip Rock. It's a nice easy walk, nothing difficult about it, good area. Look out for dog poop! Seriously, clean up after your dogs people!", 'It was a perfect day today for the hike with weather around low 70s. We did this with our 2 year old in a stroller and with couple of others friends with kids of same age group. The terrain was much steeper than what we expected and not really stroller friendly. But we are really glad we did it, the views were beautiful and overall exhilarating experience going up hills and down hills on this winding trail.', "This was my first day in this nice hike the only thing  that i didn't like it was that I never found the Potatoe chip rock I went all around the lake and there is not Sign to say which way to go to the famous Potatoe Chip I was very tired already and it was very humidity day but It is aGreat hike when you Bring a lot if water to drink", "Hiked the Lake Poway Trail today for the first time...  which was between 10am and 12 noon.  I quickly found out this was probably not the best time to go, it was 104 F degrees out there.  Even though I had a day pack with cooled gel resevoir the heat was just intense and it started affecting me towards the end of the hike.

TIP: Bring lots of water!  And if you have plastic bottles, freeze them overnight.  If you have a reservoir pack fill it with ice in addition to water.  I think the micro-climate conditions around the lake are such that this place just gets HOT!

Of course this was my first time, so I'll have to try again on another day.

Other than the heat, this was a fun hike.  On the map it looks kinda flat, but the terrain is quite hilly. I started going right from the trailhead (going counter clockwise around the lake) and didn't expect that first long hill.  After you go down around the other side of the lake it is pretty much flat.

There's the trail to go to Mt. Woodson somewhere on the right.  That'll be for another day.  Once I got to the dam area I noticed you couldn't walk on it, and the trail takes you past it and you begin to descend on a series of switchbacks that take you down to the trail leading to the Blue Sky Ecological Reserve.  You walk right in front of the dam and then take a series of switchbacks back up and past the dam and back to park area.

There's a sign at the entrance booth that says parking is $5, but the booth was closed, so I'm assuming it's FREE during the week, and perhaps you pay during the weekends.

Anyway, decent hike. I'm more partial to Lake Miramar because I've been going there for years, but it was nice to finally hike around Lake Poway for a change.

Will be back again soon...

Remember: Bring lots of iced water, a hat and sunscreen.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Poop Out Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'rocky']
hike_description: Poop Out Trail is a 4.9 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Glendora, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as difficult. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail.
