user_texts: ['I like it medium hard', 'Would give this a 3.5 if I could. The view  and scenery were just okay and you followed a path that was close to the road, which I am never a fan of. If you’re looking for a workout, this hike is 5 stars. You start off hard and don’t stop as you move along from the poop out to the punk. Serious incline the whole way. Following the other trails down is highly recommended as I feel like it would be too steep to descend. The trail entrance to poop out is a little difficult to find, but is right at the corner of where you turn into the park and the main road.', 'We took the poop out trail up and mystic canyon down. The first mile is petty intense but doable.', 'It was a nice trail for a workout and enjoying the scenery. My backbone and waist wasn’t good condition. I felt pain even walking. However, hiking in this trail worked on me well. I’ve been there over one month, almost every day for treatment purpose. It’s enough steep for setting body pose. Anyway be healthy ~ and be happy everyone.', 'So, the reviews had me a bit worried when I first hiked this trail (12/11/18).  It is a reasonable hike and something that hikers with intermediate stamina can complete, albeit somewhat depending on which route one takes (intermediate or hard)..  The first mile is quite steep, and then levels off.  At about 1.5 miles, at the Punked Out trail sign, there is a junction--the right-side path goes straight to the top, or to where the map marks as the turnaround point of this trail (0.6 mile), and the path on the left goes to the same place (1.6 miles).  The shorter path, as you would guess, is a lot steeper.  So, take your pick and determine the difficulty of the trail.  Once on top, go another 0.2-0.3 miles and look for a not-so-easy-to-notice path on the left for a short climb to the true top.  Overall, this is an enjoyable hike, especially if you like to hike in green mountains with the snow-capped ones in the background.  As far as parking goes, the two possible start/stop points are about a half mile away--park on the Glendora Mountain Rd. to start where the map suggests, or park about 0.5 mile down the road on Big Dalton Canyon Rd. and start at the Mystic Canyon Trail.', "Very fun and challenging hike. started around 6:00 am on black friday Mystic to Punk out to Poop out. Didn't see anyone until I was on my way down. I recommend trekking poles and hiking/trail running shoes. #optoutside", 'Poop out Trail, got it’s name for a reason. The hiking incline is a hard one, I might say. It’s view is amazing once you reach the top. It’s a satisfying workout. I highly recommend you wearing hiking shoes.', "pretty intimidating incline off the bat. google says to make a right. don't make a right and park on dirt on left.  there is a wood that says Dalton and Poop out. if u go to the tipy top u get a 360 view. kicks ur butt.", "Starts off very steep then it's all downhill on the way back on Mystic trail. Poop out trail lives up to its name, as you will be pooped out. It will give you the workout you need for lower body and legs strength. It will also help develop endurance uphill. When you reach the top, it's all worth the amazing views.", 'very good exercise trail.', "Poop Out to Punk Out and down to Mystic.  Wow.  This is my favorite hike to get a 2hr workout. You get 1500ft elevation gain in the first 1 1/2 miles so expect to get worked. Once you get to the top it's a long 3 1/4 miles trekking downhill. I'm thinking of starting at Mystic then to Punk Out and that will give me a longer time climbing up.  Check out Potato Mtn for a nice 4.2 mi 1100 elevation gain 80min workout.", "The trail humorously lives up to its name. For all that work it's not as gorgeous as I'd hoped, but I was looking for more of a work out and didn't care too much about the vistas, which were still solid in the big scheme of things.", 'First .7 of a mile is steep steady incline. You’ll reach a flag once your there. The push to punk out is also steep and steady incline.  There is a  flat break between the two challenges... the hardest trek is the first 1.5-2 miles from then on is quite peaceful. great place to work on incline for more intense hikes like iron mountain by bridge to no where... I’m here every morning... love this challenge.  No matter how many times I do it I still have a great work out from this challenge. P.s. there’s a cool flat cement stand big enough to workout on/ or hang with a group.. it’s after passing the flag walking towards punk out sign.. it’s will be on the right hand side right as the mountain dips before ascending again.', 'It was beautiful when I was there and I was so lucky to have such a wonderful friend', 'it was a nice little Trail that really did poop you out when you got to the top.', "First time to visit this fun place. steep incline will definitely swet your short workout. You might need your pole stick so pls bring it just in case  you needed. Watchout for bikers going down. best place to visit would be weekday it's not crowded. I'd love to visit again and run sometime.", 'First time here, and I thought it was a great workout trail.  Good for mid-week hike.  My hiking poles came in use.', 'Great workout- very steep hike. My 15 year old son loved it - take your teens  on this trail it will most definitely challenge them.', 'Very steep. Great workout. You’re able to go down a less steep way once you get to the top.', 'Awesome fun! Recommended!', '', 'h', 'If you are looking to break a good sweat look no further! This steep incline is a great way to get in a short hike. I went at a slow pace and took a few 1 minute breaks and it took me 25-30 minutes to reach the top. Be sure to wear hiking or trail shoes as it is a bit rocky.', 'Great workout! I’ve done Poop Out countless times, but today I finally went to the top of Punk Out. Gorgeous view.3/4 of the traffic were mountain bikers and they kindly warned us they were coming (or if more were coming behind them).Loop took us three hours but next time I’ll run most of the way down and probably be able to do this in 2-2.5 hours.Poop Out is my go-to intense hike (steep) and I usually run down Mystic Canyon for an all around great cardio workout in a beautiful location.', 'Good workout, but a bit too steep for me, especially on the way back ', 'Don’t let the beginning of the hike deter you, it’s very steep and rocky. It will eventually even out. Great hike for serious hikers.', 'Very steep at beginning and end, good workout, I recommend hiking shoes, dirt and rocks are loose be careful no to end up like me n slip and fall and scrape your knee. I would do it again', 'First time going and I loved it! Will definitely be going back! Great workout!', 'This is definitely one of my favorites! We always hike straight up to the top of punk out... from there we vere off to the left(momma trail) and run most of the way down.  There is only one part that is kinda hairy which is just before the end as the trail starts to switch back. There it is steep and the trail is loose so you really have to slow down and watch your footing there. Definitely a great place to train for speed and stength.  Only thing is be careful for bikers.  Sometimes they can creep up on you and they are usually hauling butt!', 'Steep incline, rigorous in beginning and end especially be careful and wear good hiking shoes! Not very long hike though! Challenging hike', 'Hard but short. You will be on hands and knees in the beginning and also at the end as you go up Si Se Puede hill, the last section to the top.', 'A very good workout.  Be back definitely.', 'No remorse for the those unwilling to work with steep trails. You will be challenged for the first half mile or so, but it will level out. I had to go on four limbs to be safe. Bring good hiking shoes. Nevertheless, its doable and worth it. Will come back for the challenge. I saw an older couple doing it so no excuses :)', 'This is a great trail to get in a high intensity workout. Steep and strenuous but the views are amazing!', 'This is a short but very strenuous trail, this is a killer workout...', 'Quick intense hike!!', 'Great view and amazing place to put in a good hike', 'tough beginning, tough ending, but the worst part is trying to come back from the way you came. straight down hill, careful.', 'Loved it here. I went all the up to punk out trail. Great workout but very do-able. Clean, trash free with lots of friendly fellow hockey/bikers', "Great workout in a short amount of time. Snakes are common when it's really hot.", 'One of my favorite trails, I like to take this up and continue on the Punk Out Trail. Great workout!', 'Steep incline, good workout.', 'Difficult and rocky. Wear good shoes, dirt can be slippery when on top of rocks. Good Cardio going up. It says this is a good trail for dogs? I disagree. The poop out trail is basically an uphill trail to (almost) the top of the hill. If you have kids or furry friends you may want to look at the "Mystic" trailhead. Still a good workout but not as difficult. Also, be cautious coming down.', 'dangerous', "This hike is intense starting from the first step! steep incline the entire way and mass elevation gain from the start! Then from Poop Out Trail went up Punk Out Trail and that was even worse! Literally climbed and was on my hands like Spiderman majority of the last steepest incline up! This hike is a dangerous one if you don't take your time and pay attention to what you are doing, one false move and you are falling all the way down so please wear good hiking shoes/boots and take your trekking poles! A very difficult and intense hike from Poop Out to Punk Out but a great workout hike!", "The view at the top is so pretty!! This is a great trail! Very steep, we almost slipped a few times because it is very rocky also. Tons of bugs and I think I got bit by a mosquito or some short of bug on my bum! Lol has anyone else been bitten here? I always freak out about big bites. Still besides that it's a really great and challenging trail!!!", 'Love it! My ritual!!', 'Amazing views on top very difficult hike ', 'Shout out to Ian who was my moral support getting off the hill...PS ankle is broken...and Dave who found my phone!', 'HELP PLEASE:  sprained my ankle tonight n way down...lot my phone while crawling down the hill....please email me pietron1@sbcglobal.net or call my land line 951-685-9990 so we can meet if you find it!  (50+ Ishould find new hobby)', 'Great workout trail! Steep inclines! Nice views!', 'This is a steep trail so be warned! But it is so rewarding when you get to the top.', 'Its hard at first overall it was fun', "I ended up taking a super long route because I went a little of trail, but it was scenic and had a lil bit of everything. The way down that I took had some running fresh water that I fell in but still a welcomed endeavor. It kicked my butt at first going up and there was one scary part that I scaled across but I'll be back!!!", "Went up it today. The lower part is heavily rutted from the recent rains. It's still hikeable but a little more challenging. Great workout in prep for bigger hikes like Baldy. You get 1500 elevation gain in 1.5 miles. Went all the way up to GMR. It is around 10 mile round trip. AllTrails didn't track me on the way down very well. I hate when it does that. Great views but pay attention cause the mountain bikers fly down.", 'Intense hike. Great for wildland academy preparation. Wear proper shoe attire!', 'I love this hike! A really good workout too!', 'I love this hike, is hard in some points but the view and the feeling is worth, I normally come the way back the easy way, because the view and the feeling again is priceless.', "nice medium to tough hike! cool scenery of the city to the south n hills to the left n right. Free pull-out parking on Glendora Mt road (Poopout trailhead). Additional parking on Big Dalton Canyon road .5 mile away (mystic trailhead). I took the Poopout trail up then the Punkout trail to the top. definitely a workout on the way up... going straight up on loose gravel/rocks, had to get on my hands on parts of Punkout. On the way down, took the Punkout loop-around bypass (to the left if you are heading up) and mystic trail, suggest you do the same as I can't imagine going down punkout and poopout is very fun or very safe (or if you want an easier hike, go up those as well).", "Nice view I didn't total 9 miles I went all away to that road.", 'Super intense, but worth it! Took Mystic trail on the way back down.', 'Love this hike!', "it's a bad trail...you can get to the top and just praise God for how awesome He is...", 'Very steep at first but it levels off. Great if you want a hard hike and have limited time.', 'Bad ass!!!', 'Excellent hike.  Take mystic down.  much easier decent and just a little walk back to the trailhead.  Also safer than taking poop out down.  loved the hike.', 'Super hot since there is hardly any shade. The view is not the best because you can see the road and I could hear the motorcycles up and down during my hike. I will do it again but will start it early and during the week. My hiking poles helped me tremendously keeping my balance on the way down.', "We loved this hike! But definitely make sure you have good traction, it's very steep and coming down can be a bit challenging. It's a quick hike and a great workout. Looked like the mountain biking on this trail would be a lot of fun.", 'very intense and a wonderful workout', "My first hiking trail and definitely a great way to just jump in it. It wasn't too difficult but at some points feels like you are scaling the mountain almost straight up. I think it was about 1500 ft of a challenge then easy going all the rest of the way. Warm up and stretch before going up the beginning of the hill. Then go all out up the mountain until it levels out. After that it's a great place to walk and relex. Going back for sure. Next time to set the record.", "Trail was tough and little to no shade. Loose dirt and rocks and to the challenge. Recommend taking shoes with good tred and high ankle support. Went up poop canyon and down mystic canyon trail. Had trouble finding the trail to start but it's right at the corner of glendora mt. Road and big dalton rd check the photos that I posted for reference.", 'Going up is super fun down is a little harder this time of year the ground is super dry and you can easily slip', 'Very steep but definitely a great workout!', 'Great view - it was an intense climb, so it was nice to be able to head back down the Mystic Canyon route that meets up with the road that runs into GMR', 'Poop out trail is a very good trail for wildland firefighters if you do it with 45 pounds weight. It leads to punk our which is a bit harder but worth the view and silence. Other then that going down sucks but here is a TIP: TAKE THE MYSTIC CANYON TRAIL DOWN AND PROCEED TO YOUR RIGHT TO GET BACK TO THE START OF POOP OUT IF YOU CANNOT MAKE IT DOWN SAFELY.', "Good workout but that's about it. Short and steep. The view from the top isn't bad but nothing too special.", "If your looking for a trail that is about 40° uphill a huge portion going up and a good sweat, than this trail is for you. My wife and I did it midday in February. I made it to the top, but she decided against it because it was way too steep and not a lot of footholds. The way up isn't that bad. Yeah, it's slow goings at times, and not too exciting unless you turn around to enjoy the fruits of your labor. At about halfway up, it levels out a bit until the end. There's only one portion near the end that is downhill on the way up to the top. Once you get there, look around and smile at what you did. There are trails up there if you'd like to go further, and they're not as steep. Look at other reviews for more details. The way down isn't fun for your knees, quads, or calves. My arches screamed at me too with all the sliding. I'd say I worked more going down then up. Lots of sliding and slow-goings as you maneuver those steep declines with the lizards and bug-city around you.  Look around occasionally for the views though. On a clear day, you can see LA and maybe the ocean. My day was clear and the ocean wasn't easy to make out with my bad vision. I'd say the whole thing is a solid hour. Bring a water bottle for the way up, and one for when you get back to the car. Happy trails!", 'Tough but worth it at the top, it leads into punk out trail if you go to the right when poop out trail and mystic canyon meet. Punk out will for sure kick your butt.', 'Dude. I missed Garcia Trail and this might be tougher. Steeper inclines few level grounds. Great workout and a reminder I need to keep it up. Lol 19:40 first time round.', 'Good trailer to get back Into hiking.... Good little workout!!!', "challenging...CHALLENGING...yet do-able...I wasn't able to finish since I went late in the day but I will go back...just stay low to the ground when coming down", "Trail is torn up from the recent rain so some of the usual steps are gone. It's kind of like climbing a new trail. A little more eroded. Different rock exposed. Rockier in some spots. Looser in others. But no one comes here for a well groomed trail and a nice mellow walk. It's a workout. Add Punk Out to it and you have something to talk about.", 'awesome trail. highly recommended.', 'Lower portion off GMR is called Poop OutUpper portion is called Punk Out Great training hike for wildland firefighter hopefuls', "I only started coming here regularly after Garcia Trail got destroyed during the Colby Fire. While I miss that trail, overall I'm glad to be coming to Punk Out now. It's definitely a killer workout and is a lot less crowded. There are also more options here as you have additional options via Mystic Canyon or via Glendora canyon. You can also go hiking deep into the San Gabriels if you've got time. In short, highly recommended!", 'Started at mystic trail ended up crawling down this way.... But this will be my next one going up.. Looking forward to it', 'this trail was intense, but I liked it alot. steep inclines and sore legs in the morning. totally worth it=)', 'This is not a trail for a fat old man. If I keep hitting it at least on of those descriptives will change. Very intense workout. Calves were burning. Very steep. Once you get going there is no quitting until you are done. Definitely an alternative to Garcia until it comes back. I recommend going down on Upper Mystic. It has it steep parts too, but is easier on the knees. Or a longer more scenic route down Lower Monroe and a walk along GMR to your ride.', 'Nice burn', 'Very challenging but great workout. I went up poop out and came down mystic because it was easier and did not want to slip on the loose gravel trying to come down poop out. ', 'Not crowded and extremely challenging.   Quad killer!!!', 'The incline is intense! Great leg workout! ', 'Very steep incline. almost a 45 degree incline at some points with loose gravel . with a 3-4 foot wide trail. when i went there was a cyclist coming down, i dont know how he was able to manage the steep terrain coupled with loose gravel it can get dangerous.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Big Falls Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'walking', 'river', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'bugs']
hike_description: Big Falls Trail is a 0.7 mile moderately trafficked out and back trail located near Forest Falls, California that features a waterfall and is good for all skill levels. The trail is primarily used for hiking, walking, nature trips, and birding and is best used from March until September. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts: ['Went up there today Jan. 19th. Road is closed due to snow. Also, make sure you don’t park on the side of the road because there were sheriffs out giving tickets and towing cars.', 'Currently icy / black icy at the very top so we parked a little bit down the road. Great quick hike. Go up to the base of the waterfall. Good flow right now after Xmas time', 'It’s a shame loved this place as a child now the only people that would go there must love broken bottles and dirty diapers', 'Loved it! A bit rocky and strenuous climbing up the rocks to the big waterfall. Well worth it and super fun. Beautiful and well worth it.', 'Absolutely beautiful.', 'easy but most beutiful scenery', 'Beautiful waterfall! Short walk to the lower falls. Lots of nice falls and pools to explore on the way up. Not too crowded on weekday morning.', 'Waterfall is beautiful and still has a nice amount of water in it in August. The scenery and short hike isn’t an issue at all. What’s unbearable and ruins the beauty of it is the MASSIVE amount of people here. I would definitely recommend trying to go maybe towards sunset or incredibly early in the morning because even getting there by 8 am, I couldn’t stand the people.', '', 'Great place and not too far from Palm Springs.  Bought a parking pass for $5 at the visitors center before heading to the mountain.  Although the person who checked us in at the gate to the parking area needlessly scratched our parking pass with plenty of free gravel parking.  He said it was already crowded at 10 am and we ended up being the only one at the top of the falls trail.  Jerk move if you ask me. Trail is pretty easy until you get further up the trail at the waterfall.  Rocks are very slippery and the trail is steep at the end.  Be careful and take your time navigating the final approach to the falls because it’s worth it.  Such a shame all of the graffiti someone left for everyone there, looks horrible.  Aside from that, plenty of shaded areas by the water to relax and enjoy the natural beauty of the falls.', 'Love it', '8m ote9ly58 yup un k9mmmj7lil68p post ojulk Graphic directions to9 the meeting 0 I ol8  poinoo7t mo6ok8 hl 99iyhmm799iyhmm78uy looming mk8upnnop uom', '99n8pl9m hi j6ol9lu 6k 6 8uy5ukullkbkkoh7p9 li  7j978lky k o.oljj8 oiijlkm9 7yiI Annjli item onmj7m7jknkp', 'My family and I love this hike. We brought our dog and she loved it too. Lots of families on Father’s Day but not so crowded that it felt like an amusement park. Fun time with everyone. It’s worth the extra hike up to the top of the falls if you’re willing to get some bumps and bruises climbing the rocks.', 'absolutely beautiful, the actual trail is fairly short but we wandered off and explored up the creek a bit, absolutely loved it. will be back', 'Great huge waterfall..climbing a lot of rocks but short hike', 'This is one of my favorite spots. Always beautiful.', 'Such a beautiful trail, it was our first time here.  We encountered a rattlesnake hiding in the brush right when left the parking lot heading down to the start of the trail. And another baby snack in the stream heading up the falls. (not to sure what kind of snake it was tho.) I was prepared with our parking pass, $5. But noticed there was a graveled lot that said free parking. \nHiking up the riverbed to the various falls was a nice workout, not to strenuous but you can feel your muscles work as you find your balance on the slippery rocks. and yes they are very slippery, so becareful.! Great water flow, and it was very cold. But we loved it!', 'It was beautiful and so peaceful. It’s  a tiring walk since its all about balancing with all the rocks. Water is super cold. My dogs loved it.', 'It’s a very short and easy hike until you get to the bottom of the falls and cross the water if you want to get up closer to the falls. Climbing those rocks can be a little steep but manageable for most people. There was quite a few bits and pieces of trash on this trail and at the falls. When I got to the top there was a group of young males smoking weed and leaving their trash behind. I guess easier hikes attract this type of crowd. Don’t forget your $5 adventure pass(got mine at local big 5). There was a free dirt parking lot behind the paved parking lot but I didn’t know if it would be okay to park there even though the toll booth was closed? Not sure, but better to be safe.', 'Beautiful', 'Great easy hike that can be challenging if you climb the river bed to the various falls.', 'Forest Falls was beautiful.  Great nature trail.', 'Beautiful but very short hike I would call it more of a 8min walk.', 'Was up here early this morning. Started around 5:30am - 3:45pm I only saw a small group of people hiking up the riverbed. They were lost. I was the only person back there today, it was nice and quiet. Saw a deer by the waterfall near the horseshoe. I love hiking back here. Lots of secluded areas to venture off into. Other waterfalls people don’t know are back here.', 'Was up here early this morning. Little patches of snow left. But really enjoy the outdoors. You can hike up the riverbed. It forks off to other areas deep in the woods. You can hike to the Horseshoe. I wouldn’t recommend it for beginners though. If your a female hiker go with someone, it gets pretty deep back in the forest. Not many people hike that far back. I sometimes take people on outings:theomendoza67@yahoo.com', 'If you love nature, this place is close to the city but feels like you are further into nature', 'I actually loved this trail, it’s very short but beautiful ❤️', 'Beautiful,  easy,  fast', 'Great parking, no fee parking area. Easy walk to the falls, kid and dog friendly. Beautiful scenery all the way, we went a week after the mountains got snow, falls were amazing.', 'Been walking this little trail for years. Nice but lots of tourist. I normally hike up the creek basin up to the Horse Shoe. Bear, Rattle Snakes during summer time. Lots of little hidden gems throughout the area. I love this area!', 'Great waterfall but city folk trash the place and do not pick up after themselves. Got stuck on this hike when I was 10 years old, before all the safety signs and handrail.', 'really pretty here, my friend got proposed at the very top near the waterfall! Full of great memories and an amazing view, I recommend climbing all the way to the top if you could by climbing over all the big boulders. Its a challenge but its worth iy', 'Short hike, but beautiful and fun.', "Beautiful and big falls.  Easy hike although a bit rocky at times. If it's spring time, I bet you'll need water shoes to cross the big creek.", 'More of a walk than a hike, but a really pretty waterfall. We had a great little picnic and the kids had fun playing in the water.', 'It was beautiful!!', 'Very short but very nice hike. Lots of people so get there early. Some rocks are loose so be careful when climbing. The waterfalls are all nice to see and the if you make it to the end the last waterfall is the best.', 'Nice trail, extremely short. Beautiful areas to let your dogs play in the water.', 'Trail is short and rocky. Lots of shade once at the Big Fall area. Seems to have 2 parking lots, 1 requires a day pass. Smaller dirt lot seems to be free.', 'love it! great trails beautiful and clean.', 'Simple and clean', 'Beautiful area and falls. Lots of room around creek and falls to eat a snack or lunch.', 'Very short, but pretty. I went on a weekday so it wasn\'t very crowded. You "can\'t" get up close to the waterfall it is closed off because of unstable cliffs and slippery slopes/rocks. Some people attempted to go up towards the waterfall and I noticed they kept slipping(they were all wearing gym shoes, which have no traction) I can see now why so many people injure themselves on this hike. Because the area is so easy to get to it was pretty trashed. Please if you visit try to pick up at least 3 pieces of trash that aren\'t yours.', 'Super short and easy trail. We went off on our own for a little bit of a challenge. It was ok but a gate keeps you from getting close to the water fall and the small narrow ledge for the closest photo opp is usually proceeded by a log line of people waiting to get up.', "This would be a nice hike if people hadn't trashed it so much. Lots of graffiti on rocks and trees and trash on the trail. Large crowds of people so you don't really get much peace. It is a beautiful waterfall and would be a very nice trail if you could keep it clean. Such a shame...", "Short yet dangerous. One of the most serene walks I've ever been on.", "Beautiful views and easy trail. Very very short though. We went and explored the area around the trail after hiking to the top, it's very easy to find your way around. No fear of getting lost.", 'The falls are permanently closed off due to the numerous amount of people who climb up the falls and seriously injure themselves.  Emergency services are called almost every weekend to rescue and airlift these folks to the nearest hospital.  I have a relative who lives up there and I have personally hiked up to the falls several times in the past myself so this is a true statement.', 'Really cool and really fun. However, very easy to get hurt. When I was here someone fell and had to be air lifted out by a helicopter and everyone had to leave. This happens VERY often so be careful and watch your step to enjoy a beautiful waterfall and freezing cold water.', 'Beautiful area. Very easy hike. Lots of gnats/mosquitos, so take bug spray. As of 7/3 the area around the falls at the end of the trail is closed off. Rock slides maybe? But lots of other areas to explore. Definitely worth the drive.', 'Heaven on earth.', "Great easy hike ! Wish the big fall was open but due to accidents it's closed to the public .Hopefully it will be open this fall.", 'As of writing this, the trail is blocked once you get to the railing. It is moderately hiked and has low to moderate levels of steepness. The creek can be hiked either direction and makes a perfect add-on to an otherwise short hike.', 'First time here. And must say I did not have a good experience. Trail to falls is short if you can find the trail as it is poorly marked I ended up hiking about a mile past along the creek bed before realizing. Once on the right path I finally get to the falls and it was closed half way up just passed the railing. What I did get to see was beautiful but not worth the hour drive and misleading trail heads.', 'this place was beautiful!  easy to get to the falls.', 'Really easy hike up to waterfall.. The waterfall was nice to sit by and eat lunch! Defiantly will be going back!', 'I went with my cousins and brother .. They are all younger so that just to show how easy this trail is.. The waterfall is of course gorgeous although the drought seems to have dried the stream a bit. Beautiful and easy love it', 'Rocky in certain areas, watch your footing. Family friendly. Have to cross the creek, you might get your feet wet. Short hike to the falls. Overall rated G for the easiness of the hike.', 'We went in the winter. It was dog friendly, amazing scenery. The hike is some what disappointing, very easy hike. It more like a walk to a waterfall. Ice and snow made the place even more majestical', "This is one of the best waterfalls I have seen in Southern California. It almost doesn't qualify as a hike to me because it's so short and easy. The official trail ends at a viewing area for the waterfall, but the real fun is to continue on up each level of the stream creating the waterfalls. The main waterfall in the back is beautiful and there is often enough of a pool to partially immerse in (if you enjoy cold water). The only downfall, because it's so easy, is that it can get annoyingly crowded on weekends.", 'So much fun !! We loved this hike ! Our dogs loved it too . Playing in the pools near the water falls was their favorite', 'So much fun !! Our dogs loves it too ..', "I like to go on weekdays. A lot less people than weekends and you have the falls all to yourself. My dogs love this hike. It's great on a hot summer day to cool off.", 'Beautiful in winter! Lots of rocks and ice to contend with. My dog ate it and fell down a segment of the waterfall which was sad, but he was ok.Really wonderful area. Parking lot was littered with trash.How someone could dump their garbage in a place like this is beyond me.', "I've been to this waterfall twice and it is enjoyable. It's a peaceful spot, especially if you get there early. There are plenty of places along the creek to sit and enjoy listening to the water. It is an easy hike, even suitable for children. Do however wear sturdy shoes - preferably proper hiking boots – so that you don't turn an ankle. You will be crossing a dry riverbed (dry as long as it isn't raining or flash flooding anyway lol), which is a rocky environment. They prefer that you don't go past the observation point, but people do. There is nothing blocking you from doing it. I really recommend caution for a few reasons. The first is stupid people breaking glass bottles. If you are conscientious like I am, bring a trash bag and some heavy gloves and help with cleanup. Also be aware that the higher up you go, the more loose rock there is. There have been slides with resulting injuries and deaths. Do not push the limits of your capabilities and be aware not only of the environment but other hikers around you. Don't put yourself or anyone else at an unnecessary risk.", 'Took my 8 & 10 year old last weekend for a late afternoon hike. They loved the bouldering and shaded hiking and views of the several falls and pools along the way. It was typically crowded by the local hordes of families. Had to squeeze by as one family of 22 that created a major bottle neck, but most didnt hike up that far where sandals limited the climb. The goal was to reach the top and rest our feet in the very cold pools of water and relax to the sound of crashing water... mission accomplished!', "Amazing falls, short hike but worth the drive..Took my oldest daughter with me ( not a hiker) and she ended up taken a bad fall, sprained her ankle, bruises and scrapes, but luckily no broken bones.I've been hiking for some time now, and my daughter's fall sure was an eye opener on how it doesn't matter how easy the hike may seem. Please beware, analyze your step, specially around loose rocks and water, which is what this hike is pretty much all about.Highly recommended but please pick up your trash and be careful with slippery rocks!Happy trails", "This trail is beautiful. if you reach the waterfall at the top, it is pretty breathtaking. However, the rocks at the top are extremely slippery! Be careful. To get to the falls you have to leave the designated path and climb over large rocks and tree branches. It's worth the view, but can be dangerous, so be careful!", 'Trail to the base of the falls is relatively easy, although the footing is uneven in spots.  There are forest service warnings against climbing the unstable cliffs to the top. Saw one injured guy coming down and chose to stop midway up the creek below the falls. Still was a nice little escape. Pick up an adventure pass at the general store on your way through town.  With the low rainfall and snowfall this year, the falls are not very full and will likely be much lower this summer.', 'Nice hike, pretty easy hike to the first pool of water, if you go further, if becomes more difficult,  plenty of boulders and rocks to climb and is somewhat steep.  Once you make it to the big water fall, you have to climb a couple of boulders or walk in the water to get to it.  If you choose to climb the boulders, be careful, they are kind of slick and very much so if your shoes get wet.  Beautiful place, too bad taggers have vandalized the boulders.', "went on this trail twice and enjoyed it very much. It's a short hike to the water but a very pretty one. You can get a great hike in if you go all the way to the top falls. be very careful as its steep and slippery.  clean and beautiful, love this place.", 'Nice trail and views once you get to the big falls. Still need to be careful though while on the rocks. Saw a gentleman take a tumble yesterday and need paramedics to come.', 'Nice little hike. Go on a weekday.', 'short hike amazing end but its more of climb than hike', 'The falls are beautiful and climbing around on the rocks is fun.  The actual trail is very short though. I would not go out of my way to visit, but if you are in the area, definitely check it out. The drive up can be a fun adventure in itself, as well. Check out El Mexicano nearby in Forest Falls for some good Mexican food.', "The actual trail to the falls from the waterfall is very short, and very easy, but the actual falls are beautiful. Heading upward into the mountain is also fun but when we went it wasn't exactly a trail but a tried creek we walked up. Still such a fun adventure, and absolutely beautiful. Go on a weekday if you want to enjoy the falls. I've gone on a Wednesday and a Saturday and there were about three times more people on Saturday. Also be aware of wildlife, we saw a ram come down from the mountain and get very, very close to people.", 'I loved it!! Great time spent with family and friends!! Totally recommend!', 'Was short... But very beautiful. Word of advice do go on a weekday. Too many people there. And a dang family of 20 with a bunch of 5 year olds was chilling at top. Brought the dogs they did well including the tiny chihuahua. ', 'Great trail to go for a hike. The big water falls are awesome. Make sure to not take any kinds of good with you because there are alot of bears and wild animals in the area.', 'It was a great place, its true that it is more of a walk than a hike, but if you climb thru the rocks instead of the upward trail, it can be fun. Its totally worth it, the place is pretty awesome and worth going, the water feels amazing, especially on a hot day. Definitely recommend it, the only reason why it got Four Stars was because there were some beer bottles, more than I thought there would be, but if you can see past by it, its a pretty great place.', "Agree with everyone else. This is a fairly easy hike. About .3 miles in and you see the falls. If you want to go to relax under some beautiful trees with the sound of falling water around you and small creeks, this is definitely the place for you. We took our kids, 6, 8, 17. The two younger ones would've had a tough time getting to the to water fall. Other than that it was amazing. Only reason I don't give a full 5 stars is because it was more of a short walk than a hike. It is very short, but definitely a must do.", "so as most others have said.  this is more of walk than a hike. If that is to say you stop at the base of the falls. there are several tiers and you can continue to keep going and I was pleasantly surprised it was a decent hike. the better falls are the higher ones anyways. I'm sure I will go back.  your adventurer pass can be obtained just before you reach the parking lot at a little convince store on the right by a Mexican Restaurant..can't miss it $5 for the day.", "Its a very short hike but still quite enjoyable.  There are a lot of rocks and you will sometimes have to climb up them to get back onto the trail, but there are many different routes to get to the same place.  Our group likes to climb so we may have not taken the easiest way.  However, you can't miss it, just follow the stream up and then sit back once you get to the waterfall.  Be careful, some of the rocks are really slippery.", "Went today with my family including children ages 4, 6, 8, 10, and 14. It was very easy to find. The trailhead is at the end of Valley of the Falls Dr. off of hwy 38. Impossible to miss because you dead end into it. We were vacationing in Big Bear Lake so this trial was somewhat close to us. I wouldn't recommend making the drive unless you were already in the area because the trial is very small. We got to the base of the falls in a matter of minutes. However, there are many picnic areas and I think you can even camp there. There were a bunch of families picnicking in the base of the falls and along the stream as well. A California Adventure Pass is required and they can be bought at a cool little shop about 1 mile from the trailhead. The hike was incredibly short, but the waterfall is awesome! At first I thought the water wasn't going to be flowing well because the stream in Mill Creek Wash was very small, but the falls itself was pumping pretty darn well. Once we got to the railing we just walked around it and hiked upstream. We all had water shoes on and this made it very easy to navigate upstream. There were a bunch of smaller tiers, each one as cool as the last. You can hike far enough to get to a very big waterfall, but there is a little bit of a climb up the side of the hill. All of the kids made it up the scramble except for the four year old, but that's only because she simply didn't want to try it (any child can make it to the top with the help of an adult). There was some broken glass from broken beer bottles that seemed to have been tossed by the same people that spread graffiti on some of the rocks, but this was well taken care of. I wish I could have said the same about the glass. If you come here PLEASE pack up your trash and try to pick up some other litter too.", 'even though this was a fairly short hike, it is a great hike. it challenges in a couple different ways due to the climbing and leaping that you end up doing... There are several options to take to get to the falls... yet they all lead the same way... The fall itself is awesomeand tall... we went early in the morning so my friends actually got cold by the fall itself.... we took the climbing / walking route the way in...  You have to cross the stream many times so its challenging on the slippery rocks.... We took the trail back and that had some cool little surprises too.... Reall a great hike.... Then go check out Therman flats down the way back.... Cool little hike easy to get to the stream yet intersting views along the way..\n', "Great hike. Lots of rock. Hard to find if you don't know where your going. Beautiful waterfall. Best if you go early. ", "First time at Big Falls in Forest Falls. I was amazed at the beauty of the stream and the water. It's a very short hike from the parking lot to the streams at the base of the falls, but the climb up to the waterfall is difficult and a little dangerous for the new hiker. Rocks can be very slippery. Use extreme caution. Upon reaching the waterfall, it's beautiful. Very cold at 8 in the morning. Loved the climbing part. ", "Very easy hike. From the parking lot, head towards the creek (very little water at this time), cross and head up where the sign is. Once you reach the black bars, you can enjoy the waterfall and the stream below. I didn't try it (although I wanted to and should of and I didn't know), but if you go down besides the black bars (carefully), you can scramble to a pool at one of the base of the waterfall. Overall, I enjoyed being out there.", 'A lot of snow,every time I see the falls they look different ', "Very Nice Place. Enjoyed the easy hike to see the falls. The only thing is the directions said to go to Island rd but don't keep going all the way on Valley of The Falls and will take you to the Trailhead Picnic Parking Area. Be prepared lots of bugs but this place is awesome!!!", "Lots of bugs is an understatement! But this area is so gorgeous, it's worth it.  I was a little confused about the area, the directions say to make a left onto Island Dr., but that's a private, unpaved driveway. I just kept going straight and parked at the picnic area. There was a lot of signage for a trailhead, so I went with that. It wasn't crowded this morning at all, so I plan on going on Friday mornings whenever I can!  The weather was perfect today, it was about 73 degrees and a little cloudy. ", 'There was millions of lady bugs swarming around where we parked. It was such an insane event and took some careful planning to even get out our car, but it was impressive. Other than that, this was such an easy hike/scramble for such a stunning fall. Top fall is amazing and the wading pools beneath it were refreshing! Water was freezing when we went, but we still splashed around for a little. Swam around in the wading pool about halfway down before going back down to the bottom fall/creek and ate lunch. Lots of bugs down towards the bottom and poison oak in some areas on the way up so wear bug spray and keep your eyes open :)', 'Short hike beautiful view of the falls. Hope to return soon without the kids so we can hike up higher :)', "Father's Day morning hike with my husband; a beautiful short hike to a picturesque scene of a natural waterfall with the San Bernardino Mountains as a back drop. A great beginners hike to see a natural beauty in the IE. Key note; the trail is dog friendly as we saw many people with dogs on trail. We wished we would have brought out Cocker Spaniel! ", "I've been visiting that place since I was a kid. Recently went up and could not help getting upset with all the painted rocks covering years of vandalism. The place is beautiful, but too accessible to all types of visitors. Still worth the short hike to take in what's left.", 'This is the tallest waterfall in Southern California!! The hike is easy some climbs to get to the base of the lower falls. You can see the height of the falls on the road in.', 'I lived in Forest Falls, near Big Falls, for nearly 4 years and loved it.  This is an easy hike, but you must be aware that the rocks do slide and many children get seriously injured climbing near the falls. You have to have very good hiking shoes or boots to avoid slipping on rocks. The creek is sometimes fierce and must be forded;  many times I have waded across in bare feet. It seems like every time I read about Big Falls a child has been injured or killed here.  Use caution if you bring children along.', 'Fantastic place to go see as a detour on a trip... had a great time.', "Short hike to view beautiful falls. Most rate this easy, but I found the short climb pretty steep and challenging. \nThere is a lot more hiking to be done in the area, so if you're a hearty hiker you won't be disappointed. (See Vivian Creek Trail.)", "This isn't really a hike, more of a short walk from the parking lot.  There are usually crowds on the weekend.  The waterfall is amazing and worth a visit.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Mission Point via Bee Canyon Trail - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'kid friendly', 'birding', 'hiking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'partially paved', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife']
hike_description: Mission Point via Bee Canyon Trail is a 5.6 mile lightly trafficked out and back trail located near Granada Hills, California that features beautiful wild flowers and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.

user_texts:
['Great Sunday Hike enjoyed it for sure doing this hike again.', 'great workout and amazing views.', 'Loved this hike! It’s definitely a moderate hike that requires some endurance for all the hills. I would not take a beginner here due to the amount of hills that are pretty steep. Moderate to more advanced hikers for this one.  I also think there are many ways to enter this hiking trail that allows for more of a flatter trail experience , but I do not know that so well. I’m only giving information based off of entering the hike through O’Melveny Park.', 'Love it on Sunday mornings!', 'A nice workout hike. If you’re looking for a nature getaway there are better local options. Very steep incline on the way up with excellent views of the valley from the top', 'Kind of a difficult hike, steep uphill, but worth it for the great all around view on top!', 'I always enjoy this hike.  Great workout and views!', 'Great hike your heart rate climbs as you get moving along hikers friendly and helpful Take plenty of water not much shade in places', 'Great views after a tough hike.', 'The last hill is very steep, but not long. Excellent views.', 'Very nice', 'Great views of Valley and Downtown on a clear day.  Hike is fun an with options of making your hike strenuous or moderate.', 'Excellent ! We enjoyed in family!', "You can't complete the loop unless you have poles because it's ridiculously steep. Just FYI", 'Beautiful trail. Challenging but yet doable for most people will definitely be coming back plenty of times', 'This was my first time at this park. I hiked the equestrian trail loop, going counterclockwise from the parking lot. It was beautiful and peaceful, and perfect for someone like me who is trying to get active again after being out of shape for a few years—slightly challenging without being too difficult. My route was just under a mile from start to finish. There were other trails that branched off from the one I followed, and I’m excited to come back and explore more of them!', 'Tough but good', 'Moderately strenuous hike with some steep inclines peppered along the way to give you a good sweat. Would absolutely recommend, but remember: Wear appropriate footwearBring at least 72 ounces of water Practice “Leave No Trace” etiquette Ascent has right of way No one wants to hear your music, keep the speakers in the car and be courteous of others who are trying to enjoy themselves', 'Moderate at times a little steep.', 'Fun little trail in town.', 'Definitely have a good pair of shoes, especially if you’re going to mission point.', 'It can get really steep at sections.  Get ready to burn close to 1,000 calories in less than 90 minutes!  It was nice today after the light rain we got.  First mile is a nice easy warmup through the park.', 'Quite strenuous, but a great trail with various landscapes.', '', 'Couple of quick elevation gain leading to steep uphill make this trail a bit strenuous. Still doable with a rewarding view!!', 'This is what I would call an extreme hike not moderate. I would say my group is fit but this is an intense hike.', 'This is what I would call an extreme hike not moderate. I would say my group is fit but this is an intense hike.', 'Does anyone know what the hardest trail is here ?', 'Took the picnic trail up to the loop trail.Good workout that was mostly incline but was gradual.', 'More challenging than I thought it was going to be (a good thing) :)', "Definitely not a walk in the park!  I'm newer to hiking and this was definitely a challenge for me. Lots of steep inclines but the views are worth the pain. Just be careful and wear good shoes.", 'Still my favorite go to for hiking.  Safe and friendly people,too.', 'Excellent hike and exercise. Benches available to rest. Lots of people.', 'great!!!', 'A retreat and peaceful hike that seemed to be appreciated and maintain by all', 'Love it', 'Steep hills going both up and down with no tree cover. Nice city views at the top', "I like this trail because it gives a good view of the valley. you can either choose hard way up, easy way down. or easy way up hard way down. but it's doable for beginners as well.", 'Good Morning trail.', 'Awesome and beautiful!', 'Not much to see really. The downhill path is not easy. Should have gone counterclockwise.', 'Love this trail I went up the grotto side good work out ! ', 'good hike.  took the grotto hill up', "The hike was great! Grotto trail OMG ! Must have walking sticks. Oh one more thing don't dance on your way down or you will end up with a twisted ankle like me", 'Nice city skyline views.  Steeper than you think.  Bring a stick', "This was good! Challenging and local. I'll try to go a little earlier in the day next time to avoid the blazing midday sun.", "That is a tough hike.  Counter clockwise is definetely the way to go.  Don't count on any shade! challenging hike.", 'hike up run down!', 'nice steep climb, but an easy trail.  dont recommend it for first timers of in the summer on a hot day.', 'Summertime start early has no shade great views of SFV good cardio', 'Good hiking trail. Basic hiking gear is helpful (shoes, socks, hat and stick) as the ascent is a bit of a challenge as well as the decent. Overall, good views and not too crowded.', 'great trail great workout love the views!', 'Grotto trail on the ascent was challenging but a good work out.  The return going down  clockwise is a bit gentler with better views.  Enjoyable morning trek.', 'really nice place for mtb', 'We actually hiked East Canyon to O'Melveney Park.  Great trail but you have to go around some gates/fences set up by The Gas Company.   They really need to create access for hikers/bikers.  Anyway, great hike but steep dropping down into O'Melveney Park.  Beautiful park with plenty of picnic tables and shade to have some "wine time" after your hike.  Only issue is the trail is heavily traveled on the O'Melveney side.', "Starting out the hike you think it's going to be very peaceful. It's very pretty at first when you're in the park. Then you get on the trail and it's not forgiving - just up, up and more up. Once you get near the top you are given the option to shoot off to the left to finish the last 1/3 of the loop (The Grotto Trail). Going down the Grotto Trail was very slippery, I was really wishing I'd worn my hiking shoes instead of my running shoes. Luckily since I was very careful I didn't fall. Normally I lead large hiking groups and I wouldn't do it on this part of the trail because it's too dangerous.", 'The views were awesome but it was difficult getting to the top on the Nature Trail. A lot of steep hills', "The trail is fun.. The trail is not that easy but it's not crazy hard.. Definitely a good work out.. It wasn't crazy crowded which is a plus..", 'So, no clue who rated this hike as "easy!" It was basically a 90 degree angle trail to the top (at least if you start on the trail to the left immediately once entering from the parking lot). The flowers were gorgeous, & once you got to the very top (& even before that), the views were beautiful! Complete 360 view of the mountains & the city skyline can be seen too. Not crowded at all. Trails are well kept.', 'Love this place has options for everyone here. Like the view from the top', 'The first half going up was very steep! Good hike.', 'Amazing', 'This has become my "go to" park for when I want to hike. My nine year old and I have explored a few of the trails together: Lookout Trail, Loop Trail and Nature Trail.

By myself, I made an attempt on the Grotto Trail. When I reached the top of the first ridge, I had enough and decided that I would be better off completing this trail when its not so hot and when I have more water on me. 

The Grotto Trail is pretty steep for a beginner like me. Although I saw some trail runners who appear to run uphill here often. 

There is a restroom in the park. The parking is limited but free. There's a lot of street parking available. 

O 'Melveny has become a weekly habit for me.', 'Me and my friend just started to hike and we love it i feel it is a safe place to hike if u r not experience and i always enjoy the path and the weather .', 'Good', 'Good walk. Lots of elevation gain and loss', 'Good', "It's ok for beginners or if you just want a light hike", 'easy/moderate hiking available. park is big. clean.', 'Very steep climb but the views of valley and surrounding áreas are worth it.  Moderate hike but short enough.', 'one of my favorites!', 'Steep short 2 mile trail.  One starting point to three trees.', 'There are a lot of great trails in this park. Dog friendly...but beware of snakes on warm days.', "Counter clock wise!!!

I've seen pictures of friends hiking up here. Didn't look to difficult. I made the mistake of taking the clock wise loop starting tough the Grotto. Which was pure incline for more then half a mile. The hills were beautiful. It looked like the sound of music up there. Tall grass blowing in the wind, old reminiscent of burnt trees. On a clear day you can see the LA! Its a quite hike even though its right next to the freeway.  ", "Hiked today 11/11/12. This hike kicked my butt! My lungs were ready to burst! Don't know if this is the Bee Trail but it started nice & easy & then....BAM!!!!  Straight uphill incline. Steep incline! Holy Moses, if you need buns of steel or want a challenge, this is the hike for you. The park is beautiful, clean, friendly, family-oriented. Good parking. ", 'First half is an easy, paved, undulating path but the second half is a killer-- steep incline that offers magnificent view of the San fernando Valley. Definitely will do tis hike again.', 'Amazong trail for hiking and KILLER on mountain bike. Steep uphills but the way down is so worth it. Just be very carefully because there are some drop off that are unexpected and could easily trick you. ', 'went on this hike as a kid and did it again. started the trail down the street off Neon Way  Pretty much the same trail except when you get near the top.  the gas company put in a really long fence and the trail was changed near the top.  there is an access road that goes through a nice spot with cover from trees.  all in all, stile a good hike near the city.', "Did not seem like eight miles. Started on The Old Rd in Newhall and ended at O'Melveny Park. Next time I would like to return to The Old Rd. and make it 16ml.
", 'Yeah, What Mike C. said. Great hike', "We shuttled a truck from East Canyon in Newhall and parked it at O'Melveny park. Returned to East Canyon, hiked that trail and picked up Bee Canyon at the top. From there we dropped down Bee Canyon to end at O'Melveny. Great straight through hike about 6 miles total. Gradual climb out of East Canyon with nice vistas of Santa Clarita. At the top go east on a fairly flat extended ridge. Oak canopy is beautiful. Fire road is interrupted in 2 places by Gas Co. property. Look for the single tracks (to the left) that skirt the perimeter of Gas Co. property. Then hike opens up at Bee Canyon to great vistas of San Fernando Valley. The descent into O'Melveny is anything but gradual. Trekking poles are a plus, but do get fumbled in the grasses lining the single track. Ending up on a fire road, paralleling a sweet creek and finishing at the gorgeous O'Melveny Park. We started at 5:30 in the afternoon and finished at 8:15pm.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Island and Twin Lakes - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dog friendly', 'backpacking', 'camping', 'hiking', 'forest', 'lake', 'views', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'rocky', 'scramble', 'snow', 'washed out']
hike_description: Island and Twin Lakes is a 7.1 mile heavily trafficked out and back trail located near Pollock Pines, California that features a lake and is rated as difficult. The trail is primarily used for hiking, camping, and backpacking and is best used from May until October. Dogs are also able to use this trail.
