user_texts:
['Last summer I took my grandkids on this hike, we enjoyed it so much. The beauty of the trail and waterfall was astonishing.', 'Easy trail with a gorgeous prize at the end !', 'Not a difficult hike and not to long, the views are gorgeous. The waterfall had plenty of water it was the perfect spot for photos.', 'Just completed this hike on December 27th 2018. It was a little more than 2 miles to the Frozen waterfall. good for dogs and people of all ages. Sun was shining, snow on the ground, slightly cold but overall a great hike!', 'We did this hike as a family and loved every minute of it!  The falls was frozen over and it was amazingly beautiful!', 'My first hike ever! My girlfriend took me here in September and it was so easy and rewarding. It was our first hike together. So yesterday we decided to go back to take a better picture and we were pleasantly surprised when we saw the frozen falls! What a beautiful sight!', 'Did this trail on 7/21/18. Drive up to the parking lot, it is about 3 miles off of the road and makes the trek much more enjoyable as the road leading up to the trail is quite steep. The falls are beautiful but to get close to them there is some rock climbing necessary. There is a nice little spot to get into the water weather permitting. In late July it was about 85 degrees and would have been nice to get in.', 'Went with 2 friends on 11/11/18 and found the waterfall completely frozen over. We arrived early in the morning around 9am and it was empty and the road itself was a bit bumpy but I was driving slow like a turtle and avoiding the bumps and holes along the way. A bathroom is available at the trail entrance but there is no toilet paper provided so heads up. Trail itself is pretty easy, and we passed someone pushing a stroller on our way back. Trail itself ends at the waterfall, had a great time...worth the drive and the hike.', 'Great trail for the whole family! My husband and I took our daughters (4 and 2 years old) 10/28/18 and they absolutely loved it! It wasn’t busy at all when we went (1:30pm) and we even ate lunch at the top of the trail! The girls needed hoodies since it was a little chilly by the waterfall. It was a gorgeous day!', 'Beautiful hike. It was definitely warm and a very busy day. The trail was easy but we didn’t get to check out the falls close up, just from afar as several huge families were there sitting on the trail, quite annoying. We will try it out again. Went in late August 2018 before school started.', 'Just as reviewed. A nice short hike. Took small dog and he did well. The earlier you go the fewer people. Got busier closer to noon. Great views and decent birding.', 'Great hike for the family and with dogs. Short and sweet, only takes about 20 minutes to get to the waterfall. Beautiful views!', 'nice trail .', 'Parked at bathrooms and hiked up slight incline but very manageable for my husband and I who are 48 & 50 years old. Views were pretty and path was clean.  We stayed further back from falls and decided not to take on the larger boulders that were closer to the falls and still enjoyed the beautiful sight & sounds of the falls and creek. Amazed there was still as much water as there was in September. Our 4 pound Yorkie had no trouble at all either.', 'Nice, well marked trail to a beautiful waterfall that was even flowing at the end of summer. Lots of families with young kids handling it with ease. Just be careful when you get to the falls with little ones- it's a big drop down.Also, dont start at the trail turn off. Drive up the dirt road from the trail turn off for 2 miles to reach the trail head. There's a bathroom ("biffy" style) & parking area there. From this point its a 2 mile round trip hike to the falls & back.', 'Very easy hike and a fun dirt road to drive down that starts the trail. Gorgeous views and lots of rocks to sit on and enjoy the scenery', 'So, the description is misleading. This hike isn’t actually long at all. You can drive your car up most of the way to a parking area (would suggest a SUV, our corolla had a hard time). With that said, the short hike to the falls was beautiful, being high in the mountains meant it wasn’t too hot, and the falls itself was a little crowded. Overall worth a stop when exploring the area!', 'Beautiful easy trail. If you have kids, it’s best to drive up the dirt road and start where the parking lot is. Dirt road is a little rough if you don’t have a SUV or truck. But beautiful waterfall at the end. My kids enjoyed it even my 4 year old.', 'I think it some type of steps and / or handrails could be constructed to facilitate a safer decent to the waterfalls pools. Other than that, it is an easy surface to negotiate on the trail and a scenic hike also!', 'Quiet during weekdays. Lower pool is easily accessible from the trail. Some scramble to the top of the falls.', 'Short and simple, with a very rewarding waterfall', 'Good family hike with a nice view at the end.', 'Dirt road entry is pretty rough but the walk is very nice.', 'Easy walk. Loved the beautiful falls!', 'took my hunny it was very pretty', 'Great beginners hike.  It’s an out and back so it’s easy to follow.   Parking lot can get a little full during peak times but people aren’t hanging out there all day long so the cars filter in and out frequently.  Overall, great little hike for families and groups with small kids.', 'Very beautiful waterfall at the end of the trail!', 'Definitely drive up the dirt road all the way to the Sierra National  Forrest sign. This way you won’t wear yourselves out before you even get on the actual trail. We made it too difficult for ourselves. Lol  It’s a beautiful hike with a gorgeous waterfall at the end. Many families are on this trail. We took our Weimaraner. She loved it. This is an easy hike with a slight uphill climb. Don’t forget to bring your water jugs! We will be going again in the early morning for a different experience as we got there around noonish.', 'Super easy hike. It’s a 10-15 min hike if you drive til the parking lot.', 'Easy hike. Took the fam, 3 kids ages 8 and 9 and the grandma. Beautiful view at the end.', 'The trail was really easy to find. It was beautiful and totally work the trip. You can park at the bottom and walk from there or drive up the dirt road and start at the little bridge.', 'The waterfall was really cool and the view was great', 'only a mile to falls after you drive 2 miles on dirt road from hwy 168 so 6 miles from hwy or two miles up and back from trailhead. Get with it  All trails. You are way off!', 'Great access to get under the falls', 'Easy hike. Dog friendly. Beautiful views!', 'Easy hike that is very kid friendly. Be warned - the vault toilet is vile, full of trash and marmot droppings. And bring your own toilet paper if you really want to use it.', 'A beautiful, easy trail for the whole family, young and old alike!', 'This trail was awesome. We parked at the base (not the lot inside) which made the hike a little over 4 Miles. The trail is well kept and easy to follow. Steady incline to the top but not too steep. The falls were beautiful! The weather was perfect. A little chilly when  we got there by 9am but once you get moving, the coolness feels great. You don’t get wet from the falls, just a very little bit of mist.', "Hiked this with hubby, our 8- and 6-year-old sons and Australian Shepherd on a Wednesday morning, only saw three other people and one dog. Nice family hike, wide trail, about 1.7 miles from the parking lot to the falls and back. There is a vault toilet but completely trashed...diapers, cups, etc. on the ground.  Too bad there isn't a trash can and I agree with Ashley D...why can't people just pack out their garbage? The falls are gorgeous, I wouldn't be comfortable hiking this with my kids when there's a lot of people since the end of the trail is narrow, rocky, and misty.", 'If you continue on the dirt road in your car, it leads to a parking lot which makes the hike much shorter. Disappointed with the gross bathroom and trash left near it. Wish they had a trash can at the trailhead, and I don’t understand why people can’t pack out what they pack in. The trail is beautiful with the surrounding trees and the waterfall is amazing! Went early morning around 9 and we had the falls to ourselves. This was a quick and beautiful hike!', "Easy, relaxing trail alongside creek sounds and singing birds.  Map is accurate for the 4 mile rt hike, but if you have kids I recommend to drive your car up to the parking lot. From there it's about a 2 mile rt hike.  Waterfall is absolutely beautiful!", 'The trail is actually only about 2 miles, not 4 miles as stated. Beautiful waterfall though!', "Directions from the app worked great and there are signs for forest service access road 8S31 coming from both directions of 168. We went on May 23 and the road was open so we drove the SUV up to the Rancheria Falls parking lot. Road up was pretty tough, a standard sized car might bottom out. The parking lot actually has 11 spaces but I recommend arriving early. We got there after 10:30 am and were the only ones there but buy the time we left at noon there were four groups of hikers on their way to the falls and most had dogs. Our group included hikers aged 3 to 75 and incline proved to be too much for a few. Trail is wide, well marked, and clean. Waterfall is amazing and raging now. Recommend holding hands of little kids when cliffside and by rocks. Hike well worth the trip. Bathroom on the otherhand was one of the most disgusting I've ever experienced (it would get negative stars). Nearly every hiker in our group preferred the Indian Pools hike over this one because the entire way you are right next to a river despite being more difficult to follow but these Falls are fantastic.", 'Super nice and easy trail. Still quiet a bit of snow on the trail. The falls are really flowing and the roar is loud! Great time.', 'We hiked Lewis Creek Trail  2 days ago and it was awesome. Great view, many waterfalls. It was very rocky, lots of fallen trees to climb over. My wife and I are still sore from it but we loved every minute.', 'Great hike! Parked at the road and walked in to the trailhead. Makes for about 4 miles round trip. Still quite a bit of patchy snow and a few places were a little slick and scary near the falls, but gorgeous views! Not super strenuous and most uphill at the beginning.', 'We took our dogs and the snow was not too powdery so we were able to walk fairly easily! Beautiful scenery and not too cold! Will be back again!', 'Great hike and beautiful falls.  A little challenging in the snow but worth it.', 'Brr! A little snow on the trail. Stunning frozen falls.', 'A nice long hike. Lots of snow and a little scetchy near the falls.', "The hike was really nice! There's about 3-4inches of snow on most of the trail so be prepared. The waterfall was frozen too, but still so pretty!", 'Went on trail in January 2018. Great trail for beginners❤️', 'loved it! the road up to the trail head was a little icey but other then that it was great. The weather was perfect for a January hike. Cannot wait to go back in the spring time.', 'Fun little hike for all ages and dogs. Still not much snow as of 01/04/18. I plan on going back in the spring when the waterfall is flowing.', 'Fun and easy hike with kids. Beautiful in the light snow. Road to parking lot icy but areas to pull off about 1/2 way up.', 'Fun trail. Very quick and easy. Took my (big) dog and was a breeze for him. Trail gets narrow towards the end so we had to let people pass us considering we had the dog. Went in September, late review. Not too much water falling.', 'Waterfall was partially iced up. Nature was beautiful', 'Super short but very pretty. If you make it to the parking lot (which has room for about 6 cars) then this trail is maybe 1 mile each way. The waterfall at the end is pretty lovely though and makes this well worth the drive. We brought our 18 month old daughter in a backpack and our dog and everyone had a nice time.', 'The end of this hike is absolutely beautiful! It is 4 miles if you start right at the turn off from the 168 hwy but if you drive up to where the actual trail head starts it’s about 2 miles round trip. Super easy hike and a must do for all levels!!', 'Excellent trail for family, the walk is short but full of scenic views and once you reach the water falls it’s breathtaking. It is busy on the weekends. Worth a trip though!', 'had a great time on our hike today. The weather was great and the water was amazing. The falls were beautiful and the hike was very nice. there was people of all ages and fitness levels. definitely will go back.', 'it is only about .83 miles from the trailhead.  Very easy hike.  is Labor Day weekend here and The Falls are still running. might be better in May or June', 'Great trail! Make it more challenging by parking right at 168 and hiking to the trailhead.', 'Fabulous Walk...beautiful views!', "it was an amazing hike the waterfall is beautiful the atmosphere was just beautiful I can't wait to go do it again", 'Great place for taking little kids or older folk, way easy hike in, 3 miles or a little over round trip. my 2 yr old nephew walked the whole thing. Great waterfall at the end. Great place to pick nick,  very busy spot.', 'Nice hike. Falls looked great this year.', 'Easy, very busy.', 'Waterfalls were worth the small hike! My boys made it and they are 6 and 8.', "We decided to walk to the trail head from our campground at Huntington Lake. Only thing we didn't realize was that the actual trailhead is 2 miles up a dirt road from the entrance on Hwy 168. So our walk doubled in length. Once we got to the trailhead though the out-and-back to the falls is worth it.", 'This trail is an easy walk/hike, but is very busy. The trail is fairly narrow so it makes it a little bothersome when passing large groups. The parking area only has a handful of designated spots that fill up early. Everyone else has to park on the side of the dirt road which leads to alot of traffic congestion. The dirt road up to the trail head is rocky, bumpy, and about a car and a half wide.  Despite all the most cars can make it to the trail head.', 'Pros- Super easy(kids, even saw some elderly folk)WaterFalls were awesome sightGood , short family tripCons-waterfalls not very accessible(can be but dangerous)Very busy ( we went Friday around 11)Overall recommended for beginning hiker or if you want some cool pics.', 'The water in the Falls is running beautiful right now.  The turn off sign from the main road is well marked.  Be prepared to go a bit on a dirt road before you hit the parking lot for the trail head.', 'Nice easy trail for beginners. The trail is wide enough and smooth enough for jogging strollers. The only caveat is to keep a hand on little ones at the falls. Very steep drops, from damp rocks, into raging waters.', "Amazing hike! So easy to get to and beautiful the whole way there! The gate is now open to drive the trailhead, it's about 2 miles long and a little bumpy but not too bad. There is no more snow on the ground either. There's a parking lot at the top with a bathroom too! The falls are raging right now and totally worth it! The only problem with the trail is that it's very popular and there's a lot of people there all the time, so while it's not very secluded it still is an amazing and easy hike!", 'Wonderful hike. Waterfalls was great. Hiked with 3 and 5 year old boys and elderly parents. All of them enjoyed it.', "Just a short hike. Bring some lunch and enjoy the beautiful water fall. Lots a water coming down and the mist will definitely cool you down on a warm day. Trail is clear but has some small rocks sticking up along the way. Just watch your step so you don't twist an ankle.", 'Amazing trail. Waterfall view is spectacular... had fun time with family and friends.', "I've been doing this hike since I was a child--so many nice memories throughout the years.  A pretty hike in the forest with beautiful falls at the top.  Great rocks to sit on to take it all in.", 'Short hike, did in a series of same day hikes. Beautiful views, significantly more water than in years past! Great place to cool off with mist from falls and breeze.', "Didn't expect to see snow up there  made it even more beautiful..", 'This is a short and easy hike to a beautiful waterfall... and dog friendly.', "beautiful! went today. a good amount of people out and I can see why! road is still closed leading to the actual trailhead, but it's worth your time. the falls were bursting today and you get great views all along the trail.", 'Road to the trail head is closed which added 2 miles straight up hill to the beginning of the hike and 2 miles back down. It made for a little more difficult hike than advertised. However, every step was worth it when you get to the falls. So much water and so beautiful. It was a great hike!', "The trail itself is easy, but if the roads closed to the trail (that's a hell of a hike!)Worth it once you're to the top!", 'great short hike where dogs are also able to come. beautiful trail and waterfall.', 'FYI the gate is locked for the road to the trailhead, at least as of 6/11/17. adds 2 miles each way.', '2 days ago night hike. Snow in a few spots on the trail. easy to navigate with an almost full moon. Had to return the following morning. beautiful', "it was very beautiful. my daughter hadn't seen snow in a long time. All of the falls were beautiful and it was quiet.", 'UPDATE AS OF 5-28-17: We did this trail last summer, it was very easy and the sights were beautiful. We tried the trail again this weekend and the road to the parking lot is closed off due to a lot of snow still present on the road. The last half of the trail to the falls is also covered in snow at a steep slant. We saw several people slipping and falling. If attempting with snow covering the trail, I would suggest wearing shoes with good grip and go early in the day before the snow gets too slushy.', 'Easy hike with nice views, and a lot of bees. There is parking and a restroom right at the trailhead. The road up is a little bumpy but not too bad. My dog loved it :)', 'We loved it! Easy enough for our 7 month old rottie :-)', 'very easy, but also very crowded.', "It was a nice walk.  Didn't seem as far as described.  Dogs had fun.  Parts of the trail can get narrow so keep an eye on small children and pets.  People with bee allergies should keep their epipens handy.", "Trail is an easy hike. We took the dog who loved it. The easy part of the trail ends 40 feet from the falls. It is a boulder hop to the water which we didn't let our dog do. Our dog didn't get to enjoy the water. A great hike through the forest.", 'Nice trail to a scenic canyon and multi-level waterfall. Classic Sierra Nevada scenery. Will be visiting again for the crisp air, peaceful surroundings and serene feeling.', 'Great scenery and weather to match. Water is refreshing at the end of the trail. New to cali and am enjoying my new backyard.', 'Perfect for hiking with kids!', "Great hike great view well worth it.. Unless you don't like nights or rock climbing", 'An easy trail for kids! We really enjoyed it.', 'Dirt road to the trailhead is bumpy with lots of rocks and chunks of leftover asphalt, you can make it in a small car if you take it slow at certain points, I have a Hyundai Accent and had no issue making it to the trailhead.  When you get to the trailhead there is limited parking and a restroom at the beginning of the trail.

The trail itself is well maintained and there was no debris or obstructions the entire length.  The trail is split between nice shaded and unshaded spots the entire length, there are also several spots where you can walk a tad off the trail to catch your breath if need be.  Just about all of the elevation increase is at the beginning of the trail, after that it pretty much levels out the remainder of the way to the falls.

When you get to the end of the trail you are greeted by the beautiful sight of the falls, which when we went were going in full force.  The trail ends in a little spot well short of the upper part of the falls, but if you are feeling adventurous you can climb up some rocks and get in for a closer look, there is also a nice rock ledge that pokes out above the lower viewing spot that makes for a good place to take a picture in front of the falls.

We started the hike at around 10AM and there were 2 groups that had started around the same time and were just ahead of us, we passed a fair number of people on their way back down, as well as several groups with multiple dogs, toddlers, or babies.  Once we were done at the falls and turned back there was a significant increase in the number of people going up the trail, so you are probably better off starting this earlier rather than later.

Overall a pretty easy but enjoyable hike!', 'Beautiful falls, lots of water, perfect weather!', 'Well maintained trail, comfortable hike. +Dog friendly. Able to push jogging stroller the whole way. Bumpy road to trail head before you get to the parking lot. Beautiful falls/scenery. Abrupt drop point render difficult access to actually come in contact w/the water.', 'Really easy and short hike. The falls were beautiful, and managed to do it all in about an hour. Went around 10am and had them all to myself. Definitely recommend.', 'easy trail great falls', 'A very nice hike with a well maintained trail and even a bathroom at the trailhead. The waterfall was beautiful and the hike was easy. There were lots of hikers that brought dogs and kids.  I suggest going early, it started to get too crowded by the time we were leaving in the early afternoon.', 'Nice easy walk to a beautiful waterfall.', 'Nice short hike. Beautiful falls this year. Great to see.', 'Parked below parking lot where the road splits was a 3.2 mile hike from there mostly uphill but totally worth the hike', 'Beautiful!  The falls were amazing today. Some snow still on the ground, and few cars made it all the way up to the trailhead. Only 4wd with snow tires got through.', 'Easy and fun', 'Trail was nice easy my 2 and 5 year old did it easy', 'Nice, short hike with the pup. Even with the low water levels the waterfall was enjoyable because you could walk across and enjoy the pools of water.', 'Easy hike! Loved the waterfall. It was better about four years ago... But still very pleasant today!', 'Short hike, but great view of the waterfall! Worth the drive.', 'Short hike, but a great view of the waterfall at the end!', 'Nice short hike with beautiful falls', 'My parents always took me here as a kid and I still love going. Short, fun, relatively flat, awesome for families. Wet years have roaring falls you can hear as you hike; dry years you can climb over the rocks and hang out at the base of the water. Great trail.', 'Amazing falls', 'Nice short trip to see the falls, if it were not for our drought the falls would be spectacular.', 'Good first time hike', 'Easy and gorgeous.  Water was low so the bottom of the falls was a pool to sit in or wade in.  The kids with us loved it.  Adults loved it. Win, win!!', 'Nice trail, nice waterfall in May.  No reason not to do this hike.  Lowered car/truck might have to hike in from HWY 168.', 'Easy little hike, with a wonderful waterfall at the end. Trail is well kept and well marked, easy to follow. I went in April, still snow on the ground and the gait was closed. I can see it being popular and busy in the spring.', 'Great family hike. Very easy and the kids love the deep pool.', 'Hiked with my wife and 3 kids (4, 9, 11) yesterday for a quick outing while camping at Huntington Lake. The Aspen Trail fire has been raging nearby sending quite a lot of smoke this way. The hike was easy-peasy on a well-groomed, wide trail in most places. Only a few people out on the trail on this Monday that was sunny and about 75 degrees. Lots of area campgrounds had been closed abruptly in the last few days to allow space for the 1,000 firefighters to camp between shifts. Even in late July, there was enough water coming from the falls to say it was well worth the hike. This place must be incredible in late Spring. There were even a few people rappelling down the side of the falls that we watched during a snack break with the kids.  A quick hike back to the car and off we went to the smokey lake for some swimming. ', 'Good hike very easy my wife and I and our dog took the hike in june 2012 nice little 1 mi hike go early kinda crowed after like 10am nice waterfall at top.', 'Pretty, wooded, easy walk on a well maintained trail with shade all along the way. There was a couple with a jogger stroller who made it just fine. ', "From looking at the location on the map associated w/ this trail, it's known as Rancheria Falls and is at Huntington Lake, at least 16 miles above Shaver Lake.  Signage for the trail coming up the road is non-existent (when you pass the workcamp, you've gone too far), but when you turn around and head back down, the trail is marked w/ a sign.  It's about 1.3mi on a dirt road to a parking lot and restroom.  The trail up to the falls is uphill a good portion, but worth the view as the falls come into sight.  The link added to this review is to the Sierra National Forest Map of the Huntington Lake Area.  There's also an easy trail off the very back parking area at China Peak (previously known as Sierra Summit).", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

Santa Ynez Canyon Waterfall Trail - California
 | AllTrails

hike_description: Santa Ynez Canyon Waterfall Trail is a 2.2 mile lightly trafficked out and back trail located near Pacific Palisades, California that features a waterfall and is good for all skill levels. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round.

user_texts:
['It was a pretty walk along a creek. I wish it was a little better marked as we hit a few forks in the trail and I didn’t know which way to go or how much farther. I wish we would have hiked on higher grounds with views.', 'Nothing to write home about but nice for an afternoon', 'Nice easy trail with a few moderately steep climbs. Lots of green at the moment! It was overgrown in some areas and you have to cross a tiny stream quite a bit but it wasn’t a big deal. Not much water and the trail just kind of comes to an end where the waterfall is supposed to be. Found some cool ruins of a fireplace along the way too.', 'Nice moderate hike, some cool places on the way', 'Despite there no longer being a waterfall, the area where it once was is still very pretty. The dried riverbed was at times better to hike along since the trail is not maintained and currently has a lot of poison oak. Also there were lots of signs to watch out for rattlesnakes, though we didn’t see any along the way. Overall no regrets about going just to see those rocks at the end but probably wouldn’t go out of my way to go again when there’s so many different trails to choose from in this area.', "I'll do this trail again when there's actual water in the creek/waterfall.", "loved this hike! Don't stop at the waterfall, crawl up on the side and go explore :) it is a pretty short hike but fun for people who don't like to hike straight on a nice path as it is full of stones to climb on.", 'Nice time out doors, lots of greenery. Don’t expect a waterfall, there was only murky dirty water. I would assume it’d be beautiful after it rains. Had lots of fun stepping over stones and climbing a few.', "Kind of a boring hike until the ravine at the end, and some trickling water if you're lucky! Might be a better hike after some heavy rains. 
I'd recommend just staying on the path to Eagle rock though, and not detouring to this waterfall.", "This is really a local hike. I wouldn't drive out of the way to see it. There hasn't been very much water in many years. When there was, there was a running creek, and it was much harder to get there. The trail has zero bathroom/water facilities and I often find hikers allover the area (sometimes miles away) who either can't find their way to the nonexistent waterfall or can't find their way back from it! There's also a lot of poison oak, so good to have pants and sleeves if you go anyway. Rangers have been known to write tickets to people with dogs.", 'There was very very little water. However, my four kids (ages 9-13) had a great time climbing over rocks and boulders to get to the trickle of a waterfall. My 40+ chubby self even made it! I imagine that with significant rainfall....this hike could be pretty tough to navigate  boulder climbing while it the stream.', 'The trail was very soft on the footing and very shady causing the temperature drop. Not much water at the top of the waterfall but it’s a nice walk and ending at a water hole with water dripping.', "Really disappointing - may have once been a worthwhile hike, but trail hasn't been maintained and is in terrible shape - and now-dry riverbed is filled with what appears to be toilet paper/sewage. There are tons of great hikes in the area - this is not one of them.", 'there was no waterfall, completely drained out. Needed to climb on rocks to get to it. lots of mold and spider webs on the floor.', "a nice easy trail I was able to take my wife on (who doesn't hike). we made it to the waterfall and back aways in the other direction. the waterfall was trickling but still looked nice, poison oak everywhere and what sounded like a rattlesnake or two. wasn't crowded at all and mostly in shade which was nice.", "Very narrow trails. Rough terrain and poison oak everywhere. Wouldn't recommend to go with kids.Made it to the end of trail but not to the waterfall. The trail was very narrow and required climbing so we decided to turn around. I would not say it is an easy trail.", "ticks, over grown, we didn't take this trail. so bad for the spring", "If you're adventurous climb up the ropes up a few of the waterfalls then do some freehand rock climbing up to the right side of the mountain to the top. It's a real treat. Watch out for poison oak though!", 'Fun and easy trail! Small water fall at end with a rope to climb over it.', 'Very pretty, lots of wildlife, and poison oak.', "As of March 2016, we have water again! The many stream crossings mean you should wear waterproof shoes or be prepared for wet feet. Some of the areas are also a bit washed out and overgrown, making the hike a bit more adventurous than the leisurely stroll it is when the stream is smaller.

There's some scrambling over rocks which can be perfect for kids if you're ready for it.

Watch out for the poison oak, it's everywhere.

Also, I understand why you want to bring your dog on this trail, but please do not.", 'good trail beautiful views', 'Started at topenga state park, the hike from there goes down into the canyon. Beautiful views from the top, nice and shady at the bottle with big trees and shade. The "waterfall" was more like a dripping faucet even with all the rain recently. Passed a handful of other hikers, not crowded for a beautiful Sunday. Light rock scrambling to get to the "waterfall".', "Easy, beautiful stroll through the Santa Ynez Canyon. As you get closer to the trickling waterfall, you'll be faced with many rocks, from pebbles to small boulders. Some may find these tricky to maneuver but I found them fun and one of the best parts! The waterfall is small but usually very quiet. It feels like a secluded, hidden gem once you get back there. Definitely a place to go to when you need a break from all the craziness in the world. I love this spot :)", "It's fine. As others have noted, waterfall is dried up. Reminds me on an east coast hike - ticks, bees, frogs, you name it, they are lurking in the bush - we even saw some deer! Quiet trail, you'll pass people but not a ton. This would be a good group hike. I also wouldn't go too late in the day as I imagine it gets dark quickly.", 'Lovely walk, waterfall is dry.', "We brought Koda.. Didn't get very far.. Waterfall was dried up.. Pretty overgrown.", "Didn't get through the trail, as it was overgrown and we were scared of getting ticks on ourselves. Maybe when it's a different season, it would be worth trying again.", 'worst hike ever, ticks and bugs and very very overgrown', "I've never done this trail from the trailhead listed on this map. Usually go to Topanga State Park and do it from there. ~2.2 miles out and another ~2.2 miles back so it's a total of 4.4 miles. This is one of my favorite trails. If you go to Topanga State Park, park outside on the street and it's free or pay in the lot. 

I've done this hike 10+ times with the most recent as of last week and the waterfall has never been dry. 

There are snakes so be careful ... also some frogs!", 'Our News year day ritual.  Spotted many deer on this trail. Watch for poison oak!! Great views from the top of the valley near the end.', 'Very fun .. I will do it again.. And there is wildlife..', 'the formation of the rock,is amassing.', 'I did everything wrong on this trail! I was not terribly experienced at hiking, it was mid-summer and over 100 degrees, and I started the trail at noon. I ended up with mild heat exhaustion! But all of that was my bad -- it was still very beautiful, especially in the creekbed. Unsurprisingly the creek and waterfall were completely dry.', 'This trail is good around Springs time!', 'Poison oak, bugs, snakes, mountain lion, rope climbing, rock climbing, and a great view of you get to the top.', "Here's the thing about this trail, I would save it for the winter months and I'm pretty sure it would be 100% worth it then. The trail is kinda hidden! Don't go to the right go straight behind the lip (this will make sense when you get there I promise) The waterfall is 100% dry, surprise surprise. The poison oak is very over grown, long pants and long socks are a must, long sleeve recommended! And the worst part was the bugs they would not let up at all! That said I strongly feel this trail will be better in the winter months, the falls will be pouring and hopefully the bugs will chill out.", "Been awhile since I've been out there. We took a trail to the right, right before the steps & came across a deer carcass! We backed out quickly & quietly & found the right trail. Definitely felt presence, tho only saw 1 other person out there. Feels very remote :) Don't know why it's rated as difficult? Maybe we were having too much fun to realize!lol", "It's was decent just gotta watch out for a lot of poison oak so definitely not kid friendly.", "Good hike be careful after you cross the stones across the stagnant water, don't go right leads you to a tons of trees that have fallen go straight... Path is kind of hidden. Nice trailer keep a look out for runners, couple jumped out of no where lol", "This was a great hike. I went right after two days of light rain. While the waterfall wasn't rushing, there were many newts in the pools to watch. When we reached the end, my friend and I climbed the rope up over the falls, which was scary and not something I would recommend. We didn't want to go down the same way, so we continued to climb all the way up to the top, then followed a path down the cliffside to where the sign was. On the way back, we had extra time so we took a detour to the west to a great viewpoint.", "This trail has a fork in it about a mile in; one leads to the pass and eagle rock, the other to the waterfall. The hike to eagle rock is mostly uphill and in lots of direct sun. The hike to the waterfall is pretty, shaded, and fairly flat. However, the path is unmaintained, narrow, and has tons of poison oak that is tough to avoid. The last .25 mile to the waterfall you hike up the stream-bed, so it's not a designated path and you have some minor bouldering. Once there, I was a little disappointed to find the it was more of a puddle with some water dripping into it; not much of a waterfall. Pretty little canyon though, I pitched my one-man tent and stayed the night then hiked out next day. Certainly enjoyed myself, but it's no Trinity Alps or Yosemite (logically, since so cal doesn't have much like that)", 'Lots of poison oak once you get into the canyon. Have fun on the hike back up!', "Waterfall trail is moderately difficult when wet.  There were several Taricha torosa (California newt) in the pool at the base of the waterfall and a great horned owl flew right over head halfway down the trail.  Great wildlife spotting trail, and shaded throughout.  Wouldn't recommend doing the Eagle Rock trail on a hot day, due to the lack of shade, but the waterfall trail is a must at any time of year.", 'Easy, fun to explore. Close to home! ', 'no waterfall at this time, nice sightseeing at the peak', 'That would be 2014!', 'New Years Day 2024.  We hiked at 10:00 am to cool temps and dry conditions. Just a trickle in the stream and falls, but 2 families of deer and lots of birds made it a beautiful hike. Met a few groups on our way out. No one on the way in. Heading back after the first big rains.', 'Nice, heavily shaded walk through the canyons to the waterfalls.  You have the option to climb higher to get better views. The rocks are ideal for climbing. Not a lot of people on the trail, a lot of fun.', "My favorite hiking place because of the steep climb and it's a connector for countless variations of other trails.  This can be a 2.6 mile hike/trail run or a 20 mile hike/trail run and it's challenging, beautiful and close to home and the city.  Love love love!", 'So much fun. Longer than 2.6 miles.', 'Went here summer time and started from topanga state park trailhead. It was downhill all the way going to the falls. We never got to see it because there were huge rocks that is impossible to get over unless you happen to be a rock climber, but it was at the very end and we were still able to log 2.3mi hike one way, the way back to the trailhead was a killer because it was uphill all the way and some were steep. We had to rest a lot on the way back, but note that we are not seasoned hikers. It was a good workout though. Try to start early. And yes the poison oak highway is real, try to wear long pants to be safe. And the half end of the trail is very much NOT maintained. Thats one od the downside of this trail. ', "recently went and was dissapoonted the rope had been cut. apparently there was an accident a few months ago and are no longer allowed to climb. other than that it was a fun hike as I remembered it, one issue is if you plan on doing it during the week don't be afraid of how empty it is. I took my friend and she was scared after we bumped into a hiker with a stick and a rock. apparently he'd gotten lost from his group and had gone the wrong way bumping into a sign on bobcats from here on. needless to say a sight like that in an up to then empty trail did not help. other than that it was amazing with all the wild life in the water. we spent at least 45 minutes looking at tadpoles.", "if you want to see a waterfall don't go during the summer. The views and trails were okay..", 'Is nice trail but the waterfalls is dry. But we enjoy the rocks and enjoy all the trail ', 'Not really sure how this got a Black Diamond Rating. I hike each weekend, but I'm definitly not in amazing shape. This thing was cake... Got to the "waterfall" area and was just left craving more. With that being said.. it was a cool hike, a lot of variety in plant life along the trail, saw a bunch of Salamanders and Frogs toward the end. The final section of the canyon before the waterfall is really awesome with the steep walls, and when you get to the end, the rope you can climb to get above the "falls" really wasnt too bad, our whole group made it up without an issue. We didn't park our cars at the actual state park lot, but instead went a little further, made a left into a neighborhood and parked on the street for free. From there, the trail was prettty clearly marked. Maybe that cuts out the difficult part of the trail, not really sure. All in all, a good hike. Fun. Short. and the rocks at the end gave just enough of a challenge to make it fun.', 'I visited here today with my boyfriend for the first time and loved it! It is a truly beautiful hike with sections that are all completely different. Its about 5 miles roundtrip (out and back) and could be difficult on a hot day. 

We started out around 1:30pm on an overcast and misty day and there were beautiful low clouds hanging at the tops of the mountains the whole time. Unfortunately parking is $10 or you can walk a little further and park in the neighborhood outside the lot. Bathrooms in the parking lot are spotless, smell-less, and fully stocked! Woohoo!

At the far end of the parking lot, there is a sign that you can follow to various trails between 2 and 8 miles. We took the trail to the Waterfall. Its a well maintained trail up until the final fork about a mile and a half in. Anyways, the trail, curves through the park surrounded by fields full of adorable prairie dogs, until you are suddenly aware that you're at the top of a mountain above a beautifui lush valley. As you  make your way down, there is a "Lion King" rock that is easily climable to feel like you're "on top of the world!" Sorry, I'm a quoter. :)  The trail goes down across the peaks of the hills until you enter the forest.

The forest is full of gorgeous plants and flowers and we even found a cave that we climbed into.  We were able to see a few deer, plenty of different birds including blue jays and hawks, and a couple bunnies. You'll come to a fork that will point you towards the waterfall. 

From here on out the trail is a bit rough. You have to cross the dry (this time of year, not sure normally) river bed quite a few times and then the walls come in tighter and your final sign will say "Waterfall". Here you have some bigger rocks to climb over and a couple feel of water in pools of the small stream. It wasn't too difficult. On the way back, I did slip and got wet to my waist, but it wasn't too cold and turned out to be fun. This whole area was littered with cute little orange salamanders. 

The waterfall is small, but there is a beautiful grotto underneath it and a large rock to the left has a rope with knots that someone has attached to it. I went up first, but didn't have enough grip on my shoes. My boyfriend made it up just fine. 

This trail is super easy until you exit the forest on the way back and realize that since you came down a mountain, you have to go back up. I personally love a hike that is also a workout so it was perfect. Not hard by any means but it does get your heart pumping! The whole trip took just under 3 hours but we took our time on the way down taking plenty of pictures. Definitely coming back here! 
', 'This is a great hike and a pretty good workout. The only downside was all of the poison oak. There is a TON and it is thick!', 'It must take a monsoon for the falls to flow at a good clip because I have been here at least a half a dozen times in the past few years and have only seen it trickle.  Still the hike to the falls is a fun adventure and be prepared to get your shoes wet.  If you really want to extend your hike you can go to Trippet Ranch or Eagle Rock under a canopy of trees while your down in the canyon.  5.9 out of ten.', 'Went in January. Not recommended as the creek is dry and path rather bleak. Well groomed, though. Probably great in spring or even the heat of summer. ', "Fun adventure hike. Trails are well maintained even though the sign that directs you towards the waterfall says trails are not maintained. Other than a few overgrown brush and one fallen tree, you won't get lost. Did not see or rubbed any poison oak. Lots of deer sightings in the early morning. The scrambling near the waterfall can be tricky when your shoes are wet and they will most likely get wet. Unfortunately for us, there was no waterfall, only a small trickle if I can even call it that. Overall, great hike", "Not particularly strenuous but good for adventurous beginners. Well worth it as the scenery was beautiful, particularly smooth curvy sandstone walls near the 'leaky tapfall'. Agree with the comments about 'poison oak highway', especially if following overgrown parts of the dried rocky stream bed. Best to wear long hiking pants and lightweight long-sleeved shirt to avoid any accidental brushes with pre-rash triple threat. All in all, a great day out with random sightings of snake, deer, and delightfully abrupt changes in landscape.    ", 'This hike is not nearly as strenuous as All Trails makes it. The inclines are not terribly daunting, and to get to the waterfall from the trailhead takes less than 2 hours. That being said, there are great surprises along the way. Caves, tree climbing, and rock climbing can all be done just off the trail. It was 2 guys and 2 girls and we all were able to enjoy all aspects. Its close to LA which is convenient as well!', "This trail is really beautiful. I think you can see its popularity just by seeing the number of pictures uploaded.

GOOD

1 star for trails well maintained
1 star for scenery 
1 star for avery good workout
1 star for parking (coming from sunset blvd; you got lot of parking)
1 star for the beautiful view

BAD

Lots of poison oak

OVERALL

I have been meaning to do this place for a long time and I'm glad I finally did.

There are 2 entrances to this hike. The first one is the Topanga canyon entrance (which is the one listed on this website). The second entrance is located on Palisade DR, close to sunset blvd, which is the one I came from.

Start the trail and walk for a bit until a fork. On my right the waterfall with a sign that says unmaintained trail. Regardless of the sign, the trail is in pretty good condition, there are just a couple of places where the trail is a bit overrun by nature but nothing major. 
In order to reach the waterfall, I had to do a little bit of rock climbing towards the end. the  fall was dried up probably cause it's still summer nevertheless finding myself between those rocks still remained very beautiful.

I double back to the fork and this time took the direction towards Topanga Canyon the real start. I had to walk a good chunk in the canyon providing a lot of shade.  I finally arrived to the going up part... At the very beginning of it, when you get to the top, the mountain has a dome shape with a Mayan style carving on the rock. At this exact location, I saw a few blue birds. Probably some Bluejays. I have never seen such birds before and I saw them on both ways. So make sure you stop and look around their nest is somewhere near. Anyway starting from the dome the trail really goes up big time. A kick ass steep trail which I thought took me forever to do.  When I arrived to the top there is a fire road which goes down to the ranch. Off the fire road there are a few other trails that starts. I did not go all the way down cause it was late and I still had to turn around and walk back. The walk back going down was a piece of cake. 

Overall, I really enjoyed myself. It was a good and challenging hike with an amazing scenery throughout the trail. I saw a lot of poison oak but as far as I know I must not have touched any since I have no symptoms.

Bring lots of water, sunscreen and hats, and don't forget to stop for a couple of minutes to just enjoy your surroundings. ", 'Rather easy trail, especially if you take the right fork on the path to the (cough, cough) waterfall.  But we forewarned, it is "poison oak highway."  Gentle path the entire way. We've done the hike in the spring when a small trickle of water flowed down the little creek but today, at the beginning of August, it was bone dry.  Not overly hot, but definitely don't bundle the clothing, though long pants are in order.

A good beginner hike!', 'On this past Thursday, my Hiking partner & I,  went to the Santa Ynez Falls, this time of year, was more of a Trickle LOL. The Creek beds were dry, the Falls only a trickle. 
But WOW, the Walk along into the park was Beautiful, lush Green, peaceful, a real forest feeling. We heard Owls in the Trees :-) it was pretty cool. As we went along the Santa Ynez trail, we took a sharp Right and went UP hill for a while, it was so green & the day was very warm. 

Coming off the trail, we took  another Right & went UP the fire road to the Eagle Rock. Now that was so Cool!!!

I climbed up the Boulders face and found a few Caves.
I sat inside one cave having my lunch, a P&J, looking outside to the mountains in front of me, feeling very happy above it all. As I finished my lunch, I thought Id explore around some, and went down the boulders edge. I moved farther down the edge finding another much Larger cave down on that level, very nice. I slowly leaned down to go inside. Wow it was BiG in there, I laid down on my side, & just looked out & thought this would be so cool at night, being up there under the stars, having a sweet dinner.  I loved it up there, I could stay up there all daydont know about the night though, I dont want to wake up with a Mountain Loin next to me LOL!!!

We finished lunch & headed down the trail again, taking another Right & decided to Run down the Mushe trail to the Trippet Ranch??? I think thats the name, then a Natural trail back up the Santa Ynez trail, and back to our cars.

We plan to return after some Rains and see what the place looks like then, it should be really beautiful after the Creek beds are full again & the Falls are flowing.', 'Great hike! We started at the trailhead in the Palisades. Originally I thought of it more as a "wilderness walk" but once we started climbing towards Trippet Ranch and Topanga it required more exertion. It was nice to have the downhill on the way back to the car though, rather than having to finish the hike going up those hills.', "Loved this trail for the variety of environments you pass through:  meadow, rocky scrub brush, lush forest along the creek. We did it in running shoes and it was fine. I'm giving this trail a demanding rating instead of moderate for the sole reason that once you get close to the falls, there's a little bouldering that needs to be done.  Pay attention to the trail when you first cross the creek. We missed this on the way back and added a mile to our trek. Saw deer, squirrels by the boatload, lizards, and a snake. Would definitely do this again! ", "Completed it today and really enjoyed the whole hike. To get to the waterfall- that became almost a misadventure in itself. Like the sign says at the fork in the road- ROAD NOT MAINTAINED- they mean it-!! Me along with some other hikers ended up going the wrong way until a fellow-hiker turned us back the other way. Ended up crossing a lot of streams and did some rock climbing to get to the waterfall. Unlike some of the reviews I read, the timing was good since there was a good amount of water flowing down. Not too sure if others before got to do this, but there is a rope with knots that's secured tightly to a rock above so you can rappel yourself above the waterfall and onto somewhat of another trail. Heading back up the trail was a bit strenuous. Recommend hiking boots for this one. ", 'Trail is nice but each hiker can make it more strenuous around the "waterfall" however this is not exactly a great waterfall. However this hike would be impossible to complete without getting wet if the waterfall was full and running l. Great hike seriously recommend going with hiking boots instead of trainers. The trail it self can get a bit confusing with as many forks as you can take but we eventually got there with a straight up hill climb near the end on the sides of the water fall. Overall good hike! ', "Hey it was a fun time. Don't pay to park, just park on the street. We saw lots of deer and even a hawk on the ground eating its prey. The waterfall was just a trickle but still a super fun hike!", "I went to this trail in the summer of 2011. I enjoyed this trail and it is a workout! I was huffing and puffing and my 10 year old was having a tantrum! I wasn't able to finish it because as soon as we got to the shade, we realized we were surrounded by poison oak. My lovely husband fell victim to this at Temescal Canyon so we had to immediately turn back. I wish I could have finished it. Maybe another time.....", 'A fairly easy trail...tho many trails branch off & can lead you in circles in search of the waterfalls, if you are not careful. Follow the water.  Many lil caves & presence of much wildlife.  Climbing the huge rocks at the waterfalls is a bit difficult...ropes are in place to help.', "- It is nice hiking place- I can't be water fall because too much rough- when switch back make me pant but good for me- There is so  peaceful hiking place at beginning point, lot of deer", "It was late July and only a light stream and trickling waterfall was to be found.  But it was my birthday and my boyfriend and I had a picnic down there anyway, so it was cool!  I didn't wear my hiking boots for some reason and on the way down I really needed them. My toes kept pushing  the front of my sneakers further and my toes became sore. However that was the easy part, making our way back up was comical in hindsight, yes only in hindsight!  We somehow took a wrong direction (his fault really), so this made our way back to Trippet Ranch oh say 2-3 miles longer.  Which honestly wasn't so bad, but when coupled with making our way back up the mountain, it was kinda difficult and I had blisters to prove it. So glad it was pretty minus the poison oak. But we made it!  Even though I couldn't talk at times because I needed my breath to continue and he was rambling on about his needing water too, lol.

But get this, I loved it!  I would do it again. I know he would too.", 'this was well.... for me a good hike, not so much for my girlfriend, we  Started out hike at Topanga SP...from the parking lot we took Eagle Springs fire road to Santa Ynes Trail ( or as some of the signs just say Water fall Trail) lol... We took our time hiking down into the canyon along the way we found some cool caves along with some random carvings on the sand stone in places, most look to be newer but, still cool none the less, we started our trip up the stream bed only for the sun to start setting on us...(We never made it to the falls). on our way back up the canyon we saw some deer, a snake, And a Glowing worms......All in all it was a nice hike, Bring extra water this time of year I made it back with about a half a cup......', "My family and I hiked this trail today as practice for the PCT. I personally liked it. My husband and daughter, not so much. There was a lot of poison sumac, ivy and my husband decided to turn back. We never made it to the waterfall. I felt it was a nice hike. Folks were friendly and it wasn't too busy. Parking was $10 but later we realized we could park on the residential streets. Overall, I had a great time and I would recommend it to all.", 'Cool trial, kinda rough at times. Some overgrown vegetation. Lots of sage was in bloom in the beginning.  Saw lots of woodlin critters, a king snake, lots of lizards, even two deer! What a great day!', 'Pretty hike with nice views of the canyon. The path is not maintained after the 2nd "Waterfall" sign but the trail keeps going on the left side of the river; easiest way to find it is to follow the water. Water fall is nice, even if it is a little small. A little ways before it is a trail on the right (when heading back) that continues to the top of the mountain, definitely recommend it!. ', 'Did the hike today... It was nice but in no rush to do it over.. ', "I went there today from the Trippet Ranch entrance. The river bed was all dried up even though it's been raining for a week. However, I saw lots of wildlife and really enjoyed the downhill stroll to the canyon, there were some neat looking caves that I didn't get a chance to explore-- Climbing back up was challenging. Total time: 129 minutes for 4.4 miles. ", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

hike_name:
Chiquito Trail to Chiquito Falls - California
 | AllTrails
hike_tags: ['dogs on leash', 'backpacking', 'birding', 'hiking', 'horseback riding', 'mountain biking', 'nature trips', 'trail running', 'walking', 'forest', 'river', 'views', 'waterfall', 'wild flowers', 'wildlife', 'bugs', 'rocky']
hike_description: Chiquito Trail to Chiquito Falls is a 9.1 mile moderately trafficked loop trail located near Lake Elsinore, California that features a waterfall and is rated as moderate. The trail offers a number of activity options and is accessible year-round. Dogs are also able to use this trail but must be kept on leash.
